Reviews.Title: “Great for families of all ages and activities and, as always, the amazing Fairmont service!”
Reviews.Author: mtontheroad
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a mixed-age family get together. The service was wonderful. We especially appreciated that as this resort covers a large area the choice of handy golfcarts, hop-on, hop-off bicycles or walking is available for transportation. Playa del Carmen is close should one wish to actually leave the resort. Don't miss one of the interesting and informative boat trips along the lagoons and canals of the Mayakoba.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great pools”
Reviews.Author: haleyalex101
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for spring break. It is a very fun place. The hotel rooms are clean and they have nice views. (at least from where we were!) The property overall is very nice. The one thing I disliked was the restaurants. For example Laguna, the breakfast place (which also serves dinner and lunch), has a very good buffet, but it is a long wait to get a table. We also went their for dinner and lunch. Lunch was very good and fast, but dinner was the opposite. We got our table and there were apparently not enough menus so we had to wait to get those. then out food took a very long time and we could not get our check. This may sound negative, but that was just our experience, staff over the hotel are very kind.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful facility”
Reviews.Author: Mike T
Reviews.Content: Like most upscale Mexican resorts the landscaping is exceptional. The reception area is open and ample staff is there to greet you and expedite the check-in process. The rooms are very nice and spacious. Internet access is available. The restaurants are convenient from the trams that move everyone around the resort property on a regular basis. We did not play golf but the course looked terrific. There are several pools for all ages as well as plenty of lounge chairs. After my stay, I arranged for my daughter's honeymoon here and they had a terrific time too.

Reviews.Title: “REAL 5 stars hotel !!!!”
Reviews.Author: montrealjp
Reviews.Content: Evrything is perfect at that hotel from the lobby aéra to the beach aéra. The only négative point is the beach in front of the hotel, the water is not turquoise and the sand in not really clean, alot of algue. But if you walk 10 min the beach is nicer. Wevisit the Roosewood hotel Next door and Fairmont look better. All the little details are taking care. If you are looking for a busy place don t come here, the clientele here a peoples with alot of travel experience and professionnel peoples.

Reviews.Title: “This place is heaven!”
Reviews.Author: L T
Reviews.Content: Came here with my boyfriend for a wedding. This place is beautiful. Wish I can live here! Staff is super friendly. Will definately come back again soon!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful quiet luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: creep1974
Reviews.Content: This property is huge and very differnet with the rivers and jungle on site. I would recommend this for families, rich golfers, and couples looking only to relax. It is very nice the service is top of the line, the food was great, and it is very expensive, off the charts expensive by Mex satndards. I was here for 2 nights, 3 days and that was perfect. If you have unlimited budget you will love this place. El puerto was very good, dinner next door at banyan tree was incredible - that place has to be a 5.5 star property. Anyway my take on this place is that it is expensive, kinda boring for a mid 30's couple BUT the food, the service and the scenery is awesome..it just depends on what you are looking for. I cant see anyone not liking this place..its just a matter of what you want to do and spend. also the pool waiter was the best, we had same guy every day and he even got my key delivered when my room was not ready upon check in, and brought my little cooler to my villa when I left it at the pool. GILDARDO I. was his name, you are in good hands if you get him.

Reviews.Title: “Serene and refined luxury coexisting with nature.”
Reviews.Author: bevvy22
Reviews.Content: Full disclosure--a relative in management invited us here for a very special couple of days on our recent trip to the Yucatan. So the front desk people, our wonderful "butler" Oliver, and the equally awesome driver who picked us up knew who we were, and treated us like royalty. The rest of the 700+ staff didn't, though, yet we found all who we encountered--from cart drivers to waiters to spa folks--to be not just smiling and engaged with us, but also happily engaged with their jobs. Many have been there since the property opened and most are genuinely proud to work in a top-of-the-line resort that also cares so deeply about environmental stewardship in a delicate region that has been trampled by rampant, questionable development. We were in a spectacular suite, one of the high end ones near the ocean, which we could see from the roof while soaking in our own private plunge pool. If I had it to do again, I'd make sure to spend more time there with all its wonderful resting spots, up top especially, but also from the long stretch of deck that overlooked one of the carefully engineered canals. It was huge, immaculate, elegantly and tastefully decorated, with incredible bathrooms (yes two!), amenities galore, and all those lovely outdoor spaces. The roof was simply the best! Meanwhile, I don't see much discussed here about WHY the Mayakoba was designed the way it was. No, it may not be particularly "Mexican" style-wise, but if you want to stay in a beautiful resort that shows off the natural environment, this is the spot. The canals follow natural underground waterways that were studied extensively before any ground was broken. The layout, with most of the resort set behind and intertwined within huge, healthy stands of mangrove, was done to minimize impact on these estuaries, something that too often happens with careless wetland destruction and overbuilding. (Note that a lot of resorts along the coast there have as many as 2000 rooms right on the ocean--this resort has a graciously planned 400, with most set back from the shore, nestled within the flora and fauna.) We were further impressed when we went on the excellent early morning canal tour and saw the abundance of healthy habitat and resulting bird populations everywhere. Fairmont Mayakoba was designed to live in harmony with its surroundings, and yes, that means a cart ride to get somewhere, or a few more mosquito bites than in other places, but I think it's worth it to be enveloped by nature like that. It's a truly serene place. Mayakoba also sources their seafood from a sustainable fishermen's cooperative in Punta Allen and even made roof shingles for most of their buildings out of recycled tires! All this was impressive to us--we love the peninsula and grieve the losses sustained by bad planning and greed. But we didn't have to feel guilty here. This is a class act all around--from a company that's been careful to preserve some of the natural resources that make the Yucatan a go-to destination in the first place. None of this would be much of a selling point if Fairmont didn't also provide excellent lodging and services. Food was very good (crab tostadas at the beach pool, mac and cheese with truffle oil in the Laguna restaurant--yum!), cart shuttles were plentiful, everything was immaculate. Love being greeted upon arrival with cold orange blossom-scented towels and delicious iced elixir too--details like this make it special. (Oh, and the spa is its own oasis that's really worth visiting.) Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible 5 Star Family or Couple Resort”
Reviews.Author: BJAJDA
Reviews.Content: Excellent resort for kids with natural beauty and attractions including nature boat ride and free bikes with paths a plenty. Mayakoba is first class and there are excellent restaurants at Fairmont as well as Rosewood and Banyan Tree. All incredibly well suited for kids with special menus, staff make 5 star dining with the family a pleasure. Fairmont website very accurate, recommend staying 600 series villas, getting second floor villas, or requesting Rooms with unobstructed views. Concierges were top notch. For local attractions HIGHLY recommend Xplor for families with kids 8 and up, it is a world class experience. Also worth renting a car and going to Coba and climbing pyramid and going to Tulum.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont at its best!”
Reviews.Author: Matthieu25
Reviews.Content: As I start all reviews, please take a look and see how many hotels I've reviewed, I'm not a jaded one time traveler. I travel often and feel I have a good base to write a good overall review. I'd also like to say I love Fairmont Hotels, I've stayed in several and do prefer them to other 5 star properties. Very simply this resort is outstanding. As longtime Premier members of the Presidents Club and having experienced many Fairmonts this very much lives up to the expectation. As for the negative reviews as I've said before look at how many hotels those people who give a negative review have rated. When someone mentions mold ect. THIS IS MEXICO! its wet, very wet. They cant do anything about it, its like saying its cold in Alaska. The hotel is LARGE. We were booked in a beach area casita suite and while being close to the beach was and the beach area pool was great, getting to breakfast in the morning sometimes required a wait for transportation. The grounds are very beautiful and kept very clean. The staff from transport drivers to reception to housekeeping all went out of their way to say hello and during our stay we were able to make it to all the restaurants twice, they always remembered our names upon return. As I said we had a beach area casita suite and it was one of the nicest appointed rooms we've stayed in while at a fairmont. When we arrived we had fresh flowers and a large fruit basket ( I believe thats because of our Presidents Club status) The room was about 1100 sq feet (living, bedroom, two large closets, two large bathrooms large veranda that spans the length of the room and a private rooftop pool and sun-deck! The since the pool was on the roof it was like bath water but it was very nice after the sun went down. Housekeeping did a great job, didn't miss a thing. The bed and linens were typical fairmont fabulous as well as the towels. We did loose our key one night, I thought to myself "oh great, we're clear on the other side of the hotel" after calling from one of the many phones around the grounds, not exaggerating we had someone willing to let us in our room within 1 minute and a replacement key within 5. How they did it? I have no idea and I really don't care I thought it was great! We were there with some dear friends who booked a Deluxe Casita and we were able to see their room and it too was great. It was basically half the size of our room but still very well appointed. All the restaurants are OUTSTANDING 5 star all the way! I'm a picky eater and didn't have an issue finding something tasty. The deserts were to die for :-). We did the breakfast buffet every morning and it was very good. Eggs, bacon & sausage was offered every morning along with mexican dishes. Fresh fruit and pastries along with made to order smoothies and omelets. Coffee and juice also included with the buffet. They also have a menu to order from, which is most likely what we would have done if the buffet wasn't included in our room rate. While the buffet was very very good I think $25/pp is stretching it, especially for Mexico. All the pools are kept in very good condition and towels and chairs are very plentiful. As I've experienced in other hotels many people believe that getting up at 5 am and reserving a chair with a shoe is an acceptable practice and then the chair sits empty for an entire day while other paying guests are unable to utilize it. This didn't seem to be tolerated here which I LOVE! All the pools have bar service and the service is VERY prompt. There is also a pool menu for lunch which was GREAT! The steak nachos a outstanding! Drinks are pricey but are inline with other 5 star hotels. Beers $5 mix drinks $10-$14. There is a store on the grounds which sells beer for $3. We had treatments at the spa. 3 of us had messages and 1 of us had a facial. All great. I've been to the Willow Stream in Scottsdale many times and based on another AT review I expected the spa to be the same. I sadly report its not. The rooftop pool was small, all the chairs were lacking the cushions which they clearly were built to have. The mens room was nice but the locker area also very small but the mens lounge was huge. The treatment room and staff very good and very much on par with other 5 star spas. I can say I went into it thinking it was going to be like Scottsdale and that following my treatment I could spend the day by the pool relaxing. This really didn't have the same feel and we left. I would still 100% recommend it for a treatment. We booked our transportation roundtrip via USA transfers it cost $80 TOTAL for a private car. Far less than what the hotel was quoting (I believe they wanted $110 each way) The transport was very clean, fast, friendly and english speaking. When we return I'll book through them again. My only areas that can be improved would be the transport in the resort. I think there should be almost a schedule that when a cart is at the beach that when its leaving another one is headed that way. On our final day we waited 30 minutes to get picked up for breakfast. Had we known it would take that long we could have very easily walked but it kind of got to the point "I've waited this long I may as wait a little longer". The other is Fairmont Fit. This is a program as a Presidents Club member, allows you to to have workout wear waiting for you in your room upon arrival. Whats great about this, is we don't need to pack the shoes shorts and shirts. For two adults athletic shoes take up a great deal of space. When we arrived to our room we had the shoes and shirts but no shorts. (please keep in mind I had this part of our reservation for over 2 months as did our friends) During our entire stay they never had any shorts! NONE! We made many calls but finally gave up. This was unfortunate because I had Khaki shorts and swimsuits none of which I could do my morning run in. While this doesn't spoil my view of Fairmont Mayakoba. I would have expected this issue resolved at some point during our week stay and had I known they wouldn't be able to accommodate our request I would have packed my own shorts. We did a day trip into Playa del Carmen, I didn't find it "charming" or "cute" at all. I found it very commercial and kind of dirty. There was 4 of us and we were offered drugs and Prostitutes several times and Cuban cigars about 100 times. While walking down 5th ave, people just scream at you to come look at their stuff. We counted about 20 Sunglass Huts and 15 watch stores. At one point we needed sunscreen and a very small bottle that would go for about $3 at Target was selling for $17.50USD. (OUTRAGEOUS) we were there durning the afternoon I can't imagine what its like at night. Had I known it was going to be like that, I could have passed on the experience. Overall will I return to this hotel? YES 100%! Actually we will be booking a stay in November this week. Overall tips. I would stop and get alcohol in town or through duty free. While our room was great, a room in the middle of the resort is more convenient and we rarely used the beach and beach pool because of the wind. The hotel is kid friendly, but they weren't everywhere (which no having kids, we liked). Our friends had the All Inclusive option for their stay and for them it was great, for us we still ordered what we were hungry for and drank what we wanted at the bar and saved $600 if we'd booked the AI option. (plus we didn't gain 15lbs) We didn't have any issues with bugs ( I live in the midwest and I know bugs) The dress code is very relaxed at the restaurants. When you get to this level of hotel most know how to dress to dinner. (men are fine in shorts and sandals) In the end you'll have an outstanding time! Happy Travels! Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “amazing vacations”
Reviews.Author: MPadoin
Reviews.Content: I would like to talk about this great escape, well done, beatuful constructions, nice service, good beach, excellent food. El Puerto restaurant is great, the meat and fish really good; Las Brisas with good mexican food; very nice to walk in middle of nature or take a bike; I did with my son and It was great amazing; the room is very chic, clean, excellent bad. wonderful to go with kids or not because is so big.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and nature in one place”
Reviews.Author: afreller
Reviews.Content: A special place far from turists in the midle of the nature. Impecable service and food. You must try the octopus carpacio at the beach night restaurant. The SPA is a must go, I love sauna and the one there is fantasic.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Resorts in Mexico!!!”
Reviews.Author: willamettephoto
Reviews.Content: Amazing, luxurious, top service. amazing food, top service!!! The navigable lagoons are simply amazing and will lead you to the beach!!! Las Brisas Restaurant is simply unbelievable in terms of food quality and service!! We took our kids and they had an awesome time in the swimming pools. We really enjoyed the trails around the resort with all the tropical jungle noises and birds. There is a reason why a lot of Mexican celebrities select Mayakoba for their weddings !!!

Reviews.Title: “4th time a charm.....”
Reviews.Author: J2PTRAVELER
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our annivesary at the Faimont Mayakoba last month. This was our fourth visit and it was wonderful. The staff went out of their way to help us celibrate. Everything from flowers in our room to special desserts. I must mention the tremendous service we received from Frida and Wilbert in the Laguna Restaurant they were the like extended family. We had a fantastic visit and will return again. Must note that it always takes an hour or so to check to our room, this is a bit annoying. I hope management can remedy this issue.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise. Relax and unwind”
Reviews.Author: dexco
Reviews.Content: The property is beautiful and well kept. The all inclusive is a great value. Food is great, staff are fantastic. Large property but the are shuttles everywhere. Loved my stay

Reviews.Title: “Sanctuary at the Mayakoba!”
Reviews.Author: G0CanucksG0
Reviews.Content: Spent eleven wonderful days at the Fairmont Mayakoba and simply fell in love with the resort from the moment we entered the beautiful lobby...the service throughout our stay was extraordinary and the grounds of the resort are impecable...the main pool area was a wonderful place to spend the day or a short golf cart ride to the infinity pool and beach area was another great option...we travelled with our 5mnth young son and we were very impressed with the resort overall... As with all Fairmonts I have visited (this being my tenth) I find the food is overpriced and not always satisfactory...the breakfast buffet was excellent ($25 U.S. per person)...some of our meals were quite good and others just ok...I do expect excellence considering the price charged...the drinks can be expensive as well ($10 U.S. for a one ounce relatively small Margarita) so budget accordingly...one good option is to stop off on the way to the resort and pick up some Tequila to top off your drinks and a case of cold beer to put in the fridge...this was recommended by the staff when we arrived and we appreciated the ability to drink our own supply... I also don't necessarily agree with the $15 per person "Resort Fee" which covers your daily housekeeping tips and the golf cart drivers...if you're going to build a resort on 400 acres and a thirty minute walk from the beach then you should offer the golf carts "gratis" and let me look after the housekeeping tips... Overall, a wonderful resort...and a sanctuary away from home...

Reviews.Title: “Worth the visit”
Reviews.Author: gdl_traveler1
Reviews.Content: Now that the Mandarin Oriental is closed, the Fairmont is an excellent choice to an upscale hotel in Playa del Carmen. Yes it may be expensive, but the place really worth the visit. Excellent attention and service. Different types of rooms, if possible, try to book the ones besides the canals, after all no just jungle will be in front of the window. The plates at the breakfast buffet changes every day. The restaurant at in front of the beach is also great, expensive too. Don´t forget to visit the ruins of Tulum, Quinta Avenida in Playa del Carmen and if you have time go snorkeling around the beaches..

Reviews.Title: “First Class - Great Stay at Mayakoba Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: Equipped3H
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Fairmont Mayakoba for 5 days. Great decorations, great rooms, good food, flawless landscaping. The best housekeeping I've ever encountered - they even folded my dirty clothes! Spacious stand up showers. Great AC and heating. Huge pool and other small pools throughout the resort. The beach area is large and full of chairs and cabanas. Top notch all around. My only complaints were the high prices of the spa and lack of late night lounge areas.

Reviews.Title: “Good!”
Reviews.Author: Weltreisender_ba
Reviews.Content: It is such a nice hotel in the Riviera we enjoy 5 days of total rellaxation and getting to know the most famous places around the area, we just were too sad that we didnt have the best weather and in the hotel there are not activities when the weather is like this but we enjoyed it anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont at its Best”
Reviews.Author: Hunterboeuf
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Fairmont Mayakoba for a week in February. The stay was part meetings and part pure vacation. This resort is outstanding. The grounds are huge. They provide golfcart transportation, which comes in handy when you want to get to the beach or back to your room. There are also BMW bicycles that may be picked up and dropped off whenever and wherever you like. It is about a 5-minute ride to the beach. I would recommend riding all over the resort, including along the sides of the fairways of the golfcourse, perhaps later in the day when there are not many golfers on the course. It is a beautiful property, with lots of water and you are sure to see numerous birds and iguana - we also went up close to a crocodile and we also saw several cute cat-like rodents called guati. I would also strongly recommend taking the half-hour boat ride around the resort. You are in for some pleasant surprises, especially if you like seeing a variety of large birds. We ate at two of the main restaurants - La Laguna and Las Brisas - and were very very pleased with the service and the quality of the food. You can also pick up a lighter breakfast and excellent coffee at the coffee-shop besdie La Laguna. The only disappointment was that on February 14 - Valentine's day - for some unknown reason, La Laguna was closed for dinner, without any notification. That made it difficult to find a place to eat, given that this is an all-inclusive-type resort. That evening we ended up trying the Mexican restaurant on the adjacent Rosewood resort, called La Punta Bonita. This is well worth it. The food was unlike any other Mexican food we had eaten before. The hotel will drive you there in a golfcart, or it is an easy walk north along the beach. We walked back after dinner. The set dinner for two is recommended - go there on an empty stomach, because it is a lot of food. There are several pools on the resort, all with plentiful lounge chairs and towels. One of the pools has a built-in bar, with stools in the water. We recommend their margaritas and their signature drink, the Mojito. As far as rooms are concerned, we stayed in a casita - highly recommended, over a room in the main hotel building. If you can, stay in a second-floor casita. The ground floor rooms look onto swampy ground; the second floor rooms give you more breathing space and a more pleasant balcony experience. The rooms are very large, with bathrooms the size of most hotel rooms in the typical North American hotel. The rooms have wi-fi and it is free for Presdient's Club members. The reception was always fast. The swimming in the ocean is great, but there is no coral reef there. I swam out and saw some fish-life (and found a couple of golf balls). If you want some good snorkelling or scuba, you will have to go off-site. All of the staff are very friendly and go out of their way to help you, without being intrusive.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chicagodude07
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Fairmont Mayakoba. As somebody who travels the world and is VERY discerning when it comes to hotels, that alone should say something. Last trip was Dec, '08 and I had such good memories that, when looking for a place to just relax and do NOTHING, this was my first pick. Before reading too far, let me respond to the consistent comments on the distance to the beach and around the property and the need to "walk". People! - have you become so lazy that you can't walk a beautiful path through Mexico to get to a beautiful beach!? First, there are bicycles EVERYWHERE that you could ride and if you're unable or unwilling to ride or walk, there are golf carts CONSTANTLY making the trip and there JUST for you! If this is why you rate this property lower, well, that's YOUR problem and you're probably overweight. I've become a fan of the Fairmont properties and the unique blend of local vibe coupled with generally great service. So, in quick summary; ROOM & PROPERTY: Room was a canal-side casita (recommend top floor if possible). Apparently I was upgraded to a different "view" because of my AmEx payment. Not sure, however, if the room itself was any different from other casitas but I did have a view of the canal and could hear the swimming pool on the other side of the shrubs. Again, guessing that ground floor rooms are not quite as comfortable. The bathroom was huge, the bed comfortable and the internet pretty reliable. There was always, also, plenty of bottled water provided. A casita by the beach would have been great too but then you'd be at that side of the property - away from the main structures. The gym/spa is large and well-stocked. As others note, highly recommend joining the Fairmont's President's Club for free gym access and wifi. Would love it if there were a few more standard English-language television channels but honestly I spent most of my time in the room just on the patio watching nature - seems that many folks do. One minor incident, however - during the trip, we had a pretty solid rainstorm one evening and I woke to find that there was a minor flood coming from the ceiling through the closet door and pooling in the bathroom. Upon calling housekeeping, they not only came to inspect immediately but then provided piles of towels to prevent it from continuing. It was a one-off but I can only hope that after I checked out they actually REPAIRED the problem so it didn't happen again. These things happen (and they responded accordingly) but wouldn't want to have been there for another week with this potential problem. I would say that there are a few water features (fountains) at the main swimming pool that need repair. Nothing major but, if not repaired, it may begin to be noticeable that the pool is getting a little beat-up. Pieces of tile here and there that is broken and a couple of dried-up fountains. FOOD: My room included the full breakfast buffett which was AWESOME - higly recommend getting a rate that does so. Was always able to get a table and the food is VERY good and exhaustive. As for other meals, lunch down by the ocean was alwasy solid with great service, poolside ordering was equally good (and quick). Of course, as mentioned elsewhere, meals can get to be a bit pricey and that was frustrating. Hard to get a drink under $10. I'm also happy to say that I ate raw vegetables and salads with no trouble (they clean things properly - no Montezuma's revenge!). There IS a small market that sells drinks, beer, wine etc. at a lower price but you can't get a margarita there. I guess that's the challenge of a resort. One frustration in this vein is that the market was initially stocked with sandwhiches and snacks but after a couple days, the stock was gone and one had NO choice but to spend $25-$30 on a meal. PLEASE try to keep some options in the market. Restaurants are great but with no ability to go off-resort, provide your guests some more options from the market. SERVICE: From the arrival at the lobby to the housekeeping staff to the waiters, hostesses and beach staff, EVERYONE was well-trained and very friendly - kudos. One minor complaint - I ordered room service a lot and, upon concluding dinner one night, set my tray outside my room and called for them to pick it up. Unfortunately, nobody did so and I was awakened later to two animals knocking over plates and trays and making a lot of noise. I called and asked that somebody please come get the tray and, again, nobody arrived. After the second call, somebody finally came and, in the morning, the area was clear. Shouldn't have taken this many calls but... OVERALL Given the ease of getting to and from the hotel, the service, quiet vibe, nice pool and pretty beach, this is definitely the place for you if you want a destination where there is NOTHING to do. If you're looking for a place with action, entertainment and music, this is NOT the place for you. It is truly a peaceful, quiet and beautiful property where one could easily go the whole day without doing too much talking or moving.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, quiet, and beautiful.”
Reviews.Author: Nlee79
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Myakoba and had a wonderful time. Our room was a peaceful casita on the canal. It was spacious, clean, and extremely well-maintained. Getting around the property can be tricky at first but you het the hang of it. If you can find a bike, take advantage of it. We tried all three resteraunts, very expensive, but the food was wonderful and worth it. It does take extra time so be prepared. Try to snag your beach chairs in the morning If you want shade and you might want to grab your drink before you walk down because it may take them a little while to get to you. Overall the staff was extremely friendly and we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Food and Service”
Reviews.Author: John L
Reviews.Content: WOW . . . the staff at the Fairmont give the Ritz a run for their money in the guest services department. From the valet, to the desk clerks, maintenance and housekeeping, restaurant and bar servers to the pool attendants. . . all are trained with the guest top of mind. Their expertise in their areas is top notch, the training they have recieved first rate and their knowledge impressive. The rooms are very comfortable, well appointed, cleaned and organized several times through out the day. We stayed in their "Fairmont Room" which is just their typical accomodation . . . but not at all disappointed. Peso for peso . . . great value for your money!! Black tie lodging at blue jean prices!! John

Reviews.Title: “Simply wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: Hoony
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, friendly resort in Playa Del Carmen. Has everything you need in the resort, including some great vegetarian meals, abundance of pools and relaxation areas, and lovely spa. Buggies help you get around and to the beach, or take one of the complimentary bikes!! Fantastic margaritas and the friendliest staff I have ever met. Will be going back!! Tip: ask for a lagoon facing room & be careful using the phone, can get pricey!

Reviews.Title: “A great alternative to Cancun.”
Reviews.Author: Moustacio D
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to the "Mayan Riveria" and stay at the Mayakoba Fairmont. As expected, this is a five star facility and it lives up to its name. My wife and I especially liked the rooms with their privacy and the open shower. Took some getting use to at first but loved the natural light. The breakfast was incredible with a lot of variety. What really got us was the guacamole. The best I have ever had and we ordered it every day. The beach was very nice and windy. I liked the wind while my wife did not care for it as much. The pools are incredible and seem to be all over the resort. Since my wife and I are not really big partiers, I liked staying here versus being in Cancun.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: snide-remarks
Reviews.Content: Went with a family member. First time to this side of Mexico. Mayakoba is a great secluded beach area with extensive mangroves viewable by water taxi at the property. The property is well spread out, and if you go to the beach it is much better to take a cart or one of the bikes to get there. The food was very good, but not quite deserving of a 5 star rating, and I did try all the restaurants during my one week stay. Pools were excellent and never very busy. Concierge services were great. Wish there was a bit more wi-fi, as I could only get it at a few buildings. Beaches were lovely on property. Sea level has risen somewhat, so the strip of beach is pretty narrow, but wasn't a problem during the low season. I saw a ray in the water about 30 meters out with my snorkeling gear on! Easy trip into playa and easy to catch the ferry to cozumel. Wonderful trip and great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Mexico at its best! Rivera Maya as a perfect experience!”
Reviews.Author: schnuckel2502
Reviews.Content: You can see it: This high end luxury resort was only built in 2006 and is nesteled in the natural canals and creeks of the mangrove jungle on a huge property. Rooms are spacious and the bathrooms amazing. The service is impaccable - like any Fairmont I have visited so far. The beach is incredible especially because it is far away and even separated from other Rivera Maya hotels... Special tip for those on a honeymoon (or any special occasion): Do the "Moon Dance Dinner" on the beach: A table surrounded by torch lights, beautifully decorated and a multiple course dinner... Noone else but you on the beach (and the service staff...). This one week of vacation will truly be unforgettable for us...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, amazing ammenities!”
Reviews.Author: emily m
Reviews.Content: The beauty of this hotel is amazing, the location and design of the facilities are breathtaking, and the design comliments its' natural surroundings. The beach and pool areas are beautiful, there is a waterslide at the kid's pool, the service is outstanding, and the casita rooms are like a small house! The resort was wonderful, the boat tour is awesome, and it is only 15 minutes from Playa Del Carmen. The restaurants looked good, but were a bit pricey, and since we were on a non- all- inclusive plan, my family ate in Playa instead of the resort. Overall, this is an amazing place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Superior service”
Reviews.Author: Tekko1975
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Fairmont Mayakoba, I haven't left yet and I cannot wait to return. I am writing this review from the deck of my Casita suite overlooking the canal and golf course. An osprey eagle is hovering overhead, sheer tranquility. The room is spotless and the bed covered in fresh rose pettles. Every step of the way, employees ensure that your experience at the hotels flawless. From helping me find my lost phone charger to driving us to the tennis court, the experience has been excellent. The food at each restaurant is outstanding, my tuna steak was to die for. Make sure you make reservations as we did have to change choices one evening. I have read complaints about waiting for the carts or availability of bikes. I never had to wait more than two minutes for a ride and bikes were readily available. Walking was also a wonderful options as the temperature was ideal and the surroundings breathtaking. If you are lazy, out of shape, physically chanllenged or in a rush while on holiday, perhaps this is not the best resort for you. For the rest of us.....it is paradise. Make sure you are a President's Club Member to get free Internet that even worked on the beach. Thank you for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay!”
Reviews.Author: honestreviewer07646
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Mayakoba Resort was absolutely amazing! We travelled with our 3 kids and had a great time. Property was beautiful. Rooms were perfect, clean and large. We had a suite which had 2 bathrooms, a bedroom and a living room area. It was very large and I highly recommend it to anyone traveling with kids. Loved the glass windows in the bathroom! Felt like I was in a spa all day. Restaurants a bit overpriced. I recommend spending the money on a cab and going to Playa del Carmen. You can have a fun night out and have dinner in town and it will cost you less than the price of your meal at the hotel. Staff was unbelievable!!!! Everyone was willing to go out of their way to make sure we were happy. I've stayed at 6 star hotels all over the world, and the service here was definitely one of the best! Pool was nice. Beach was great. Spent day in Xplor, which was well worth the price! Highly recommend staying here. Will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Its Contagious... !”
Reviews.Author: WineDineDive
Reviews.Content: Playa del Carmen has a bit of something extraordinary...and it is over-the-top, extraordinary service. The restaurants, the hotels, etc. They all know they are in competition for the same guests. But what sets a hotel a part? When the guests start to behave with the great attitude that the staff has. I've never been to a hotel, anywhere in the world, where the guests reflect the attitude of the staff. The guests seem to be as eager to say "hello" and "good morning" as the staff...and that can ONLY be because from the top management down, the staff are eager to be of service and extra friendly. We had our entire bag of dive gear stolen from our trunk while in Playa del Carmen. Not only did the security people at the Fairmont help with the situation, but they drove us to the police, translated the story, and then went back two days later to the station to pick up the police report and deliver it to our room. Also, my husband had a birthday while here, and to our complete amazement, the staff decorated our room with flowers and balloons and delivered a birthday cake. Are we at a hotel? Or have we died and gone to Heaven? The rooms are amazing. And yes, the place is spread out. I overheard another guest saying "The place grows on you" when his friend was complaining about walking for 5 minutes to get to the restaurant or the pool. If you are seeking a resort where you can go down 40 floors in the elevator and walk out to the pool...this is NOT it! Here, you walk out of your beautiful room into a community of well designed buildings with 4 units each, people coming and going, and of course, the jungle. You can walk, bike or take a golf cart (which are plentiful) to your destination. The servers at the beach area amazing...flying around with food and beverage in the air ...keeping everyone happy and greet you by name after one visit. The restaurant servers are terrific. Even the drivers of the golf carts are caring people. I asked one server, German, out at the Playa restaurant if he was the manager because he was everywhere helping guests. He said "no, but I look for places to be of service." That seems to be the overall training of the servers...look for where you can be of help...and they are. There is always something that may not be the way I'd like it to be, and this case...it is the temperature in Las Lagunas restaurant. FREEZING. Who wants to eat with a jacket on? Other than that...a stellar venue. Can't even recommend one room over another. Get the room that you can afford, and you will love it.

Reviews.Title: “We are coming back again!”
Reviews.Author: SteelersToronto
Reviews.Content: We went at the end of January to beginning of February. We picked a great time as it was in between large conventions and was very peaceful and relaxing. We stayed in a Casita Suite overlooking the lagoon - great for a family as the kids stayed in the outer area on a sofa bed and had a separate bathroom. Maid Service was exceptional - even setting up the kids stuff animals every night on their sofa bed! The food was great - if you are on the all inclusive plan - make sure to eat at Las Brisas for dinner! Staff and food were amazing - we tried something different every night. The breakfast buffet at La Laguana had a great spread including different local cuisines every morning. They make smoothies, eggs and even quesadillas to order. For the healthy, there is even a separate "fit" food station. Lots of fresh fruit and different juices are available each morning (we had the buffet every morning for 4 days). A very kid friendly resort. Kids 5 and under eat free (best chicken fingers ever), the kiddie pools are heated and their is a kids program for ages 4 and over. Staff is extremely friendly and are very considerate with kids, even the golf cart drivers would remember their names when greeting them. The resort is large but there are golf carts running 24 hours a day. Most we ever waited was 5 minutes - but most of the time, a cart would be coming within a minute. There are also bikes throughout the resort which you can use to get around - however I noticed people would hog bikes and park them outside their room instead of leaving them at bike stations. Definitely our favourite family vacation. As always, thanks to the staff at the Fairmont as their service is always first class. The concierge was always quick in replying to my many emails before our arrival. We'll definitely be looking to returning again in the future

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: AS S
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers excellent and luxurious facilities as well as a well-trained and attentive staff. The place is beautifully decorated, spacious and makes you feel like you are in paradise. We arrived at noon, but our room was not ready yet, so we took a short ride with the golf cart to the beach restaurant. It offered a fantastic view over the beach and our expectations were high. However, not fulfilled whatsoever. My boyfriend had a tasteless fish and warm beer, and I had to send my veggie burger back twice just to get it in a decent state. The bill was shocking to say the least, so we decided not to repeat that mistake again. The rest of the days we ate a lot for breakfast (which offered a superb and varied selection), bought musli bars for the afternoon and went to Playa del Carmen for dinner. Leaving the hotel is clearly not something that is appreciated, and we discovered that the taxi rates to Playa are fixed at 230 pesos, which is very overpriced for Mexican standards. Other overpriced elements at the hotel was the spa, internet and gym. We stayed in a room in the building close to the reception. It was a true pleasure with everything in amenities and direct access to one of the many pools. All in all we had a great weekend in Fairmont Mayakoba and would certainly return if we can get decent rates or a good package.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: jim s
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice location, the food was great, and the staff was very nice, friendly, and helpful. If you like to be away from the craziness of Cancun, then this would be a great choice. If you like to be surrounded with more things to do, then closer to the tourist part of Cancun would be the better choice. The beach is very narrow, but it is fairly clean.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique-style hotel within a hotel near the beach”
Reviews.Author: kaykaysd
Reviews.Content: This property feels and looks vast and expansive when you first arrive. After a quick drive from the airport you enter a private gated community with a couple other hotels, and enter a large open lobby overlooking the entire jungle engulfed property bordered by the Caribbean. After many trips to Cabo and Puerto Vallarta, the verdant landscape was a refreshing change. The lengthily golf cart transportation to our room, a casita in the beach area, only reconfirmed what visually seemed like a huge property. Our room was spotless and tastefully decorated with a wrap-around deck, private rooftop pool, two huge bathrooms, and a walk-in closet. We also had a butler who was very sweet and at our beck and call. As a couple traveling, the beach area is where you want to be. It is very quiet with what seemed like a small collection of very high-end rooms and fewer families. The beach was steps away, as was our favorite dining experience of the trip, Las Brisas. The other areas are nice, but a little more action going on. Bikes are a nice way to get around, and the spa is an absolute must. We spent most of our day there arriving early to go to yoga and use the gym, and partaking in the suggested "spa ritual" consisting of steam room, aromatherapy, hydrotherapy, etc. Spend time after your treatment on the private spa deck. You can dine at other properties within Mayakoba and charge to your room which is convenient, but our most memorable excursion was to downtown Playa one night where we ate at a small Torta stand. Tulum is also worth the trip for the views alone.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, not excellent”
Reviews.Author: meanchat
Reviews.Content: We selected the Fairmont Mayakoba as we felt that it was a good valued compared to the other two properties in Mayakoba, the Rosewood and the newer Banyan Tree. We visited the Banyan Tree which is a more intimate property, but felt the room rates were unrealistic. Reading the other reviews about the Fairmont, I was not sure what to expect in terms of the lagoon views. The view is peaceful, but I prefer a more expansive view, preferably of the ocean. Unfortunately, there are a limited number of beachfront rooms, none of which were available during our stay. The beach area was nice, but the weather was too windy and the water too choppy to enjoy. We spent most of the time by the main pools where our children enjoyed the water slide. Adults should make note that the slide is meant for children as I ended up injuring myself when I picked up too much velocity coming down the slide. We did not take advantage of the spa, as we found the prices too high, more so than similar treatments at high-end U.S. hotels. The gym was nice but to enjoy the locker room area including the steam room and sauna required an additional $20. I did not understand this since there was a mandatory daily resort fee. We had some issues with the service at the pool area which we made management aware of. The staff then went out of their way to make sure we were happy for the remainder of our stay. At the end of the day, a resort vacation is a time to bond with the family and have quality time together, which we did. The room was comfortable, we slept well, enjoyed the amenities of the property and had a great tour at Tulum arranged by the on-site travel agency. The staff was friendly and the grounds were quite nice. The tropical landscaping was quite nice with a variety of palm trees - my favorite were the Royal Cuban palm trees. I would go back to the property if we could get a beachfront room and when the beach is more conducive to swimming.

Reviews.Title: “Casita rooms with an awesome view”
Reviews.Author: JanvdBrink
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont resort has written service all over it! People are so friendly, and really helpful, that you feel at home from the first day and onwards. Too bad our stay was only for 1 week...

Reviews.Title: “Lots and lots of walking (or waiting)”
Reviews.Author: GregOSanCarlos
Reviews.Content: Lovely facility if.... you like to walk or ... don't mind waiting. You leave your car at the lobby (which is not likely to be anywhere near your room) and then you walk to your room or, wait for a ride in a "stretch golf cart". They have bikes as well, which are fun, but they don't have enough of them and many of them are in marginal shape. They have the "stretch golf cart" transportation service but they don't have enough of them either. You often wait longer than it would take to walk... which is not trivial. And, when you walk you are on the same walkways as the bikes, the "stretch golf carts" and the numerous service vehicles (which go too fast). Nice rooms, too bad they are so hard to get too!

Reviews.Title: “This is a terrific resort that has such great facilities that is hard to leave to go sightseeing.”
Reviews.Author: Andycat1
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, first class haven from the real world. Good restaurants, great service, large gym. Only criticism is that, from many rooms,it is a long way to the beach as one must go around the golf course rather thanon a staight line. Shuttles run frequently but it is still far. They should build a bridge or tunnel to avoid the golf course.

Reviews.Title: “Avid Golfer Review”
Reviews.Author: Persuader23
Reviews.Content: We just spenr a week playing golf along the Myan Riviera where this course is found. They are preparing the course for the PGA event to be played here for the first time so we thought we just had to play it. It's very expensive and of course way over-priced. It's NOT all inclusive so everything is extra. It was cart path only which we completely understood as they want everything prestine for the tour in a month's time. The carts have GPS and it is very slightly more interesting with some nice designs and twice you play up to the ocean, than playing Iberostar which is $50 cheaper and 10 minutes away. Even you cab driver will have a hard time finding the pro shop as it is a driving nightmare in this resort...but that had no bearing on this report as I didn't do the driving. I searched for weeks trying to find a deal on-line. The best place I found was teebone.com and I sure wished I used them as we chose to take our chances and try and get a deal in person using cash...they don't care!! It's a lovely course but not worth the $280 we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely but way way spread out”
Reviews.Author: Patagoniamom
Reviews.Content: Although this a lovely property the need to travel everywhere by tram can be off putting. The food was really just average. Service was excellent. We were there Christmas week and everything was very expensive. Make sure you join the Fairmont president club before going otherwise they will charge you for wireless internet in your room and also to use the gym. This is rather petty when one is paying a premium to stay here. Much lower end resorts give you these things for free. Rooms were lovely and everyone was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “special resort”
Reviews.Author: bennypm
Reviews.Content: one of the best resorts, i love it, service is great, there is no bad room all of them are great...

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Resort”
Reviews.Author: Globetrekers
Reviews.Content: Huge resort but you don't get lost in its size. Golf carts serve as free shuttles with stops throughout the resorts. We took our 16 month old child and had a great time. Lots of pools and a great beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to visit”
Reviews.Author: JmaxBod
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property on two past vacations, both times for nearly two weeks. My stays have always been excellent. I recently visited the property on a quick last minute getaway. My airport transfers were arranged via the hotel and were prompt and clean. Check in was easy as always and I was given the Tortuga presidential suite which was it's own island. Thank you Mr. Richter! The suite was massive and had its own pool. We spent our two days relaxing on the beach and drinking. The staff is phenomenal. Nightime in Playa is always fun, Do not miss El fogon late night in playa. Best mexican food anywhere. I can't wait to return, 2 days was not enough!

Reviews.Title: “Great restaurants, good service, luxurious family break”
Reviews.Author: Holidaysking
Reviews.Content: We came to the Fairmont Mayakoba unexpectedly, having abandoned our hotel in Playa due to the noisey BPM festival that surrounded our hotel. In contrast, the hotel proved an oasis of peace and luxury. We had a beach-area casita room, which had a lovely view of the lagoon (a crocodile was sunning itself just outside our terrace one day). The bathroom was fabulous (seat in the show and deep soaking tub); and the room sufficiently big. The private butler was a nice touch - we tasked him with babysitting, restaurant reservations, late check-out and a taxi to Chichen Itza, all of which was sorted for us. Plus he personally came to collect us at check-out and drove us to reception - the bell boy had already been booked to take our luggage there. Nice touch. Whilst others have slated the food, our experience was that is was excellent. Las Brisas is a fabulous restaurant - we had several great meals there. Stunning amuse-bouches and petits fours! The staff were excellent with our young children too - we arrived in Las Brisas tired and hungry with the kids not realising it was 'fine dining', but they took everything in their stride, produced crayons and colouring paper for me son and rapidly served them bread and pasta to keep them going. Excellent. We also are at La Puerta and had delicious steaks. The beachfront is lovely but yes, the sea is rough and it is windy! On a couple of days when it was cloudy, the wind made it rather chilly to lie out. You can't snorkel which is shame and there are no watersports, but that may please some looking for peace (as we were). The main pool area is stunning with lots of nooks and crannies, plus a flume. Kids club seemed good, although we didn't use it much. Some nice little touches like the free boat trip round the lagoon - made for an afternoon trip with the kids. Plus we liked that they provide an unstocked fridge in the room and don't fill it with over-priced minibar items - they leave it to you. And as for the golf buggies to transport you everywhere - our son loved them! Totally exciting. Overall, we enjoyed it. Yes, it's expensive. And not perfect. But would recommend and wouldn't turn down a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent with a large area of environmental preservation.”
Reviews.Author: lluviaxlluvia
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a "casita de luxo", very well chosen - in a quieter area away from the pool and in front of the mangroves. Beautiful. The room was really nice, with lovely views, a large bathroom. Cleaning and impeccable service. The food could be better for the price. And they should have more variety in the small market in the hotel. They had a beautiful golf course that overlooks the beach. In fact the pool was better at the beach. If you prefer a quieter place go to the spa. It was very well done with plenty of space, and with many interesting treatments.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: bythesea13
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from spending 7 nights at the Fairmont Mayakoba and are already missing it! We had a signature casista which exceeded our expectations. It was spotlessly clean and had the most wonderful bed that was so comfortable and had the softest, whitest bedlinen that i have ever seen in a hotel room. The bathroom was fantastic, I loved that the bath was directly in front of a huge window (screened on the outside by a form of willow fencing) which meant you could lay in the bath and look up into the trees, or watch the stars at night. The bathroom also had a great walk in marble shower. The rooms are extremely well equipped with nice bathroom products and teas/coffees. The staff were so polite, helpful and friendly. They remember you by name and that helps to give the 'personal touch'. We ate mainly at El Puerto and La Laguna, both were fantastic. The food at El Puerto was truly great and the staff try really hard to accommodate your needs. Special praise to the manager of El Puerto, she was brilliant. The breakfast selection at La Laguna is vast and delicious, that coupled with the location is a real winner. During the week we saw crocodiles, turtles, iguanas, a racoon type creature and lots of different species of birds and fish. The boat ride is well worth taking. Try the cocktails in the lobby bar and sit out on the terrace overlooking the resort, heaven!! Would go back in a second but reality calls :(

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch - Fairmont - They just never get it wrong”
Reviews.Author: arrbarr
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot, are from Canada and absolutely love every Fairmont we have stayed in. The Mayakoba is certainly no exception. Once again, experienced the superior service and hospitality that continually never fails us at a Fairmont. I don't know how this hotel chain does it so well, with such consistency. Far superior then any Starwood hotel, Sandals etc., Unbelievable and highly recommend this resort. Beautiful rooms overlooking the lagoons, so many things to do including the Willow Stream Spa of course, boatride's through the lagoon, bike's available throughout the property and beautiful pools and superior restaurants spread throughout the resort. Not to mention the great sandy beach. I'm sure the Banyan Tree next door (at over double the price is nice) but how much more great service do you need - Fairmont just does it right every time ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Stellar service”
Reviews.Author: oh_holidays08
Reviews.Content: WOW, this is the gold standard of service that all hotels should aspire to attain. We have stayed in many top notch hotels (various Ritz Carltons, Four Seasons, St. Regis around the world) and none compare to the service levels that we received at Fairmont Mayakoba. We stayed at the beach area casita that came with butler service and every staff we encountered (not just our butler) was super attentive, welcoming, genuinely friendly, warm and helpful. We've stayed at other hotels with butler service too, they don't even come close to the levels of service at Fairmont Mayakoba. Perhaps it's not just what the staff do for you, but also the demeanor and personalities of all the customer facing staff here that incredibly service oriented. Too many examples, but a few key instances that stand out: (1) my husband hurt his foot and was limping throughout the vacation. Almost every hotel staff that he met asked him if he was ok, what they could do to help, etc. And when they saw him again, would ask how his foot was doing, if it was improving. (2) there was a mess up with one of our restaurant reservations and it ended up we could not eat dinner in the restaurant of our choice one night, so we settled for a different restaurant, La Laguna. We were at the concierge when all this happened and my husband just mentioned by the way that its too bad that La Laguna did not  have esquitas on their menu as he was really looking forward to having that at our original restaurant choice. I think one of the restaurant managers or GMs overheard his comment and suprised us with specially made esquitas for dessert! (3) our butler always seemed to know where we were during the day and would pop by to see if there was anything we needed, e.g. dinner reservations, car rental, organizing trips out to see the Mayan ruins. Other things about the resort: - it is very spread out but easy to get around. There are lots of golf buggies traversing the resort for you to hop on/off. There are also free bicycles all over the place. - we went there in December and were worried about whether the pools and sea would be warm enough to go in the water. Not a problem. The sea was calm and warm enough to play in.  Some of the pools were heated, though not everyday it seemed. Or maybe they only switched on the heat the last few days of our stay. -loved our beach area casita that was overlooking the river (its beach AREA, not ON the beach). The river view was very serene and quiet. We would definitely come back here, not just because it's a beautiful resort but the compelling reason really is the superb service!! They REALLY know how to make you feel welcomed amd special.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas/New year 2011/12”
Reviews.Author: stephmck1312
Reviews.Content: My family and I (myself, my Mum , 4year old daughter and 13year old son) decided to stay here for our 1st trip to Mexico and our 1st time away over Christmas! The resort was beautiful! The rooms were very spacious and beautifully cleaned everyday. The staff were fabulous- so warm and friendly and really could not do enough for us and our party (there were 13 of us all together in our party!) especially the beach guys, the staff at the spa and our friend's amazing butler Olivier. The beach was clean and the kids spent everyday there although I must mention that it is a red/yellow flag beach all year round so the sea is rough and there were a few days that the children could not go in. There were no watersports due to this which was a shame for my teenage son and his friend, and I think therefore they need to put on more activities on the beach to keep them occupied-they did have either a football game or volleyball match most mornings but this really isn't enough. I had a few private yoga classes- David was the best teacher! The spa was fantastic! I had 2 massages which were excellent and a treatment called 'The Food Of The Gods'- ladies I highly recommend this!!! You are wrapped in melted chocolate then showered off, followed by a massage in coconut oil then given a large slab of delicious chocolate to eat! What more could a girl ask for?!! As far as the Christmas festivities go, in the hotel's Christmas timetable it said that Christmas Eve Father Christmas would be paying a visit between 3-5pm! I took my very excited 4year old daughter to see him at 4:15pm to be told he came at 3pm and sorry we missed out! My daughter was absolutely devastated, they took our room number and after complaining a couple of times nothing was done! I know for a fact that most 5 star hotels would have done something to make it up to her, e.g. a small surprise toy on her bed that night or something, but nothing! We ate in La Laguna Christmas day night, which was our favorite restaurant overall, it was a Christmas buffet, which to be honest was very 'Budget Buffet' and disappointed us! There was Turkey but with no trimmings! I ended up having Mexican which was delicious but others in the party were not happy! Overall the food was awful! Every night we booked our table for 7:30pm and did not receive our starters until 9:15pm at least, and the food was not of a good standard! I don't know if it was the size of our party that made them so slow , but thank goodness the restaurants weren't ever full as we'd probably still be waiting for our dessert now!lol One of our party got food poisoning and was ill for 5 days and two more had bad stomachs from the food. In a 5 star resort you expect 5 star food and in this hotel it definitely was not! It is such a shame as apart from the food, this has everything a 5 star resort should have, just the food lets it down! New Years Eve we had dinner at Las Brisas which was probably our best meal. We had the private dining room and our waiters were fantastic ( Alexander and I sorry I can't remember the other gentleman's name!), it was again a buffet and the food was yummy! I would recommend this resort overall, but if you are a big foodie then maybe it is not for you!

Reviews.Title: “First class service, well laid out and spacious property. Away from the all-inclusive crowd!”
Reviews.Author: zrh2yvr
Reviews.Content: You must read this review!!!! I hope the words of this review live long and near the top of the reviews of this hotel for a long time. This resort is amazing and as a very seasoned traveller who has seen some of the best this world has to offer, the resort has just provided a memorable experience. After months of deciding what type of vacation / resort to go to for a short 5 day break, we finally decided to go to the Fairmont and forgo the all-inclusive which is typical in this region. We are so happy we did!!!! We stayed at the end of the Christmas Peak and arrived on January 1. The resort was over 90% booked and remained that way for the duration of our stay. The resort has over 400 rooms and can host over 800 people. The resort has a lot to offer everyone from families with children, to couples, to seniors. Based on the size and facilities available, you can always find a place that will be what you want. We really never could tell there were 700 guests (and really probably 300-500 staff). This review will be comprehensive so sorry if it’s a bit long. 1.) Rooms – There are 2 main room types. The rooms in the main building (These would be the Fairmont room and deluxe room) and there are rooms in the Casitas. The quality of the rooms is very good. We stayed in a Casita but I am sure the rooms in the main building are also great. Almost all the Casitas are the same size – they have 2 levels with 2 units up and 2 units down. The suites are usually on the top and they have the size of two rooms combined. Whether you have a Signature casita or not is likely just the location. The Signature casitas are overlooking the canals / lagoons. We had a Siganture Casita and it was great. Nice big bathrooms with windows. Given the privacy of the second floor, the shower and bath are essentially outside but are covered so you get all the natural light from the windows. Beds are typical great Fairmont quality. 2.) Beach v. Not at the beach. The beach is a 7-10 min golf-cart ride away. There are rooms / suites etc at the beach – all in casitas. Some are larger oceanfront signature casitas that have private pools. Each level up is more expensive but if that’s what you want – it is available. We did not have a room at the beach but ultimately we were fine with that. If your main goal is to get up and be on the beach every morning – you may want to get a beach room as it will be more convenient for accessing your room / beach. There is one large pool at the beach as well as the signature restaurant – Las Brisas. If you stay back in the property away from the beach it is like being in the jungle a bit. It is very private and the casitas are very spaced out. The main breakfast restaurant is in the middle as are the five or six main pools. There is also one adults only pool if that is what you are looking for. It is the largest single pool and you could do lap swimming there easily as it appears to be at least 30 meters across. 3.) Food – There are 3 main restaurants and we ate at all of them. Prices are high for Mexico but you get what you pay for and the quality is good. The breakfast buffet is amazing and any way you can get a rate to include breakfast – it is worth it. Separate cost of breakfast was $25 each. We never ate lunch all week as the breakfast was so filling. 4.) Drinks - After a week in Mexico City staying at the St. Regis and paying what appeared to be a pretty high price for drinks – the Fairmont exceeded this price level by about 20%. If you are a big drinker and are looking to go away to Mexico in order to have 20 shots of Tequila per day – this place will break your budget and you should really go to an all inclusive resort. However- if you are trying to be away from those who are drinking 20 shots per day – you will find the guests at the Fairmont much better to be around. 5.) The vibe / crowd etc. The guests are refined, international and the kids on the site were under under control (for the most part!). There is no single country which seems to dominate the guest list and so for those of you who have possibly in your past vacations felt that you were just around a bunch of (insert nationality here) - - that will not happen here – at least it did not for us. 6.) Service – The staff have really been well trained to provide the Fairmont Royal Service. You can sense that each member of the staff feels it is their responsibility to keep the guest happy. This is from the check-in to the pool, valet parking, bell desk, housekeeping, maintenance, security, transportation and restaurants. Many of the staff feel very proud to work at the Fairmont and you can see it shows. 7.) Value – There are 3 hotels in the Mayakoba area. Banyan Tree, Rosewood and Fairmont. The Fairmont is definitely the lowest cost. We did not see the other resorts in detail but in looking into them, the other 2 are definitely a cut above in terms of the style, size and expense of the rooms. If you want only the best and are willing to pay for it – The Fairmont can offer you the Signature beach front suites and these will compare with anything at the Rosewood or Banyan Tree. I would expect that the other 2 resorts will have fewer people and perhaps more of a celebrity and very wealthy crowd. 8.) Other amenities – The Fairmont has other facilities such as the Willow Spa (we did not use), the Golf Course (Which is world class, meticulously maintained and beautiful). There is also a gym which has all the equipment and facilities you need including a whole separate room with yoga mats. There may be a fee to use the gym but we did not use if. 9.) Packages – Rates at this location are always changing and the types of packages they run seem to change a lot. Go to the Fairmont web site for latest. I do not know which wholesalers have access to the rooms but we used the Amex Platinum desk which has this hotel as one of the Fine Hotels and Resorts. They do occasionally run an all-inclusive which is comprehensive but has some limited restrictions (i.e., no all-you-can-eat fois gras and likely some restrictions on which alchohol brands are included). They also have all-you-can-golf pacakges which I would definitely take next time if available as the course is expensive ($200+ per round). In terms of cost – It is approx. $100 per person extra for all-inclusive when it is offered. This is a good option if you feel you will drink a lot. Overall – remember this is not all-inclusive unless you get the package. However, you will get a better experience, generally much better food and a crowd that is not rowdy. This place is relaxation, privacy, and has exceptional service. It has great facilities and lots of space to find your own corner. I’m sure in off-season you’ll feel like the only guests. This place is not the uber-luxury hotel like the Banyan Tree or Rosewood. it is also not a party hotel for your college spring-break getaway. It is also not cheap but it is good value for what you pay. Thus, if you are looking for the cheapest place, you will likely not be happy here and will find the costs (especially the food) expensive. However, if you have a decent budget to spend on vacation and want a great experience, this place will meet your criteria. One final note – if you are a frequent traveller and have stayed at the Fairmont many times in your travels, you will feel a sense of faimiliarity in the Fairmont and the staff make extra efforts to make you welcome. They know they are part of the Fairmont family and make the effort they can to welcome you – especially if you are a President’s club member. A special hello and Thank-you goes out to Odracir Peralta, who made our stay extra special including recognition of the special birthday that we were celebrating.

Reviews.Title: “Marred by a few very bad incidents - beware if you are Muslim, Jewish, or have any other specific dietary needs!”
Reviews.Author: FZBD
Reviews.Content: The hotel is set in a beautiful location, the staff are - in general - excellent and supremely helpful, and the beach is stunning. The service and food selection, especially for those with special dietary requirements, were outstanding at the La Laguna Restaurant. Be warned that there is a dress code, but La Laguna accepts casual clothing. The other restaurants require pants, shoes and a collared shirt for men...you might be able to sneak through slightly under-dressed. Food is extremely over-priced on the resort (one banana for US$2), and it'll set you back about US$60 for a round-trip to Playa del Carmen town with a hotel-approved cab (well-worth it just to spend some time on 5th Avenue!). Do not bother going to Las Brisas or El Puerto Restaurants. The service was ridiculously slow. As for El Puerto, the waiters and staff were also utterly incompetent. Despite repeatedly insisting that our party not be fed anything which contained alcohol, pork, or meat, the waiters served a dish which - yes - contained pork. When they served it, they were specifically asked if it had any meats or alcohol, and they said no - which was totally untruthful as we later discovered after eating them, much to our horror. Similarly, on the beach (part of Las Brisas' services) our party - one of whom was pregnant at the time - ordered non-alcoholic drinks. We again specifically and repeatedly checked with the waiter that he would bring us drinks without alcohol, but of course they couldn't get such simple requests right, and after taking sips of the drinks we realised that they were in-fact alcoholic! The apologies were quite inadequate, once we extracted them. I have to say that the one redeeming feature about the resort is the "Travel Agency" and a most helpful young lady by the name of Synda. If you're willing to pay hotel prices for activities such as Scuba Diving or excursions to nearby Excaret, the service was absolutely fantastic and probably well worth the extra cost. By the way, if you're looking at scuba diving, the dives leave from the hotel north of Mayakoba (about 30-45min walk along the beach). The dives sites are quite spectacular. If you arrange diving from the stores in Playa del Carmen, you will save about US$40 on two-tanks. At the main/kiddies pool and La Laguna look out for an awesome server by the name of Gildardo (sp?), the guy was fantastic! All-in-all...I have no desire to return there...ever.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Superb Service”
Reviews.Author: GentleKnight
Reviews.Content: A true luxury resort. Beautiful, well-equipped, well-appointed rooms, staff dedicated to excellent service, Restaurants with good to excellent food. Acres of pools, Sandy beach. We arranged a family Christmas with people from three continents, including an infant and a 3-1/2 year old. Staff went out of their way to be accommodating. With the hotel totally full, restaurant service was a bit slow. Our caveat: the in-house travel agency. We booked a tour of the Maya ruins at Chichen Itza. The on-site tour and the guide were excellent! The logistics of crowded van pick-up to meet a crowded uncomfortable bus with a wise-cracking guide (and return) were not worthy of the Fairmont! It was therefore disappointing that the Fairmont did not have its on beach-based facilities for snorkling the beautiful reefs. The Mayakoba may not be the perfect place for teenagers or unmarried people if they want more than hanging around the pool, cycling the paths and eating.

Reviews.Title: “Complete Disaster”
Reviews.Author: ericliney
Reviews.Content: Ok, I am not sure where to start. I may want to protect some of the bar staff and waiters because they were great. So hats off to them. Now to the disaster of a hotel. I cannot believe this is a Fairmont. I am puzzled whether it is just hard to find good management in Playa Del Carmen due to so many hotels, or this place is just run horribly. Our trip started with the car arranged by the hotel to pick us up not showing up at all. Great start. We then arrived to find the place PACKED with kids. I mean PACKED. I have nothing against kids and I am sure its good money for the hotel to get families... But I feel these places are supposed to be an escape. And romance was very hard to achieve with screaming brats everywhere. We then attempted to get some privacy at the spa and workout and use steam room. We were hit with a $35.00 PER PERSON charge to use the spa at a vacation resort. So basically, if my wife and I want to get healthy and enjoy a workout on our vacation it was $70.00 per day. PER DAY. We attempted to enjoy a plated New Years Eve dinner and tried several times to get our reservation to it. I was then told I had to take a half hour out of my vacation and catch a ride to the front desk (property is huge) to sign a deposit waiver for the event. I mean I requested to go to the dinner and now I have to sign a waiver to go to dinner? Sorry but this place is a disaster. I can go on and on (like the 45 peso a day resort charge they dont tell you about). My wife and I spent 1k more in incidental charges than we did in Four Seasons in Maui for same amount of time. Complete Disaster

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “The BEST”
Reviews.Author: CazLuisYoyo
Reviews.Content: I don't know why this hotel isn't ranked #1 in the world. Upon dropping off a lot of people from the airport and seeing other resorts, the Fairmont Mayakoba is BY FAR THE BEST!!! There are so many pools, restaurants, and grounds to explore, and the services are so excellent, I honestly can't wait to go back. What really sets this place apart from the other resorts in the area is that you live in a cabana in the middle of the pristine jungle surrounding the hotel, most overlooking a gorgeous lagoon. The Mayakoba isn't just another nice, big collection of brightly painted buildings made to cater to vacationers; this place is the real deal. Everything is clean, fresh and seriously romantic. I would highly recommend this resort to anyone; it's undeniably the best!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service but spread out too much”
Reviews.Author: Jodanic
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 7yr old for Christmas/New Years week and had a really good time. The staff is truly 5 star and seem hotel schooled in their level of service. The property is pretty but really spread out and getting around in golf carts can be a drag. It's pricey and it adds up quickly if you're not super budget focused. Also the New Years Eve party went on waaaaay too long and kept us up past 2:30 with bad 80s music blaring across the resort! Overall, really nice place.

Reviews.Title: “El puerto - very possibly the worst restaurant in Carmen del Playa”
Reviews.Author: travelingdad56
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Banyan Tree in December 2011. On the same property are two other hotels the Fairmont and the Rosewood. The reception desk at the Banyan Tree recommended El Puerto at the Fairmont. It is advertised as a steakhouse. This is a terrible restaurant in every way possible. The reception desk had to cajole the hostess at Ei Puerto to accept our reservation for 7:30pm on December 20th. When we arrived the restaurant was only half full and remained so for the entire evening. The decor consists of bright white walls and bright lights. With a lady singer singing karaoke style 1960/70s music. The terrace is better but unfortunately the mosquitoes like it too. The terrace looks out on a fountain with a huge (2 or 3 story tall) white Christmas tree with red lites. It makes one feel you are in mall of America. Service was disorganized and felt like our waiter and busboy were 2 of the 3 stooges. Getting water, a a glass of wine and bread literally took 35 minutes. Then we placed the order. We were told that the national beef was "outstanding" and ordered steaks rare and charred on the outside, asparagus and to start salads with dressing on the side. 20 minutes later the salads arrived drenched in dressing.
