We accepted the salads since we were starving. 45 minutes later our steaks arrived well done and not charred. The waiter left the asparagus and told us it would be 15 minutes and we would have our steaks. 20 minutes later after asking about our steaks twice we were told the kitchen was very busy since it was the Christmas holidays and the manager would see us. Another 5 minutes and no manager. We asked for our bill. It was 80 dollars without the steaks and included a 15 percent service charge. No apology. When we were leaving there was a family with 2 kids about 5 and 8. Both kids were sound asleep with their heads on the table. The father told me that they had been there for 2 hours. I complained to the reception desk at the Banyan Tree and they told me they would notify the manager at the Fairmont. We never received any response from El Puerto or the Fairmont. The experience was terirble and a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Christmas Stay by the Beach”
Reviews.Author: SigisB
Reviews.Content: We had an Amazing Christmas Stay by the Beach. From front desk, to housekeeping, from Restaurants to in house dining, the whole stay was perfect. We had the opportunity to book and stay in an Oceanfront Casita Suite ( These oceanfront suites feature a private stairway descending to the beach. As an extraordinary amenity, the Oceanfront Casita Suites feature their own private (heated) Infinity Pool on the terrace, with a stunning views). Perfect for a small family. Amazing bathroom(s).

Reviews.Title: “Great property bland food”
Reviews.Author: azpNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: Pool was wonderful and the grounds are beautiful. The kids club is only good for children 2-5 years - there is a volleyball net on the beach but no volleyball, lots of arts and crafts activities but not as much for boys. The grounds are beautiful and the staff are very friendly. The beach is beaitiful. Would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like Royalty but welcomed like Old Friends.”
Reviews.Author: sbpchapman
Reviews.Content: Really... What can I say.... My family and I travel a lot, and have stayed in many hotels in Mexico and around the world, but the Fairmont Mayakoba just elevated us to new heights. The personal service was first class, from the front desk to the gardeners - the hotel and rooms very beautiful - the grounds were breath-taking (take the boat tour with Pedro - iguanas, crocodiles, herons, plus too much more to mention) - delicious restaurants - amazing pools.... Honestly, what a vacation. We were there for a wedding, which was run superbly by the Planners at the Fairmont. Just simply the best. Full stop. End of story. Go there!

Reviews.Title: “World Class Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Rick182
Reviews.Content: I spent 10 days in Nov/Dec in a Cassita on the canal after a hectic last 6 months and I became the real me again in no time. Every employee at the Fairmont was genuine in their warm greetings and their life stories (if you engaged them). I never left Myakoba to venture into Town (as is my practice wherever I go) because the beach and swimming pools were excellent, the food as great as any Fairmont in Canada, the Willow Stream Spa and Exercise Area immaculate and rejuvinating. I loved riding a bike to the beach, to the spa, to the boat. I loved the frequency of the golf cart rides around the resort. I loved the Christmas decoartions. The boat ride was so informative that we took it twice. There are many birds, fish and animals that live there and it was a treat to have them so close and seemingly content. I liked the way the waitstaff at the restaurants remembered our favourite wines, the way they engaged us with authentic stories of their lives, and the way they paced the meals. I rarely visit the same place twice as this is a big World, but I know I will go back if just for a long weekend to relax and enjoy the superb hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Great grounds but poor quality food for price”
Reviews.Author: palapas93
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed walking around the complex. It is such a relaxing and beautiful place. The service staff at La Laguna restaurant were so attentive. However, the food was on the expensive side and not authentic. Except for a few times we were generally disappointed with our dishes. Go to playa del carmen for authentic food and more variety.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Mayakoba, Luxury All Inclusive great value!”
Reviews.Author: Stinger55
Reviews.Content: Fairmont Mayakoba Review: Just recently returned from the Fairmont Mayakoba, stayed between December 10th and 14th and was trying out the new Luxury “All Inclusive” package that was currently offered at a 30% discount. The nightly rate for the basic room was $429.00/night and that included food and beverage for two adults and two children under 5. We did have to pay the additional $15/person/day resort fee which was added to our bill. I am first pleased to report that we received an amazing upgrade to a Beach area Casita Suite, we very much enjoyed the room top pool/hot tub as it was a nice way to end the day. Thanks to the management of the hotel and the previous GM for assisting in following through on a promise made a few years ago!! The package was very good value in my opinion. The package included Laguna restaurant for breakfast and you could either select the buffet or order off the menu. All drinks, juice, milk, etc were also included as part of the plan. Lunches were available at Laguna or Las Brisas, as well as both pool or beach service which gave you access to all venues that were open, including all day and night access to the lobby lounge for drinks and food. As far as dinner, Las Brisas and Laguna were included at no additional cost. They did have a couple items on the menu (lobster items) that were an additional $10 cost if ordered so you were always able to order off the entire menu. Wine was by the glass and we found them to have a sufficient selection. You are also able to eat at El Puerto for an additional $25/person I believe. We did not have to pay as Las Brisas was closed on the Saturday night for a wedding so they switched our reservation to El Puerto at no cost. I paid the additional $10 and had the lobster from Saan Kiam, which was good. Once again, at El Puerto, no limit on number of any appetizers except the foie grois. I was able to order a nice mix of fresh oysters flown in. Bar service was available throughout the day at all bars and restaurants including the beach and pool service. The cocktail selection was wide ranging, only certain cocktails were not included such as some of the signature fairmont cocktails with high end champagne and cognac. As far as beer selection it appeared you could order whatever you wanted, I am a fan of Modelo Especial which I cannot get in Canada so stuck with that. The only confusion seem to be with bottled water/sparkling water. Although not charged additional for anything, I thought it should have been clearer what all was included as on occassions I drank, perrier, pellegrino, and cristal mineral water as well as Bonafont. Anyway, service was very good and taxes and gratuities were included. On several occasions we added to the tip as service was exceptional. Some staff knew more about the new plan then others and were able to explain things better, however, it was never really an issue. As the hotel was only about 30% occupied, there didn’t seem to be that many people on the AI plan, however, I would recommend it to anyone if offered again. I believe the cost for children between 6-12 was $50 or $75 additional a day, however, the package also includes three hours of kids club activities per day. Anyway, would definitely do this again as I enjoy the property, and with suite upgrades, I believe it is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and sofisticated casitas!”
Reviews.Author: ourplanetisbeautiful
Reviews.Content: lush foliage outside the casitas, which have every amenity inside, feels like you never left home, except that you are in the Mayan Riviera!

Reviews.Title: “SO relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: Vagabond76
Reviews.Content: This place was magic. The beaches were pristine, the service and attention to detail were spot-on. The food in the restaurants was a touch pricey, but absolutely delicious. I rarely visit the same place twice, but I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “terrible value for the price”
Reviews.Author: Leslie W
Reviews.Content: I took my 16 year old son with me to my business conference at the Fairmont Mayakoba, because I love Riviera Maya and wanted to share the experience with him. I travel worldwide and have traveled to Riviera Maya for the last 25 years. I have never paid more for a resort hotel. Given that the price was so high (probably a poor negotiation by my company...) the access to meals and activities was limited. While I was in the meeting they did not let my 16 year old son eat at the beach restauant, even though I paid $120 extra per night to have him stay with me, so he had to skip lunch. This was unneccessary and mean, certainly not what I consider luxury. They charged me extra for a cappucino with breakfast and they offerred me a champaigne cocktail and then told me that it would cost extra. The meals were standard (good) international hotel fare, nothing too exciting. The rooms were very nice but extremely far away from everything... a long walk to the beach, a long walk to the pool and excercise room. There was NOTHING to do there. If you are sedintary and wish to stay in a nice room in a mangrove swamp, then this hotel is for you. If you want to have an excellent time in riviera Maya, go to Akumal. By the way, the Fairmont Mayakoba also freaked me out a little because there were literally hundreds of people working there compared to just 100 or so guests. All of the workers were obviously trained to say hello to the guests which gave me the creepy feeling that they were like slaves for us rich folk. I would never consider staying there again, for any price.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Mayakoba Playa del Carmen - WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: sslaugh182
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Maykoba in November- fabulous hotel.. 5 star all the way. The staff, the rooms, the bed, the bedding, the grounds, the pools , the beach all wonderful! Breakfast was good, and the lunch was good.. a bit pricey but to be expected . We never ate dinner because there are so many wonderful restaurants in town. Very accomodating for us as my daughter and her family with young baby also came and stayed with us. We asked for and received an upgraded room. Only negative is taxi to town ... and that is a bummer but would do this again because other than being far from town.. this is a fabulous hotel.. It is huge.. they have golf carts picking you up and you do not wait more than a minute! One note of caution: they charge for Internet use

Reviews.Title: “A magical hotel in touch with nature”
Reviews.Author: traveleronlinenyc
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time here. This was my second visit.The best things were the service and how in tune with nature this hotel is. You hear exotic birds chirping, see the most lush foliage and just feel very at one with nature. You can look out at the beautifully landscaped setting and gaze into the lagoon. It's so peaceful and gorgeous. I also cannot say enough about how great the service is here. Everyone makes you feel welcome and in a genuine, not saccharine way. The restaurants are very very good. I have never been to an all-inclusive, where the food sounds not very good, but I can say the food at these restaurants were quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect "Babymoon" in Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Jonbo1116
Reviews.Content: I had posted a forum topic a while back asking about which resort in Playa Del Carmen would be the best for my wife and I on a 'babymoon" trip. The Fairmont Mayakoba won, and I feel like we made the absolute perfect decision. A very big thank you to the staff across the entire resort: from the restaurants, to the spa, to the beach and pool areas, the font desk and concierge, to the housekeeping and cart drivers... everyone was better than perfect. Everything you may read about the hospitality, attention to detail, quick response, and positive attitude are all true. Amazing service and the entire staff had a 'can do' attitude. We stayed in a Signature Casita with the breaskfast package... The room was amazing, quiet, very clean, with an extremely comfortable bed and a huge bathroom. We could not have asked for more. I would certainly recommend the breakfast package- severed till 11:30 am so we did not feel rushed if we wanted to sleep in, and had basically every gourmet breakfast offering we could ask for. One thing we were concerned with before going (and asked several people about) was the beach. Was it too small, too loud, too far..etc... It was just want we wanted.. white sand beach, clear blue water, plenty of space, safe enough to leave our things unattended to go for a long walk or swim, and well attended by the beach waiters. I actally liked the fact that you had to take the hotel carts to the beach (like a 4 minute ride) through the mangroves to get there... made it feel like you were traveling through the jungle to arrive at a private and secluded beach. The Willow Stream spa is also amazing. We spent two afternoons there, just lounging by the spa pool and using the facilities. For what we were looking for (quiet and relaxing time), it was just what we needed. Again, like a broken record, the staff was attentive and very welcoming. Cannot tell you enough how perfect this trip was. The management and staff certainly deserve a big pat on the back. We will certainly go back to this amazing place. They have set the bar pretty high for any other resort in the area. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Last minute well made decision!”
Reviews.Author: evelinalagallina
Reviews.Content: We recently visited Playa del Carmen and had originally made reservations at Hotel Fusion (Downtown Playa), little did we know that the entire down town was under construction and there was no parking in town, we decided to book a last minute reservation at Fairmont Mayakoba, OMG!! best decision ever!! The location of this resort is perfect, its on a lagoon and close to the beach. Its such a beautiful place, they have these cool boat rides throughout the lagoon and the restaurants are awesome!! We loved it and would come back in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Mayakoba... the Venice of the Riviera Maya”
Reviews.Author: Mark H
Reviews.Content: Truly amazing resort, the nicest I have stayed at in Mexico. The Willow Stream Spa was tremendous! My wife and I have never experienced a better spa treatment. If you stay here, you must get a Casita as your accommodation. The ones on the canals are spectacular. This resort is lush, with many tropical birds and plants. 5 Star restaurants and top notch service! This resort is a home run!

Reviews.Title: “An Experience to Remember!”
Reviews.Author: Tesslady
Reviews.Content: If you want to lay back and just enjoy the fruits of life, this is the place! Your room is set up for elegance and beauty of nature. The shower is marble and huge! The backdrop is a wall to floor glass window showing the beauties of the jungle. They have made is so there is a cement wall dug into the ground for privacy but a jungle inside of this for you to enjoy while you shower, while you relax in the jacuzzi. It adds another dimension to the room that just adds to its elegance. The restaurants are all first class which will suite any appetite. The grounds are amazing and huge! I totally recommend going on a morning boat ride each day. They take a maximum of 4 people of a very relaxing, quiet (electric boat) , safe little boat ride through the canal system into the jungle so you can see nature at its best! You will see many species of birds, iguanas, caves and maybe a crocodile or two sunning on the rock. Oh and I am not a golfer but this is a very famous golf course for the golfer enthusiast just steps from your room. It has everything, swimming pools, the ocean, great restaurants, solitude and relaxation, Playa del Carmen just a $12 cab ride away if you want noise, shopping and entertainment but you can come right back to your little piece of heaven at Mayakoba. I will be back! But this time I am bringing my husband as while I spent time there with my girlfriend all I could think of was if my hubby were only here with me. So if you want luxury, fine food and nature - This is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Most Enjoyable Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Skuba
Reviews.Content: We have had the pleasure of traveling to many Caribbean destinations, and although each is unique in its own way, this was without a doubt the most relaxing vacation we have ever had. We had arranged for airport pickup through the Fairmont concierge, and even though it is pricey, having the private drive in a plush and spacious Suburban was a welcome oasis after a cramped and full flight from Canada. The drive to the resort takes about a half hour along a modern and well-maintained highway. The entrance to Mayakoba is striking. Three luxury resorts share the Mayakoba grounds - The Rosewood, Banyan Tree and the Fairmont. Having visited a few other resorts in the Riviera Maya, I can say unequivocally that the grounds and hotels in Mayakoba are exceptionally well maintained and landscaped. Checkin was quick and efficient. Golf-cart style shuttles run regularly between the lobby and the beach. The bulk of the hotel infrastructure is located far back from the beach to maintain the ecological integrity of the fragile dune and mangrove environments. Our Signature Casita was located on one of the canals, and featured a spacious bathroom well-supplied with toiletries. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have slept in. The large balcony had two comfortable cushioned chairs and we spent our mornings listening to and watching the numerous bird species that inhabit the area. The fish in the lagoons seem to be well-conditioned, as a dozen or more would appear beneath the balcony as soon as they heard the screen doors close! My only complaint about the room was that the two wicker chairs are not comfortable for sitting to read or watch television for extended periods of time. We had purchased the full meal plan (which included all drinks) and were glad that we did as meals tend to be expensive. The quality of the food, preparation, presentation and service are all of a high level, commensurate with the prices. There are three restaurants at the Fairmont. We regularly had breakfast at La Laguna in the centre of the resort, the only restaurant open for breakfast, save for the deli cafe. There are many options to choose from, including traditional breakfast items, many Mexican specialties, a large assortment of fresh fruits, eggs made to order, smoothies, and hot meat entrees. I eat gluten-free, and the chefs were able to accommodate that with specially-made muffins, cookies and bread (best gluten-free french bread I have had to date). You do however, have to order these the day before. Lunch for us was normally at Las Brisas which is on the beach. You can also obtain food and drink service right on the beach. Las Brisas has a great selection of Mexican specialties. The wait staff are all genuinely friendly and warm. Dinner is available at all three restaurants. El Puerto which is located in the reception building, specializes in seafood and steak. Our favourite restaurant was Las Brisas because it is right on the beach. In the evenings it tends to be quite windy and cool at this time of the year. At night the lights bordering the walkways are quite dim in order to create a more natural environment for the birds and animals that inhabit the area. If you are intending to walk after dark, rather than riding a shuttle, a small flashlight may come in handy. The beach is beautiful with well-manicured white sand. The island of Cozumel is clearly visible on the horizon. Parasailing and jet-skiing are very popular. You can walk for miles along the beach in both directions strolling by adjacent hotels. We took a day trip to the Mayan ruins at Coba. We had organized this through the onsite travel agency Maritur. There was apparently some confusion about which tour we had requested - we thought we had booked the private tour, but ended up on a group tour in a cramped 12 passenger bus. Ensure that both you and the travel agent understand what it is that you are purchasing. The ruins were very crowded. The largest temple at Coba can still be climbed, but we understand that this will be allowed for only one more year. Every element of this vacation was enjoyable and relaxing. I simply can't say enough about the wonderful staff. There wasn't a person that would pass us without a cheerful Hola or Buenos Dias. Wait staff would go out of their way to make us comfortable and welcome. Shuttle drivers always asked how our day was going. Evening entertainment was professional and enjoyable. The lagoon boat tour guide was knowledgeable and entertaining - I highly recommend taking this free resort trip which lasts approximately 30-40 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “BEUTIFUL”
Reviews.Author: agarcia87
Reviews.Content: The place is amazing the staff very polite, lots of privacy as well as personal service... from the bell boys to the cleaning staff was amazing the grounds are very clean and natrually beutiful.. the food was great a little to americanized for me not authentic mexican food a little pricey as well.. as soon as we arrived we were greeted with a very berry drink and the upgraded us to a casita... only once did i run into a bad exprecince at the reception area the guy was very rude other than that every one was GREAT escpeciallly the ppl in the front that help you in to ur car... we booked two tours with the hotel came out expensive we ended up renting a car witch was more affordable and even bettr the roads are very safe and clean and everthing is off the main highway. i had a wonderful wonderful time at fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for the care and attention!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle_V_2010
Reviews.Content: Our last stay at the Fairmont Mayakoba was truly memorable. The grounds are very beautifully landscaped and offer a peaceful surroundings. The staff is attentive, offer personal service, but not overwhelming, and are very respectful of guest privacy. We had excellent service in all the restaurants, as well as on the beachfront area and the breakfast buffet offers a wide selection, with an amazingly delicious green juice. Our room was impeccably clean and orderly. Also, when we arrived, I was ill with a sinus infection and feeling very bad. I was able to quickly see the Doctor on the site. He was very caring and attended to treating me to full recovery in less than 2 days. As a result, I was able to enjoy the rest of my stay! I look forward to visiting again soon! Thanks, M. Van Damme

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at a Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: nkn9
Reviews.Content: Where do I even start, what a perfect holiday and we just got home this morning as we had a long weekend there for Thanksgiving. We have stayed at many a Fairmont over the years, and this was absolutley one of if not the best stay at a Fairmont we have ever had. We had arranged for airport pick up when I booked this back in March of this year and I never remembered to reconfirm pick up. We realized this on the flight down and said ok, either they are there or not and no worries. Well, they were there and waiting for us with a private vehcle and cold water. Perfect and off to another great stay at the Fairmont. My husband is a Presidents Club member etc and we received an upgraded room on arrival that came with a Butler, Elio. We were upgraded from a Lagoon View Suite to a Beach Area Suite and it was great and came with a lovely balcony with a view of the lagoon and a roof top view of the ocean. We had coffee out there every morning ( on the lagoon view balcony) and watched the birds and it seems with all the peace and quiet ( perhaps due to the trees that were there and the way the architects laid it out) that we were there all alone in our own private world. It was fabulous and exactly what we needed. We had the breakfast buffet every morning and it was well worth it. The property also has three pools and other activities and a person could come for a stay and never leave this beautiful place. It is also really nice that all of the employees say good morning, afternoon etc as you walk by and many take the time to learn your name. This is typical of Fairmont Hotels but they do an even better job of it at this location. The golf cart transportation is brillant and often if an employee sees you waiting they will call on the radio for a cart for you. I don't think we ever waited more than a couple of minutes for a cart if even that. Back to Elio our Butler while we were there. We can't say enough good things about him, just a nice person with a can do attitude for everything we inquired about and one day when I found something my husband and son wanted to do and it appeared to be sold out, all I had to do was to call him and voila, tickets were available in ten minutes and all we had to do was to pay for them and show up on time. Also our trip back was changed and he handled all of the changing to the return trip to the airport to catch the flight home. We were on vacation and I did not have to mess with it and I loved it. I also used the Spa and found the services to be very good. Also, like most Fairmont Hotels, they have a car rental desk in the property. We rented a car at the hotel for the duration of our stay as we wanted to do a bit of touring but not on a tour bus and not only was the rental price better than out in town, but complementary valet parking is included if you rent a vehicle on site. I could go one and on about our perfect stay but the best thing was this morning. As our flight home had been changed by the airlines and we had to leave the hotel at 4am to get to the airport on time-ewww. Elio arranged to have the staff come up to our room to get our bags at 3.45am and ride the cart back to reception to check out. They were there at 3.45am on the dot with smiles on their faces and our teenager realised at that moment that he had forgot his perscription sungalsses in the rental vehicle. Those were retrived with no issues or any " I guess we can do it for you". I was simply, oh, I have all the keys to the rental cars at night, one person said and it would be his pleasure to get the glasses which he did and it did not hinder our leaving on time. Also the bill was ready when we arrived at reception right before 4am and the front desk staff was awake and professional. Surprisingly they also had fresh hot coffee ready and we happliy took a cup to go as at that time of day, yes we needed it. Elio had it all arranged and it was the perfect ending to the perfect trip. We travel about 2 to 3 times a year for pleasure and we do have a family rule to never go to the same place twice, but we have decided that we will make an exception and we will return again to the Fairmont Mayakoba in a few years.

Reviews.Title: “second visit was better than first”
Reviews.Author: yogasue
Reviews.Content: this hotel is amazingly wonderful. the room was large and well appointed. the staff is as helpful and attentive as any at any hotel we've ever stayed at. they seem bound and determined to make sure everything is perfect. most of the staff knew our names by the 2nd day, which astonished me. we spent thanksgiving week there and hotel was about 60% occupied, so it wasn't too crowded. most days we had the pool to ourselves. a tip for dining: there are special menus at all the restaurants for those who prefer gluten free, vegetarian, vegan, macrobiotic or other dietary choices. these menus are not well displayed, but ask for them. the lentil soup was terrific!! we never left the property, although we have swum with dolphins and done the other tourist attractions on previous trips to the area.the gym is well stocked, and the spa area is lovely. my husband had 2 wonderful massages. the fairmont is perfect for any size family or group.

Reviews.Title: “It was all amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Habby73
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Fairmont Mayakoba which is located between Cancun and Playa del Carmen. This place is amazing!! We woke every morning to the call of birds and enjoyed watching them hunt, and nest just across the canal from our private balcony. Everything about this property exceeded our expectations. The grounds and rooms were immaculate, the staff very knowledgable and friendly and the food was amazing. It is a very large property so it never felt crowded. Guests are transported around the resort either by motorized cart, or you can grab one of the bicycyles they have scattered around the resort and pedal yourself, which I did every morning just to explore! I also had a treatment at the spa and it was first class! We travel frequently and rarely go back to the same area, but the Mayakoba is definitely on my "return" list!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Megg30
Reviews.Content: It was the greatest experience in cancun, the hotel is very beautiful, nice rooms, breakfast buffet excellent, the whole property is very clean and nice, but most of all, the service and kindness of the people who work there was the plus in our family trip, they are aware of everything, always talk to us by our family name and remember the name of our baby girl. Definitely we will come back, there are some useful tips: - bottlelled water is free, they delivered into your room every night - there are mosquito repellent en every jogging station, use it!! And bring your own for your room - when you checked in, reserve the boat tour, it can be full some days - complementary BMW bikes for use in the property - in room dinning with great service

Reviews.Title: “Better then we could have imagined”
Reviews.Author: peterjackie
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Mayakoba in Playa del Carmen is an amazing place to stay. The resort is beautiful. We kept saying we couldn't believe how friendly and helpful all of the staff are. Our room faced the canal which was very nice. We were on vacation for our anniversary and when we got back to our room after supper, it was all decorated with rose petals. Super nice. The food was also very good. Our favorite restaurant would be La Laguna. The buffet breakfast was a highlight. We will be back next year!!

Reviews.Title: “BEYOND MY EXPECTATIONS”
Reviews.Author: mayerthorpefarmgirl
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite resorts in Mexico. I prefer Fairmont properties, as they are always first class, but the Mayakoba is just an amazing place, it far exceeded my expectations. We were picked up in a private Cadillac Escalade for our transfer from the airport, and the ride was quick and enjoyable. We were greeted in the lobby with cold towels and sangrias, and check in was a breeze. The property is breathtaking, a perfect balance of class and culture, very modern yet there were touches of the old mayan civilization, and I cannot rave enough about how fantastic and beautiful it is. From the natural lagoons and wildlife, to the pristine beaches, I was never disappointed with my stay here. The service was the best I have ever experienced, and the food and drinks were amazing. The bartenders were wonderful, and the waiters attentive, very quick and always smiling. We stayed in just a basic Fairmont room, and although I was able to upgrade being a President's Club Platinum member, but there was really no need, our room was beautiful. The beds were amazing, the decor modern and high quality. We had a private terrace overlooking the lagoons, and we saw so much wildlife while just having morning coffee, the green iguanas were my favorite. The resort offers golf cart chauffeurs to all the lobby,different restaurants, lounges, pools and the beach, I never waited more than 5 minutes for a ride, as well the property offers a wonderful free boat ride through the lagoons, and we saw even more wildlife, including sea turtles,cormorants and crocodiles, and a myriad of different tropical fish. We did a spa day, massages, mani's and pedi's, and again, amazing service! As well, you have access to all the spa amenities for the entire day, so again you get much more than what you pay for. This resort is not an all inclusive, and some might feel it is expensive, if that is the case, there are many all inclusive hotels in the area, and those properties are much better for the people who worry about prices, although they do have sales here on the off season and you get far more than what you pay for. This is a place to enjoy a vacation if you want pure luxury, you will not be disappointed. This is the best resort on the Mayan Rivera, hands down.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Hicke
Reviews.Content: Came here for a weekend with some work colleagues. The beach is a bit far away from the main property, but other than that I was very pleased with my stay. Staff is friendly and very service-minded. And they do smoothies at breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “overprized and overrated”
Reviews.Author: Guenter L
Reviews.Content: The first slight impression was not so bad, but beauty is only skin deep. In our opinion this hotel is totally overrated. For a hotel in this price range there are too many shortcomings. Let’s go into detail: 1.) Value-for-money ratio The welcome was a little bit cold and was more or less an introductory speech to understand all the additional charges that were about to happen to us: - 15 US$ per day and person resort fee - 100 Pesos per day for valet parking - 10 US$ per visit of the fitness center - 23 US$ per day (!!!) for WIFI-use; this borders on insolence. Every other modest hotel we visited during our Yucatan-round-trip offered this service of course for free, but not the so-called “upper-class” and “luxury” Fairmont-Mayakoba-Hotel. All these additional costs for partly obviousnesses must not be for an AAA 5 diamond resort. 2.) Location The hotel complex was very spacious. Advantage of this was the silence; Disadvantage: long distances to the pools, restaurants, beach, exit, … . To surmount these distances you can use bicycles (for free !!!) or the shuttle service with golf karts. The bicycles, if available, are really high grade (BMW: hub grade, Magura hydraulic caliper brake, suspension fork) but unfortunately bad serviced. I didn’t have a single properly working bike (brakes, shifting system, slack splashguards, …). The shuttle service with the karts was really well organized and the staff was really strived to minimize the waiting time. Compliment to the kindness of the drivers and their good service. Clean and nice pool areas but no showers. Clean and beautiful white-sanded beach, but uncomfortable beach chairs. Because of the great distances to Puerto Morelos or Playa del Carmen (City) you need a car or you have to use taxis if you attempt to escape the high-priced Fairmont-Mayakoba-restaurants (with a very different quality). 3.) Sleeping quality Very comfortable beds and cozy bedclothes. No noise or other disturbances. Only the air condition could be less noisy. 4.) Rooms Well spaced and also very cozy but very dark because of the trees next to the terrific big window. In reply to my request for a brighter room there was immediately the question of an additional charge. Because I told them, that I’m not willing to pay more money for a room with bright daylight, they needed more than one and a half hour to check for another room. After this time another room was offered, but it was absolutely similar to the first one, although the Mayakoba was filled only to 40%. Thank you to the management for this outstanding performance. As for the rest we had a problem with a bedside lamp (was solved very fast) and during a rain shower there was a small waterfall in the bathroom, because the top side of the bathroom window was leak. On closer inspection we saw, that there must have been several attempts to tighten the window frame with silicone. The odor in the room was a little bit musty, but in my opinion that is caused by the high humidity, closed windows and air-condition. 5.) Cleanliness At first sight ok, but upon closer examination there was a lot of dust on the furniture, lamps, shutters, ceiling fan and in every nook and corner. That is unacceptable. The shower head in the shower should be exchanged. 6.) Service Altogether the service staff was very attentive and zealous. On the weekend we had long waiting times for the breakfast. We had to wait for more than 15 minutes to get a table and again roundabout 10 minutes to get a fried egg or an omelet. That is unacceptable. But I think this was a management problem. They didn’t considered, that there would be a lot of weekend tourists. One time a table reservation was forgotten. After a short discussion why the reservation was not in the system, we were requested to wait in the hotel lobby and take a drink. We considered this an invitation due to the messed up reservation but this was a misunderstanding. We had to wait for 20 minutes and the tab was on our own account. That must not be and is no customer friendly crisis management. It is the succession of trivialities which are unacceptable for a so-called AAA 5 diamond resort. Ute + Günter (Germany)

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Neha M
Reviews.Content: During check-in, the staff was not able to find our reservation. It seemed like they had given our room to someone else because when we arrived at our room, it wasn't what we paid for and it definitely wasn't ready - unclean shower and tub, bad smell in the room, missing English menus from the guest book. We spent 2 hours trying to get everything resolved to a decent state only to be woken up by a fire alarm two times in the night. When we asked the front desk what had happened they gave us a few different explanations, one of them being "they were testing the alarms" - 4:15 AM in the morning seems an odd time to test alarms. The night of our arrival we went for dinner at La Brisas by the beach. Although they close at 11 PM, they were quite reluctant to serve us when we got there at 10:00 PM. We would have arrived earlier but like I said above, it took us 2 hours to get everything resolved with our check-in and room. Anyway, we told the restaurant staff that we are very hungry and would really appreciate them feeding us. They finally seated us. I have never had to plead to be fed in a restaurant before. All this in one day completely broke our trust in the hotel and its staff. Paying for the internet connection was another shock but I could live with it if the internet was available more than just in the room. We could not access it in La Laguna restaurants and when I asked the staff, they were totally clueless about it.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: David J
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days following 5 days at Blue Bay for our honeymoon. The property is beautiful. The parts we loved was the scenery; the room was gorgeous, and I really mean it was unique, spacious and very high class; I liked the turn down service; the pools are awesome, 2 infinity pools, one over the ocean, and the other over the river; food was delicious; you can ride bicycles around the property if you can find one; they have running stations to provide morning runners with towels and water. Parts we were not thrilled about: the staff wasn't very friendly, and even made us feel uncomfortable at times. Some were great, but most had this depressed attitude. This might have been ok if we didn't just come from another resort where every employee we encountered made us feel like the sun was shining and every day is a celebration; the place is expensive. $15 per person a day for a resort fee, even a cup of coffee in the morning was 5 dollars; the hotel was a breeding ground for mosquitos; the beach was at least a mile away from the rooms, so no ocean view or stroll to the beach without planning to bike or take a cart. We felt a little restricted. Won't be going back. Too many other options in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Service for Kings”
Reviews.Author: Brentis
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend are at the Mayakoba right now and I had to take the time to write about how great this place is. We work for Fairmont (Banff Springs) so we get discounts on rooms at any Fairmont and usually the service for employees is not as great as everyone else (from experience). However, the past couple days we have been here it's been a slice of heaven. They are so helpful and friendly. We have stayed at many Fairmonts and this one takes the cake. It is by far the best hotel I have ever been to. A must see.

Reviews.Title: “Garden of edenGarden of eden”
Reviews.Author: ubmagus
Reviews.Content: Room, pool, service, beach and service were all outstanding. Food was quite good but not aligned with the price. Perfect place if you want to stay in resort and not venture out much. Leaving the premises can be expensive and difficult. Suggest renting a car.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: Travelforlife09
Reviews.Content: Love the resort, the people working there, the beautiful spa and tasty food. Sign up for the Fairmont President's Club(free online) and get gym access and free wifi. Eat at Saffron @ the Banyan Tree - really good Thai food and a good change of pace from mexican/seafood - the bar there is also worth visiting. Mayakoba is just an amazing little place meant for some real R&R!

Reviews.Title: “"May o May" We Love Fairmont Mayakoba!!”
Reviews.Author: Crystal S
Reviews.Content: "How do I love thee, let me count the ways".....Just came back from 11 whole nights in Riviera Maya, 4 of the nights at the Fairmont Mayakoba for our 15 year Anniversary. It is the small details that remind you that you are in a 5 star Hotel. We checked in on 9-16-2011 and found that we had been upgraded, compliments of the Hotel to a signature Casita. The Casita was decorated with flowers on the bed in the shape of a heart with rose petals leading to the bathtub which was also pre-filled with bubble bath and rose petals. Tiny flowers spelled out "Felicidades." Amazing! Later that night we got a knock on the door and were given a fine bottle of Merlot in celebration of our anniversary. Enough said. The grounds of this property are amazing. There is a man-made canal which meanders around the property. If you reserve the boat 24 hours in advance it will take you for a cruise around the property. 12 passenger Golf carts will pick you up and take you wherever you need to go. Food at the restaurants was very good, but I would have liked to see more authentic mexican dishes on the menu. Property was only 10% occupied so we virtually had most of the pools (and there are many), all to ourselves. Pack your insect spray as you will get eaten alive by mosquitos. I sprayed OFF any time we went down to the pool or out to dinner and I was fine. As with any property there were some spots of missing paint. Epai wood on some buildings that needed slight repair, pool tiles missing in some spots, but for the most part this property deserves 5 *****. My husband slipped and fell on one of the bridges on the 3rd day, slightly injuring his left hip--something should be done to protect others who may fall. There is a sign posted "slippery when wet", but with rubber soled shoes it is a lawsuit waiting to happen. Our thanks to staff for making our trip so pleasurable. The Ridino's, Aptos CA.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis Tucked Away on the Beaches of Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: gloriousglobetrotter
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Fairmont Mayakoba after a lot of research in trying to find exactly what we were looking for. When we arrived at the Mayakoba we were entranced from the moment we entered the front gate. The tropical foliage, understated elegance, and casual, but classy design made us reel with excitement for our stay. We stayed in a Deluxe Casita with a King bed and it was perfect. With a cozy bed, large outdoor deck, and sizeable bathroom we knew we would be comfortable. Not being on a canal and being on the second floor we had a good bit of privacy unlike the rooms on the canal and first floor. We took advantage of the bikes and golf carts that are available to guests as part of the per person resort fee, which were very helpful in getting around to all of the parts of the resort. We didn't have any problems with the frequency of the golf carts and saw them running often and didn't have to ever wait long for their arrival. The bikes were a fun change of pace and everyone seemed to enjoy them, but you soon learn that they might not be waiting for you when you needed them again. There were MANY pools and options for guests to lounge. They don't monitor the "adult" pool on the canal very well and children and teens often visit the space because it's the only infinity edge pool canalside. The "adult" swim up bar is another place that children visit and order and play and splash, which makes it a little harder to enjoy your cocktail. The beach pool area gets pretty busy since it's the only pool at the beach, but we didn't ever have a problem getting chairs. We pretty much ate breakfast, lunch, and dinner there for the 3 days we stayed there and every meal was delicious. On our first night we signed up to do the cooking classes, making Arrachera with one of their chefs - I highly recommend it because it was super fun and a little something different. We had everything from empanadas, to fish tacos, to ceviche at their restaurants and it was all amazingly delicious. We also had dinner at La Puerto, their steakhouse, which was very tasty too, we ordered Steak & Lobster, and sides including the macaroni and cheese, I get hungry just thinking about it. I could rave about the grounds of the hotel, the staff, food, and views all day. The only complaint I have is their lack of interest in keeping the kids out of the "adult" areas and with plenty of pools (I can remember 6 pools) it would be nice to have some adult space for those not traveling with kids. I would recommend taking the nature tour as it gives you a better appreciation for the ecological component of the resort. We would go back in a heart beat! It was an amazing stay!

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Mexicatessen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is built around a natural lagoon, and you can see the efforts to respect nature while still caring for a comfortable human experience. All rooms have a view to either the lagoon or the jungle. In our case, the jungle started 1 foot from our room's window, and we had frogs concerts outside our room every night. The room is really cozy, featuring a large bathroom that is designed to get direct sunlight while forbidden outsiders to look into it. Mayakoba's occupies a large surface, and it means that you'll have to travel for miles inside the hotel (not just to get to the beach: the main restaurant is 1/2 mile from the pool area). There is a free, 24/7 public transportation service in operation; as all public transportation services, it gets crowded in rush hours and you may have to wait for as long as 20 minutes to get a cart. There are also a few bikes to alleviate the problem but they are insufficient. My advice: don't travel in rush hours and you'll be fine. While staying there I found that there was a lot of traffic from pools/beach to rooms just before dusk and then again from rooms to restaurants 1-2 hours after dusk. One serious flaw: no wi-fi in rooms: just a LAN adapter. You won't be able to browse using your iPad (unless you bring a special and expensive adapter).

Reviews.Title: “Wished we stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: Explorers377
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Mayakoba after a few days at an all-inclusive resort in Riviera Mayab. Thankfully, our trip was not in the reversa order because we were so pleased with our stay at the Mayakoba that our only disappointment was upon leaving. We visited the hotel with another couple who had been there many times before. We had a room along the river, which was just fantastic - very spacious and very comfortable. We ate at three of the restaurants and enjoyed each one. The grounds were beautiful and the pools as well. The guys played golf at the El Camaleon course and had a great time. We also visited the spa for massages which was a real pleasure. The Fairmont is located next to the Rosewood and Banyan Tree Hotels. We ate dinner at the Banyan Tree one of the evenings and had a delicious dinner at Saffron.

Reviews.Title: “Fairytale Honeymoon that exceeded our high expectations of Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: thelittlestraptor
Reviews.Content: We had such an incredible time at Fairmont Mayakoba! We stayed for a week for our Honeymoon and could not have been happier with our choice of location. We had high expectations, knowing the quality of Fairmont experiences, which were exceeded by the excellent service. So many of the staff went above and beyond their regular duty to make our stay pleasant. Arrival We were greeted immediately upon arrival with cool drinks, told by the concierge that he had been waiting for our arrival and that we were his VIPs. We were then upgraded from a hotel room to one of the Casitas. Check-in was quick and easy and they provided a golf cart shuttle to take us to our room. Our luggage arrived promptly after we did. The Casita (Room) The view from our balcony looked down onto one of the canals that connects the lagoons and we could see Hole 8 of the golf course across the water. (We were later told this was a frequently requested room during the PGA Tour, as guests can watch the play from their room). The room itself was beautiful, spacious and cool. Large shutters allowed us to close out the light and sleep in during the mornings and nap in the afternoons. We enjoyed much of the wildlife that lives in the natural habitat, including fish and a crane that apparently lived in that area of the lagoon. Pools and Beach Both the pools and the hotel beach were pristine and offered bar service. The staff always set up chairs with towels and were prompt with ordered drinks. Getting Around Getting around was easy, the golf cart shuttles came by every 10 minutes, often sooner. Bicycles were readily available at an abundant number of locations. Property Tour We enjoyed the complimentary boat tour of the Fairmont Mayakoba property, and were encouraged to learn that the 45 acres of the hotel development had actually restored an entire Eco-habitat. The abundant wildlife included several species of birds, iguanas, geckos and even small alligators. The water is pristine and the hotel property is beautifully landscaped in a network of canals and lagoons. Food and Dining All of the restaurants on the property were deserving of their 5 Diamond rating. The food was delicious, the service was good and many of the staff remembered us by name after dining there just once or twice. Vibe The resort was full of vacationing families (mainly local Mexicans) and visiting corporate groups. The hotel had a nice social buzz about it, but never felt crowded or unavailable. Spa We splurged on a couples massage at the spa, and were glad that we did. Purchase of a spa treatment also gains you a full day access to the spa's mineral pools, steam rooms and jacuzzis. Activities and Day Trips We very much appreciated the in-house travel agent who helped us book several excursions for great prices and with savvy knowledge. She helped get us the best deals and listened to what we were looking to experience before making recommendations. We paid for tickets right at the hotel, so there was no waiting in line upon arrival at the destinations. Several of the packages included food and transportation. A bus would come pick us up at the hotel, and we would stop at several other resorts and hotels to pick up fellow tourists. Guests staying at other locations were always breathless when pulling up to the Fairmont property, and we had to agree, it's hands-down the jewel of the Rivera Maya. There are so many activities and sites to see nearby, the history and culture are amazing. We were able to visit Mayan Ruins, snorkel, enjoy eco-parks, cave dive and see cultural shows. Honeymoon Extras We were treated with special little surprises in our room nearly every night of our stay there for our honeymoon. Our first night we arrived to rose petals on the bed, with a trail into the bathroom where a bubble bath with rose petals in it was drawn, and robes and slippers laid out. Other nights included chocolate dipped strawberries, a bottle of champagne, notes from our room attendants wishing us a happy honeymoon and even towels folded into a pair of swans on our bed. (We were not charged for any of these "extras" and had not even requested them as a honeymoon package.) Generous Hospitality On our last full day at the hotel, I had a conversation with one of the employees in the Cafe Maya and mentioned how much we had enjoyed our stay and loved honeymooning there. To my surprise and delight, she knocked on our room door that night and had brought an arrangement of flowers and a HOME-MADE card wishing us a happy honeymoon. She said that since we had thought it was so beautiful there, she wanted us to have a memory of the place to take home with us. We were very touched at the thoughtful and gracious hospitality of the staff. Returning and Recommendations We will return as soon as we are able to this lovely location. We highly recommend it as a honeymoon location, or just an enjoyable place to vacation. Some food favorites: The Carne Asada and the Queso Fundido at the Laguna restaurant, and the Mojitos at Las Brisas.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and perfect for children but disappointed in service.”
Reviews.Author: Neha S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Mayakoba at the end of June, the hotel is wonderful. We have 2 small children and they loved the kids club. We came to the Fairmont with a large group to celebrate 3 birthdays, we had asked before hand for a surprise in each room for the birthday guest. This did not happen, after repeated requests nothing was done and no explanation. My 5 year old son whose birthday present was this trip was upset but we made the most of the resort... The pools are amazing, each one offers something different. The room are very well kept, we stayed at the casita and felt like we were living in the rain forest. I would reccomend this resort but I wish management would follow through with requests made.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: oldschooltodd
Reviews.Content: We booked four nights here at the extreme last minute when Hurricane Irene hampered our plans to stay in Vieques, PR. This was my first time in Playa del Carmen. The resort is amazing, and purports to adhere to green/sustainable standards. You can take a boat tour of the grounds for free every day and see small gators, birds, and other wildlife. The spa was amazing, and a day pass is not costly. The service was excellent. But perhaps the best feature was the food. This is not an all inclusive resort, and does not have "all inclusive food". The food at every restaurant was high quality and reasonably priced - but was most excellent was that it felt local and regional. I had ceviche every day and it never got old. The breakfast buffet was delicious, but a little pricey. The beach is beautiful, sand clean, margaritas cold and water clear blue. Many pools and places to disappear and be invisible. We can't wait to return - and we're not even golfers... No time share or other sales pitches either as with other resorts. Go there - enjoy yourself - relax.

Reviews.Title: “ONE OF THE BEST HOTELS IN THE WORLD. WITHOUT ANY DOUBT.”
Reviews.Author: Enrique51
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a family vacation in the Riviera Maya where we stayed at the Fairmont Mayakoba. The service is just outstanding! I've never had a similiar experience in any other hotel in the world, nor even in Asia where I travel quite often for business reasons. You feel pampered 24 hours a day. Enrique

Reviews.Title: “Without a doubt, one of the best hotels in the world!”
Reviews.Author: Eduardo P
Reviews.Content: We went to Fairmont Mayakoba for the first time as a couple, my girlfriend was not very decided to go because she had never stayed at a Fairmont hotel, but we loved it! THe service was outstanding, a waiter named Pedro treated us like royalty, and we will never forget our beatufiul exprience. Bring repelent because it´s an eco hotel and they may bother from time to time! Excelent food also ! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Mexico resort”
Reviews.Author: MEMBER23
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a signature casita last spring at the Fairmont Mayakoba. The resort was not very crowded and service was top notch. We ate in each of the on site restaurants and had good experiences at all of them. I agree with some other reviews about the resort charges, but, it is explained in the reservation process so it came as no surprise. The servers were extremely attentive so much so that one remembered our names and what cocktails we had the previous evening. Beer is resort expensive so stop at the pemex station near the resort gate and stock up. Wi-fi was non existent in the lobby and not available in room which is a major misstep for a five star hote. We enjoyed the resort so much that are going back this fall.

Reviews.Title: “Was terrific both times we stayed, including a destination wedding.”
Reviews.Author: wjk3
Reviews.Content: I have been to Playa del Carmen on many occasions. My wife and I first stayed here in January, 2011. We went to scope out the area in connection with our son's upcoming April, 2011 wedding there. In January and April the service was first rate, the food at the on site restaurants very good, the grounds enchanting, and the management attentive and helpful. I know some reviews commented about a bad wedding experience, but we did not experience such. yes, we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Eco Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wiljor
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a short stay at the Fairmont Maya Coba and we really enjoyed our stay. The hotel is beautiful and is set in a eco friendly atmosphere with large rooms they call "casitas" We booked our trip from Expedia and when we arrived we were shocked to see so many people, that's because there was a huge group there and the hotel was full. When we got to the front desk and were checking in we asked if we could have our rooms together as we had our 4 children with us. The front desk person said "even better, since we are full we will move you to the beach where you will have better access to everything" My wife booked a superior suite with a canal view and when we herd BEACH, we thought great, they are giving us a nice upgrade. Well, turned out that we were close to the beach, but ended up with jungle view, or no view at all. That was really the only glitch in the stay. One night while we were having drinks in the lobby bar we happened to mention this to the girl serving us drinks, as we were curious as to the different sizes of rooms etc... She in turn brought over the front desk manager, Guillermo, and we explained to him what happen with our room change. He was very nice and explained that the front desk person on duty thought maybe we would be happier closer to the beach and was very apologetic and said that the intention was not made to make us uncomfortable. We were ok with his explanation. Dinner the first night was great, but very expensive, 500 usd for the six of us, but the service was good and so was the food. Be prepared to spend allot while dining at the hotel, although breakfast was included. The staff were very nice and always had a smile and were very helpful and attentive. It was a place that we really enjoyed and will return again some day. The kids had a blast and were always enjoying the pool area as they have a water slide as well. We had 2 rooms and they were big and well decorated with huge bathrooms and shower area and a nice size terrace to sit out, just don't get jungle view. All in all I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for an upscale place that is eco friendly, family oriented and away from the hustle and bustle of Cancun and Playa Del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “President's Club Trip! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: HarmonS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mayakoba in April 2011 on my husband's president's club trip. The company had a couple thousand + employees/spouses at four resorts: Secrets Capri, Mayakoba, Banyan Tree and Grand Velas. We enjoyed the Mayakoba. The rooms were excellent. The bathrooms were lovely, no jetted tub but very nice otherwise. The staff was nice. The beach was lovely and the beachside pool was great. Several company events were held at the property, there was plenty of space and made it very convenient for the ones staying on the property. Loved the bikes. Walked down to the beach one time, rode the golf cart shuttle back, be warned that is one long walk, rode bikes to/from after that experience. Took a gandola ride thru the property's waterway. A must do, make your reservation when you arrive. Loved the restaurant by the beach, great food. Our nightly meals were planned company events but the lunches were excellent and breakfast was good. The beachside pool staff was awesome. They kept a fresh towel on your chair and the bar staff kept a cool drink in your hand. Lovely trip, lovely place to stay! This trip caused us to plan a family vacation to the region in August 2011.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Rest”
Reviews.Author: sceezicks
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a last minute trip to the Fairmont Mayakoba. What a wonderful resort. There are 3 resorts sharing some amenities, they include the Banyan tree, and the rosewood. All three are lovely resorts with exceptional restaurants. The pool areas at the Fairmont are luxurious and very nicely designed. We really enjoyed our Tree house like suite. Highly recommend this resort area.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Mayakoba defines five-star Mexican luxury.”
Reviews.Author: Joseph C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Mayakoba from July 29th to August 9th, and it was truly a five star family vacation. The service was not only attentive, but sincerely concerned about each member of our family. The small touches like sending a gift, flowers, a "Teddy Bear Marshmallow", and stickers when my daughter got stung by a bee are small examples of the sincerity behind this five-star service. This service, coupled with a stunning authentic "Mayan" beach location makes the Fairmont Mayakoba a not-to-miss family vacation spot.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful. You won't regret it!”
Reviews.Author: Cangrejoplayero
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at least three times at the Fairmont Mayakoba and all of them have proviede us with distinguished experiences. Though a little bit expensive, when in Cancun or Playa del Carmen, this hotel brings you real comfort and amazing views both of the hotel and of the coastal zone. Food is really good, but not all of the dishes served there are to be considered as real Mexican. Generally speaking, personnel is friendly and would help you very much with everything. If money is not an issue for you, do try to stay in any of the Casitas with view to the ponds. Only one major piece of advice: if your go on a honeymoon or so, avoid holiday seasons in Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing mother daughter vacation”
Reviews.Author: SashaGs
Reviews.Content: Had a great vacation here for three days with my mother. It was clearly a large hotel but you never felt lost in the fray. The food, especially at the restaurant which was not on the beach, was great! Authentic Mexican dishes including an entire fish wrapped in banana leaves and sauced spectacularly. The drinks were also superb.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Fairmonts I've seen”
Reviews.Author: niklovestotravel
Reviews.Content: As a member of the Fairmont President's Club program, I've stayed at several of their hotels across the globe and this is one of the most impressive I've seen. The grounds are very large and beautifully kept. The room: we upgraded to a Signature Casita, and it was pretty large. The bathroom was top-notch. But, the pool area wasn't as impressive.. at least for what we were looking for. As a young couple (late 20s), we definitely enjoyed staying at the resort, but it definitely suits families moreso than couples. The pool area is usually a pretty accurate barometer of the type of resort you're at, and here, it's clear, it's a family oriented place. There is an adult pool, as other reviews have outlined, but they didn't compare to the neighbouring hotels we visitted (Banyan Tree and Rosewood). That said it's the cheapest of the 3. There are bikes, and shuttles to get you around the large resort. We're a pretty athletic couple but in the blazing heat, you'll be happy to have the option of a ride. Even if you're on your way to the gym.. Which we did check out. As FPC members, we got to use the facilities for free. It's basic, but it's got everything you'll need. I think they even offered some classes. In terms of food, we ate at El Puerto, and weren't blown away. Service was good, but the food wasn't memorable. Or worth the price. So we decided to try the neighboring resorts' restaurants. The 3 hotels offer shuttles back and forth. We really enjoyed Punta Bonita at the Rosewood, and headed over the Agave Azul Raw Bar for a few cocktails afterwards. We also ate lunch at Banyan Tree and it was a fantastic experience. Tips - sign up for FPC. You'll get free access to the gym and free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Exceded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: FlyBonanza
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel concept. The food at La Laguna was excellent and a lot of things to choose from. Absolutely a must is their Tikin Xic fish and the Cochinita Pibil Tacos. El Puerto is also very good. They do charge a "resort fee" that only includes transportation to and from your room and a tour over the canal. I do not believe that an extra fee should be charged to use the exercise equipment. A hotel at this category and price should include the gym. Another fee must be paid if one wants to use the wet areas of the spa. That fee is ok for me to pay because you do get something "extra" and those areas are beautiful. Internet wireless at the casitas does not work and it is way overpriced (they also have wired). Parking is also extra and is not included on the "resort fee". Prices are in dollars at a slightly favorable (to them) exchange rate. Service is excellent. All employees, especially the ones that are from the Yucatan area, provide outstanding service.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, poor staff”
Reviews.Author: Creazy
Reviews.Content: Building surrounded by nature as its best. Expect long waits for transport, don't ever leave jewelery or valuables stuff in the room, at the beach side nor the pool area as you'll get robbed and no one seems to care about. Don't ever complain to hotel staff, they are always doing things right, they will surely blame it on other guests acts. Other than that all will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely but stingy”
Reviews.Author: MayaPlaya1
Reviews.Content: The grounds are absolutely breathtaking -- you can zip from the pools (nestled on a mini-island amongst the lagoons) to the beach on a bike, enjoy the breathtaking beach and later have a luscious margarita on the deck of the main building. All amazing. The only downside was how very stingy this resort is. There is no such thing as complementary coffee in the morning and if you forget to bring your own, expect to shell out $5 for a small bottle of water on the beach. Heaven forbid if you run out of sunblock -- the cheapest bottle I found was $26 (that's US dollars). And the airport transfer was a whopping $170 -- it's only half an hour to Cancun airport! This nickel- and-dime mentality was in stark contrast to the otherwise luxurious and peaceful nature of the resort. It's a shame because otherwise it really would be paradise!

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite vacations”
Reviews.Author: geminijohn
Reviews.Content: I returned yesterday from a six night stay at the Fairmont Mayakoba, and since I have read these reviews avidly for several months, I thought that I should write my own. I just have a hard time describing how much I enjoyed my experience at the Fairmont. The property is absolutely beautiful. As the resort description states, it is beach, mangrove and jungle. We reserved a signature casita and it was very beautiful with a big balcony over one of the lagoons, a very comfortable bedroom and a big marble bath, with a picture window looking out at a walled jungle garden. From the time that we arrived, we were treated beautifully by the bell men, the people at the front desk ,and the guys who bring your luggage to the room . My original plan was to spend most of my time in Playa and pretty much just sleep at the hotel, but that really changed quickly. After a couple of days I did not want to leave the property at all. The beach area was really nice and clean, good beach with palapas and lounge chairs. The resort pools are magnificent. The master pool complex is really huge with all kinds of different areas for sunning reading and relaxing. The adult infinity pool is placed over a large lagoon. I sat there for hours just watching the birds and feeling really gad to be right where I was. We ate at all three of the restaurants and enjoyed them all. One evening we sat at the bar at Las Brisas restaurant (at the beach) and had dinner at the bar with a clear view of the lights of Cozumel across the water. It was amazing. We started most every evening with drinks in the lobby. The ladies in the lobby area took fine care of us (thank you Mariana and Carina ) and we enjoyed Melonie who played Alicia Keyes style music on the piano and sang in a most relaxing manner. Her music was perfect in this Caribbean venue. Transportation around the resort is by foot, by bicycle (they are everywhere) and by golf cart (they circulate through the resort constantly always ready to take you from lobby to the beach or anywhere between). The guys who drive the buses are friendly and courteous. If you have stuck with me this far, I have something else to say about a couple of the earlier posts. Yes, occasionally you have to wait a few minutes for a golf cart to the lobby or a cocktail on the beach, and I did not mind at all. Maybe we are getting a little too used to a "drive through mentality". I saw parents using the time waiting for the shuttle to show their kids stuff about the plants on the property; waiting for a drink on the beach I always have my book to read, or can just look around ( and looking around is pretty super). Maybe a vacation is a good chance to slow down a bit, and if that bothers you, maybe it is more your issue than the hotels. I loved this trip. This property. These people. I have been fortunate to travel to some very nice places, and stay in some excellent resorts, Fairmont Myakoba is now at the top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: drftwdsflm
Reviews.Content: Very beautiful, excellent food, fantastic service, extremely comfortable, inviting vibe. Some of this atmosphere I probably just credit to the warm people of the region, but really this was a delightful playground. Getting around the resort on bikes and go carts was not a problem at all and helped add to the "you're in another world" feeling. I would say the restaurants, beaches, pool, and overall layout were the best aspects. Drawbacks - the villas didn't all have good views and were in little canals/lanes; also, there was a sense of getting nickel and dimed from time to time at the hotel for little charges. Restaurants a strong plus - ask for the habanero salsa! Concierge also organized some day trips for us and my experience at spa was quite good although some in my party were disappointed by how weak/inexperienced the masseuses were (a few women made sure to only ask for men or someone with very strong hands after that!). Beach side drink service isn't super fast, but are you really in a hurry when you're on the beach? Food was great, forget what you hear about water in Mexico when at a resort like this (pls note I said at a resort like this - not everywhere!). We all had the water, fresh fruit, raw fish, etc... No problems. Health standards on resort were top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic resort.”
Reviews.Author: pjwjr
Reviews.Content: Like others, my wife and I were concerned by some of the comments about service. But we found the hotel staff to be friendly, courteous, and attentive. The resort was one of the most beautiful we have ever stayed in, the room, a deluxe casitas for which we received an upgrade was gorgeous. The pools are amazing, and the beach terrific. You even have access to two grass tennis courts (wish I had brought my racquet). Food is expensive, but no different than any other luxury resort. The restaurant in the main bldg. was the best. Get the grilled snapper.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, wonderful staff, great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Camper_NOLA
Reviews.Content: We booked on a great special off-season rate with Fairmont. I've never stayed at a bad Fairmont, but I was concerned after reading many of the negative reviews. However, we had a wonderful experience and this property fully lives up to the Fairmont brand. Check in was very smooth and we started out our stay in a Casita with a jungle view close to the main building. Our casita was great - spacious and beautiful. We could walk to the main building, to the family pool, adult pool and Laguna restaurant from our location. As expected, the resort is very spread out and we had no problems finding a bike, or getting a ride in a cart if needed. The service at the pools, beach and restaurants was perfect -attentive but not intrusive. When we arrived there was a large group at the resort, but servers were running up and down the beach making sure everyone was happy. We had a problem with a water main and unexpected construction behind our room and because of that they promptly upgraded us to a beach area casita -which was truly spectacular- it came with a rooftop pool and a butler! A special shout out to Mario Martinez who handled the situation so quickly and made our vacation so special. Food was priced similar to other Fairmont properties I've visited. (Overall Mexico is much more expensive then I remember. 2 slices of pizza and a coke at the airport will now run you $20 dollars!) In light of that I think the pricing was on par for the area. The 'El Puerto' restaurant was my favorite – in particular the sea salt encrusted ribeye, and don't miss the short ribs in merlot sauce - they were spectacular! We only went into Playa one day - it was 40 dollars round trip in a taxi- so if you plan to go frequently you should rent a car from the airport, or from the travel agent in the hotel. We had dinner one night at the Banyan Tree thai restaurant and the setting is beautiful - very pricey, but worth it. My boyfriend played the El Camaleon golf course and loved it – challenging and with beautiful scenery. It is also worth taking the boat tour of the resort, the lagoons are lovely and we saw iguanas, birds and an alligator. As noted in other reviews, if you book a Fairmont room you will be in the main building and will almost have a private pool to yourself- we never saw anyone at that pool the whole time we were there. The only negative is we had to leave! BTW: we booked USA transfers online. They were waiting for us outside the airport and showed up promptly to take us back to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: travelynch
Reviews.Content: I am not one to say i would ever go back to the same resort with all of the quality destinations that are out there, but this hotel has me feeling like i have to go back. It was great from start to finish. Yes the resort is big and a little spread out, but who cares. Are we so pathetic that we can't get into a golf cart or take a bike to the beach? I enjoyed that part of it. Food was good, rooms were great. Beach was very nice. Staff was accomodating. Alcoholic drinks were a little light, but asking for a double cures that. There are a lot of people that are scared to travel to Mexico right now, but there wasn't one second of this vacation where i felt anything but safe. I would go back in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Good/Confortable hotel but not necessarily in same league as others in the area”
Reviews.Author: miss_saigonlondon
Reviews.Content: It is so difficult to write a review while being objective. We stayed here over Christmas, when the hotel was packed. This was not our favourite choice but it was the only one flexible enough to let us stay there 5 nights and not 10. Will I go back? No. But I can still recommend it as a good alternative to stay in the area. The hotel is confortable, it is in a nice area and as part of the huge complex you benefit from being able to eat out in other restaurants (Except Banyan TREE). After walking around the area I think I can say that the beach right in front of the hotel is the best within Mayakoba. Both Rosewood & Banyan have rocks in front or more of a decline when entering the sea. Having said that the beach is nice but FAR from being heavenly... Other plus; the swimming pools here are TOP NOTCH and they are heated (the adults only is not) .I have a very active small daughter and she loved being in the pool all day. If you are there, take the canal trip, it is quite nice and we saw lots of animals (inc crocs). The hotel is really big (this is something I do not generally like) but even when full, you could not really tell. There were plenty of buggies to keep you moving. Minuses: rooms are on the basic side and soulless. Food is average to say the least (please note BIG PORTIONS do not equal GOOD FOOD, some dishes were simply inedible). Service in the restaurants was hit and miss. If you want to eat well go to Rosewood, food is delicious there & they have proper coffee. And here they charge you for everything, spa, gym, parking, etc etc... Having said that and having viewed/visited other places, this place is good for a big group. Or if you like us want to visit the mayan riviera in December.

Reviews.Title: “All Around Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: PhillyVoyager
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay at the Fairmont, just as I would have expected from a Fairmont. We booked at a great off season rate and I was a little hesitant after reading some of the reviews, but have not even one complaint. Grounds: Incredible, the resort is set on a nature preserve with a lagoon and environmentally friendly casitas sprinkled around the property. This results in it being a bit of a walk at times, but hey you're on vacation and there's lots of options (bike, call for a golf cart) if you don't want to walk. The pools were especially beautiful. There was a wide variety of birds who lived on the grounds. The beach was fine. Rooms: Wonderful, large rooms with a huge bathroom. We had a few issues on arriving that were quickly attended to after one call to the front desk. All casita rooms have a balcony with variable views.
