Ours was a jungle view which meant trees and the back of the maintenance area and I would have preferred a lagoon view, but it was fine-- peaceful, relaxing, and a great place to watch birds from. Restaurants: Others have complained about the quality, cost, and service, but I found them to be fine. We ate mostly at El Lagoon, with a great view of the lagoon. The food was good, about what I would have expected it to cost at a similar restaurant in Philadelphia, and the service was excellent. The servers were not intrusive and gave you plenty of time, but were attentive when needed. Service in General: Everyone was friendly and helpful. My compliments to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, wine knowledge and kindness”
Reviews.Author: LouiseOrlando
Reviews.Content: Really good service, we stayed in another resorts, but actually, you can not even compare, is gorgeous and the rooms really clean. About the food, we enjoyed the mexican cuisine, but mainly, el puerto restaurant. The staff was wonderful and corteous in all the areas. The young manager wondered us a complete display of wine knowledge and kindness. The service was absolutely great¡ Highly recommended¡¡¡¡ We will come back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Service, beautiful resort, and fantastic rooms”
Reviews.Author: energy1121
Reviews.Content: The service is incredible. When we checked in (we had left another resort and booked on expedia that morning), they didn't have our reservation in the system yet and upgraded us to a better room. One night I had a stomachache and called down to the concierge. She spoke with the manager so that they could open the hotel store and had a bellboy send a pepto bismol to my room at 2am (and they didn't even charge a ridiculous amount for it). The room was incredible (I believe on expedia the upgraded room from the standard one was only $20-40 more and I'd totally recommend it). Very comfortable bed, spacious, well lit, huge bathrooms, beautiful design and overall a hotel room that you want to stay in when you're on vacation. I literally could have stayed in the room the entire vacation :) The pools are beautiful and so is the private access oceanside beach. The only thing I'd recommend is to skip the food. We ate at the Laguna restaurant and the food was unimpressive. We ordered the tortilla soup, laguna salad and shrimp. Room service was what you'd expect, not great but not horrible (ordered the nachos here). Otherwise, the hotel is beautiful and I'd highly recommend overall.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: mleafs
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont Maykoba for a 5 day convention with a large group. The rooms were fantastic, my only complaint was the shower pressure was poor, and the hot water in the bathtub did not work. I understand this is a plumbing problem in all of Mexico, as I experienced the same pheonomena in my shower at another Mexico location I stopped at on the way back to the US. The Conference facilities were top notch, the common area's especially the lobby and entrance ways, are impressive. The hotel and other neighboring Hotels have done an excellent job in preserving the envirorenment, which is a rich lagoon full of wildlife. It is a must to take the free boat ride along the Lagoon, it is free. But, you must reserve it in advance 24 hours. I read earlier reviews of complaints that the Resort is so huge, but the fact is it's not that big of a deal, because their are golf carts that do round the clock rounds to help people go from station to station, plus Bicycles are free to use at no cost. My wife and I ate several meals at the pool restaurant and the Beach restaurant, and I found the food to be "OK", not bad not great. Service can be slow, but avoid the problem by not eating at peak times. The resort makes it's $ on booze which is highly priced, but any traveler know's there are ways to avoid that issue. I also recommend going to the neighbor resorts for lunch or dinner, the food in the one resort directly south of Mayakoba's has way better food. Overall, a great time, great beach, and great location!

Reviews.Title: “Picture Perfect Wedding!!”
Reviews.Author: jillayne
Reviews.Content: We hosted a wedding of 110 people at the Fairmont Mayakoba in May 2011 and it was absolutely perfect!! The resort is gorgeous and unlike any we had been to before....lots of nature to see, pristine jungle and beach, and a wonderful staff that makes you feel like you are the only one there. The food is also delicious and the grounds stunning with something green everywhere you look. The golf carts to pick you up are quick or you can hop on a bicycle for a short, leisurely ride....it is so different from any other resort in Mexico, and we had been to many of them. We spent 8 months planning our events and activities for our wedding with Lino Simonin, a Wedding Coordinator at the hotel, and he made everything smooth and seemless. He responded to emails very quickly, had every single detailed outlined, and made everything so easy under the usual stresses of wedding planning. He was the BEST! Wilberth, our butler, was also amazing! He greeted us everyday with a smile and was always ready to assist with any task (which there were many when we neared the wedding day). He was friendly, and even made us a sweet card at the end of our stay with all of our guests signatures and a special note. He spent the time to make it the most memorable day for us, as did Lino, and we are so appreciative for that. Brides....if you are looking for an amazing, unique, romantic setting for your wedding day...this is it. I looked at every single hotel from Cancun to Playa del Carmen to Tulum and the Fairmont Mayakoba is absolutely the best pick. There is only one wedding a day and you truly feel supported the whole way through. Also, the options are endless of locations to do wedding events at the hotel and they are all stunning. We can not thank Fairmont Mayakoba enough for making our wedding weekend so memorable and enjoyable for everyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful in so many ways”
Reviews.Author: lynpf
Reviews.Content: I must start by saying I was a bit nervous after reading reviews here before our trip. I was traveling with my husband and daughter. We had booked several months ahead and were hoping for the best. On arrival at Cancun airport , we were met by a wonderful driver arranged by the hotel. He was ready for us with cold wash cloths and chilled bottles of water. The ride was about 40 minutes in a brand new SUV. As we entered the lobby, we were greeted with a welcome drink and escorted to the front desk. Check in was quick. Our room was a Signature Casita located about in the middle of the resort near "The Island" ( a pool, cafe, restaurant complex). We were first floor and had a balcony overlooking the lagoon. The balcony was large and had a table and 2 comfortable chairs. We were able to see boats as they would float by and lots of fish that would swim up to greet us whenever we walked out. The room was a bit larger than average hotel rooms, featuring the most amazing bathroom! 2 sinks with plenty of storage, an oversized glass door shower, and seperate tub. Behind the tub was a floor to ceiling glass wall that looked out to a small garden with a privacy wall behind it ( beautiful at night with the lights lit). There were 3 restaurants to choose from. We had lunch and dinner a few times at Las Brisas at the beach. The food was a nice selection of salads and sandwiches for lunch, and a varied menu for dinner. We had our buffet breakfasts ( which were included as part of a package) at La Laguna Restaurant which was on The Island. Wonderful selection of hot and cold foods, good variety. Dinner here a few nights was enjoyable. The third restaurant ,El Puerto, was located in the main building near the lobby. My husband said it was the best steak dinner he has had in many years! There were 4 or 5 pools to choose from around the resort. Although the entire complex covers a huge area, you can choose to walk, bicycle, or be driven by golf cart. The paths are well maintained and easy to navigate. The bikes are located in several areas where you can take one and leave it at your destination for the next guest to use. The golf carts are continuously run by the staff, picking you up and delivering to your desired spot, whether the beach, pool, a restaurant, or the lobby. They were always going both directions and we never waited more than a minute or 2. Often times we were stopped while walking and offered a ride by a passing cart. Now about the service...I had read many poor reviews and was wondering what we would find. Well, I must say I have been to many hotels and have seen the good and the not so good. This staff was by far the best, most professional and courteous staff I have ever encountered. From the bellmen upon arrival ( and each time we left and returned to the resort) to the concierge staff ( most helpful with travel advice and finding allergy medicine at a local pharmacy which they had shipped to our room). The housekeeping staff was always friendly when we met them out and about, and graciously returned to our room 3 nights to do turndown service after we missed them on their rounds. They even delivered flowers and set up an aromatherapy bath for my daughter when they knew she wasn't feeling well. We were treated to a very nice bottle of red wine left by the staff one night. The restaurant, bar and pool service staff was equally exceptional. They met us and walked us to our beach chairs each day, setting up umbrellas and towels to make us comfortable. Drinks were brought quickly when requested, although we were never interrupted by the bar staff. The restaurant staff would greet us by name at each meal and were very attentive and friendly, always willing to talk with us a bit if we engaged them in conversation. Each and every employee that we would meet while out walking would greet us with a warm and genuine smile, many times asking " Is there anything I can do for you?". There were a few bands and music groups that would perform nightly at the restaurants They were a nice back-ground touch. If you are looking for an active party atmosphere, this is not the place for you. You are surrounded by gardens, trees, mangroves and lots of peaceful areas around the resort. Wifi is available by all the main public areas, and is free if you sign up for Presidents Club, also free! To get to Playa del Carmen, you must take a taxi which is about a 15 minute ride. There is not much to do at the resort but relax, read, work on your tan and connect with family and friends over great food in a beautiful setting. Back home to reality now. I miss being treated like royalty and can not wait to return again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort, top- notch Service and Quality”
Reviews.Author: Mooser81
Reviews.Content: Girlfriend and I stayed here while on business and made it into a nice relaxing vacation! From the get-go, the service was impeccable! One of cleanest hotels I have ever stayed in and the staff was more than friendly and accomodating. After reading some reviews on trip advisor prior to the trip, the most common gripe was the size of the resort, forcing people to walk, ride a bicycle or take the golf carts. I thought it was AWESOME and so easy to get around! (I quickly realized that these gripes most likely came from the "obese, hate-any-form of excersize" crowd.") The one 'con' is the location, meaning that if you didnt have a rental car, you have to taxi to town for any kind of night life. Other than this, I would highly recommend the Fairmont. Playa is hurting right now, so there are tons of deals to go and stay in that area.

Reviews.Title: “babymoon”
Reviews.Author: kdch1
Reviews.Content: This place has an amazing location, beautful beaches and amazing grounds. I've never seen anything like it before, and to think the lagoons were all man made. It's expensive when you arrive there but it's a Fairmont, it's the best of the best in hotels. Kid friendly and felt extremely safe on the grounds and en route to and from hotel. Food is average and staff is hospitable and welcoming. Overall we enjoyed our stay very much and plan to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good not great, inconsistent service, missed opportunity by Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaToTheWorld
Reviews.Content: Had a very underwhelming stay at the Fairmont Mayakoba. Arrived at 4pm to a nice cold towel and small welcome drink, but then had to wait an hour for room to be available and were offered nothing in the meantime. Booked into Deluxe Casita Room, on the positive it was a very good size with extremely comfortable beds, and a really nice bathroom. But on the downside definitely had the musty smell I've seen many people refer to, the "view" was of jungle vegetation literally a foot or two away from the patio. Felt very claustrophobic. Also poor use of the ample room - small table, enough room for one to dine let alone four. Big wide open spaces which would have been better with shelves, drawers etc for storage. The resort is very large and you have to get the bikes or buggies everywhere. Problem with buggies is there are just never enough of them, and of course everyone waiting forgets their manners at home and just push to get on the first one that shows up. "Oh I didn't realize you were waiting too...". No I just like hanging out at buggy stops! And the problem with the bikes is the same ... not enough of them at each stop, people just take them and lock them up. I also could not find one bike that did not have something wrong with it. Service at the beach was excellent. Very prompt, very proactive, very efficient. Service at the pool was shockingly bad. Took half an hour to attract one pool guy. Took a very complex order - two Coronas. They NEVER showed up! We went back to room maybe 90 minutes later having not seen a single other pool service guy. A new world record for me. Lifeguard was similarly missing in action. He would show up when it was all little kids and stand there and bark for them to wait their turn on the water slide. Then when a gang of 15-16 year old teenagers showed up and started bullying their way round, pushing in front of everyone on the slide, blocking the water, stopping other kids play, he was nowhere to be seen. Food is generally very mediocre. I get better Guacamole in North Carolina. I really wish I was exaggerating, but I am not. La Laguna is all middle of the road mush. El Puerto is nice if you stay off the main steak/fish menu (the duck and short rib were truly excellent). I had filet one night and it was very bad. Over salted under cooked (since when is medium rare completely uncooked for 80% of the meat?) Service was intermittent - some of the staff were truly outstanding, others right down the other end. Very inconsistent. I will say in La Laguna on my daughters birthday the service we got from Rocky was outstanding and a highlight of the entire trip. He treated her and us like royalty. If only they could hire more like this! There is nowhere in the main building to eat lunch. So when we came to check out I had to get on a bike to go to the store to get us something so we could eat before leaving. Absurd. And yes I did have to push hard for the 1 hour late checkout, explaining we were checked in 2 hours late and our room never got made up until 4pm every day. The property itself is very nice. The pools are excellent, the kids pool a lot of fun with a good size water slide. And the beach is very nice, though quite rocky and quite narrow. That said it is far superior to the one in front of the significantly more expensive Banyan Tree that is next door.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property/Good Value”
Reviews.Author: JLTP
Reviews.Content: Just a couple of things to add to previous reviews: 1) You should consider staying in the main building rather than the casitas, as the value is much better and the lagoon you view from the casitas is rather murky. 2) Absolutely take advantage of the golf course on the property, which hosts an annual PGA Tour event, yet isn't unplayable for less talented golfers; 3) When ordering dinner at the fine Las Brisas Restaurant at the beach, be sure to order the souffle of the day. We had two different varieties and they were out of this world delicious; 4) Seek out special offers from Fairmont. We received a 4th night free.

Reviews.Title: “We're ready to go back already!”
Reviews.Author: ChelsePark
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 6 days at the Fairmont Mayakoba for her birthday. We've been to "Cancun" many times before but always stayed in the hotel zone. This was our first in the Playa area and within 30 minutes of arriving agreed this is our new "Cancun" vacation destination. The resort is beautiful from the minute you enter thru the huge entrance from the highway and get's better with each minute up thru the winding driveway to the resort main building. We were greeted by our sur name soon as we exited our VIP shuttle and then given cold hand towels and a refreshing drink. Check in was under 2 minutes and we were immediately escorted to our suite by Aldia (not sure of the correct spelling). He explained the resort and even brought our luggage so we didn't have to wait for the bellman to bring it. He was extremely polite and a true professional. The suite was the nicest we have ever stayed at and having traveled the world and stayed at Ritz Carleton's etc that is saying quite a bit. If you have the option, upgrade to a suite and you will not be let down. Within 5 minutes of being in our room our butler Oliver knocked on our door and introduced himself and explained that he is available for anything we need, reservations, cars etc. We truly feel that Oliver was one of the highlights of this stay. He was incredibly polite, professional, attentive and all around a great individual. He would find us at any of the pools, beach or restaurants throughout the day just to see if we need anything, make reservations for dinner, schedule cars and or follow up on a previous request. Oliver and Hayde (Fairmont President's Club Manager) even sent a wonderful bottle of wine to our room for my wife's birthday. If the hotel management reads this and the other wonderful reviews mentioning Oliver please promote him! The resort itself is huge, beautiful and relaxing. You actually forget where you are and feel like it's in the middle of nowhere. The main pool is one of the nicest I have ever seen, pictures really don't do this resort justice. If you stay at this resort make sure you spend at least one night at the Lobby bar and have a cocktail overlooking the resort. The only negative things I can say are that service at the pool bars was very slow and service by the adult only pool was almost nonexistent. Also prices for food and drinks are high for Mexico and on par with Miami, New York etc. All said we are planning to return end of June for our anniversary! BTW....There is PLENTY of nightlife minutes away in Playa Del Carmen. Lounges, nightclubs, bars, beach bars and nightclubs etc. For nightlife tell your taxi 5th and 12th street.....some of the nightclubs are open until 6-7am.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best!”
Reviews.Author: hkparadise
Reviews.Content: I think the overall reviews are consistent. This property is fabulous in so many respects. The rooms and terraces are comfortable, private and relaxing in feel. The staff works hard to keep all of the areas where guests wander - groomed. Room service is prompt and I love the fresh ice in the bucket each afternoon. The boat ride thru the property is a highlight. One hour, free, and you'll have a sense of the breadth of the resort. Crocidiles, iguanas, and all sorts of wildlife ( golfers included). So as I'd rate this one of the nicest resort experiences I have had, I need to reaffirm that the service at the pools and beach is attrocious. Wait times for food and drinks are long and delivery is faster if you called NY and had it delivered FedEx. I read previous reviews. It is consistent. How such a profit center is ignored is beyond me! I told the front desk I was going to add a review and he said they had someone monitoring them. Well, to whoever is reading this.........triple the staff at the waters (beach and pool). Otherwise your resort is fabulous. I recommend it. """

Reviews.Title: “Too big and too generic”
Reviews.Author: SFfoodlover
Reviews.Content: I feel bad about the fact that I hated this hotel, since it is so luxurious. But it just was not my cup of tea. We arrived here from Tulum, where we stayed in a charming, lovely, small hotel right on a perfect stretch of beach. When we arrived at the Fairmont Mayakoba, we were a bit shell-shocked. The location of the hotel is not great, for starters. It's just a little too far from Playa del Carmen to make going into town easy. And it located along a stretch of highway with one gigantic resort after another. The big, glitzy, security-manned entrances to these mega-resorts make the area look like Las Vegas. Once inside, I agree that the property is pretty and well-maintained but it is simply too big and too generic. I don't want to go to a beach resort where I have to take a golf cart to go to the beach! Plus, when you stay at a hotel like this, you sort of feel like you could be anywhere--Florida, Hawaii, Mexico, whatever. There is no local flavor and nothing about it that screams anything other than "Fairmont". The food is average and expensive! Be prepared to pay top dollar for everything. We came here with our kids, expecting a resort with lots of activities for them. (They are 11 and 7.) Instead the vibe was more of a geriatric golf resort. Our room was lovely and large. The pools are pretty. But I would not go back and I would not recommend this hotel to families with similar sensibilities as ours.

Reviews.Title: “Unreasonable staff and manager”
Reviews.Author: jsgarrett
Reviews.Content: We booked our vacation at the Fairmont and when the Texas Department of Public Safety put out a travel advisory for the week that we were supposed to travel to the Mayakoba advising of the danger in the general area of the hotel, we decided to cancel our trip to that location. The hotel did not deny that danger exists in the area, but claimed that we would be safe on their property. Despite warnings from a United States agency, the Fairmont refused to refund our deposit or apply it to another Fairmont at another time. The home office of the Fairmont (Canada) told me that in situations of global violence, refunds are usually granted but the Mexican management refused.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty, Relaxing with Expensive Food”
Reviews.Author: Piratelady
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Mayakoba certainly impresses. The service was impeccable for valet and front desk staff. Upon entering they have several fountains and a large lagoon. The grounds are beautiful with tons of flowering trees and bushes. Birds are everywhere in many different colors. I keep stopping to enjoy them. The bathrooms in the rooms are what make this resort really stand out. Just like the pictures show there is a soaking tub and separate with an outdoor bamboo display (private). It is SO relaxing to lay on the bed and watch the palm trees swaying or soak in a bath and stare out upon the bamboo. Bringing nature into that degree and making each suite/room feel private is an excellent choice. I also enjoyed the spa while I was there and the facilities, which I paid $40 to use, where excellent. I travel around the world to different spas and this is in my top 5. They have a warm mineral pool and a cool pool on the roof, then a private ladies area with another large jacuzzi, swiss shower, and steam room. They provide cold washcloths and tons of comfortable chairs and lounges. It was simply heaven. The only negative is the expensive food. I don't mind a few expensive meals, but with a family a $100+ for each lunch and dinner (NOT including drinks) is a bit much for my taste. I'm more of the $100 - $120/day variety. =)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Facility, spotty service/restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Karl1111
Reviews.Content: Overall, we had a wonderful time at the Fairmont. The property and facilities were beautiful. While on site, we stayed in both a Fairmont View Room and a Signature Casita Room which was secluded away from the walkways and overlooking the lagoon. While the Fairmont room was very nice, the Casita was extraordinary. Although only about 30 square feet larger than the Fairmont room, the Casita seemed much larger and much more elegant. The bathroom was considerably larger, with an expansive rain shower. The balcony was also about 1.5 - 2 times larger. The property grounds were well maintained with walkways leading through the surrounding jungles and mangroves. There were three main pool areas on the property. Unless you are staying on the beach, the beachfront is about a 10 minute walk away. But there are a number of available bikes and golf carts will also shuttle you around the property for free. The one complaint is that there was no hot tub on the property. There was a smaller hot-tub area with large bubbles, but the water was only slightly warmer than the swimming pool. For a resort this size, a hot tub is a must. The biggest complaint about the Fairmont is the service at its restaurants. While on site, we ate at every restaurant--Las Brisas, La Laguna and El Puerto--eating lunch and dinner at both Las Brisas and La Laguna and dinner at El Puerto. The service is spotty to say the least. While the waiters and staff are extremely polite and welcoming, there were many times when we were ignored by the staff. At times when we would first sit down it would take 10 minutes before a waiter would appear to take our drink order. There were other gaps in service during the meal. The staff also did not deliver the food in the correct order. For example, we would always get an appetizer and at times, the main course appeared before the appetizer--many others at the hotel also noted this problem. It got to the point where we would have to specify that we want our appetizer served first, then our salad, then our main course. The quality of the food was very good, although Las Brisas and La Laguna offered many of the same items. Still, no complaints about the quality of the food. Another disappointment, however, was the wine available. Generally, each of the three restaurants offered the same bottles of wine with some variation. And the prices on these bottles of wine were marked up considerably--I'm used to seeing 200%-300% mark ups at restaurants, but here 400%+ mark ups were the standard. Bottles that you could typically find in stores for $12-$20 were going for $65-$100. Higher priced bottles weren't as egregious, but still bottles found in stores for $60 were going for $230. And to be clear in my review, while the service at the restaurants was spotty, the service by the housekeepers, bellmen and rest of the staff was excellent. Whether you needed a ride to the beach or an extra towel for your room, the staff was prompt, professional and courteous. Besides these couple of issues, however, we had a wonderful time. And even though the hotel was relatively full when we first arrived (there was a large convention there), the property did not seem crowded (probably due to its large size). We were always able to grab a spot at a restaurant without a reservation and there were plenty of lounge chairs and towels. Other than the spotty service and high priced wine, our trip was terrific. I would recommend this stay to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Fab-Tab-Ou-Lous!”
Reviews.Author: ImmaGleek
Reviews.Content: Mayakoba is a beautiful, great hotel to stay in, no matter if you have kids, or are alone. Multiple pools line the ginormous property. The view is absolutly gorgeous, espd,ecially at sunset. The hotel staff is kind and will greet you with "Buenos Dias" and a smile as you stroll by! I would recommend this hotel to young, or old. Enjoy the joy and happiness at the Fairmont Mayakoba!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding beauty, comfort, service, and food, in casual elegence.”
Reviews.Author: adkmts46er
Reviews.Content: After discharging other shuttle passengers, the driver said, "you are going to the best place." Others said the same. Fairmont Mayakoba lives up to the Fairmont name for hotel and resort luxury. We stayed in one of the signature casita along the waterway, with a long deck overlooking the mangrove. The resort is designed for and achieves a natural environment. In the morning we sipped frothy and flavorful mexican coffee which we prepared ourself in the french press, and looked out over sparkling clear water with colorful fish, ducks and birds. A morning USA today delivered to our door. We ate at each of the restaurants and enjoyed live music everynight. The food is diverse, fresh and healthy ingredients and inventive. No buffets at this resort. Attentive and friendly staff are everywhere on the resort. Bike racks are supplied with 5 gear BMW style mountain bikes, and guests can take the bikes anywhere at anytime (except night) throughout the resort on the many several pathways that stretch about a mile from the hotel lobby to the beach. We also used the shuttle to visit the companion hotel - Banyan Tree - which is an architectural marvel. You can dine at restaurants at Banyan Tree and Rosewood. Cart shuttles take guests all around the resort. There is boat service along the waterways to several docks. The rooms are equipped with cooler, separate tub and falling overhead showers with direct sunlight in the bath. Bathrobes, slippers are also provided. A flat screen TV and also a Bose radio. cd player. Bring your CDs. There were many families at the resort, but kids we saw were well behaved and not at all a nuisance. We stayed at the adult pool area. A lady at the beachfront restaurant was rolling cigars, I enjoyed one after dinner for about $12 usd. This resort was likely more expensive than other resorts in the area, but I found all the costs were reasonable compared to US hotels and restaurants. Dinner at the resort cost about the same as dinner at one of the better restaurants in our home of Cleveland; comparably much less for those coming from NY or Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, mostly bad...”
Reviews.Author: mstill
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont from March 5 thru 11th. In my room was my wife and I, in another room was my mother in law and our two children ages 3.5 & 6 months. I will start with the bad as it outnumbers the good. BAD: Service and Food. Now, this is not an all inclusive resort so you are paying out of pocket for each meal. It is not cheap either, they are wacking you for $10 a drink if not more. $4 for a can of soda. The breakfast buffett is $25, dinner for 2 will be $120-150 at either of the 'sigunature' restaurants and that is on the cheap side, if you get fancy with the wine (which was not very good wine btw) sky is the limit. The food was also very basic, as good as any all inclusive I have been to in the area and I have been to a few (Aventura, Sandos, El Dorado). Now, I do not generally expect great food at an AI, but when you are paying your way I expect it to be better and it simply was not, it was just basic. I have a problem paying those prices for average fare. Next is the service. I was shocked given there are probably 500 employees standing around the joint, no one bothers ask if you need anything. The first day we sat by the beach, not a single server looked in our direction for about half hour. Eventually we started asking and a few just walked by. We finally got a drink order in and that took another 20 minutes to receive. This was just the beginning. We ordered room service, took 1hr to get an order of chicken wings. We called reception, would be put on hold for a few minutes. I asked for the porter to come get our bags the day we left, it took almost an hour. Sitting by the pool, rarely a server at all. What was worst was when I called to complain or ask for service there was always an excuse, no 'Im sorry were busy" but instead I got "that isnt my section". What makes no sense is given you are charging per drink or meal, the smart thing to do is be over attentive with the service, you make more $$ the more drinks you sell, so have a server all over me offering drinks. To be totally honest, these problems in no way ruined our trip. We had a great time overall, but when you are paying good money for a 5 star facility I expect better food and service then the typical all inclusive. GOOD: The hotel grounds are spectacular. Very beautiful place, great to ride a bike around or just stroll. The beach is excellent as well, many hotels will lie about their beach and not tell you its full of rocks but they do have a pristine beach. The pool area is great, very clean and big enough so you do not feel cramped. The rooms were about the best Ive ever stayed in and the one service area they had right was the room cleaners, they were excellent. The bathrooms in particular are great. We had a signature casita for the wife and I, the rest of the family was in a Fairmont room which was also quite nice. They were also very good about the carts that drive you around from spot to spot on the grounds. remember, you do not stay on the beach (unless u pay for the beach casitas which are a few grand a night) so you need to get a ride or bike to the beach. This was no an issue. I thought the distance to the beach might be but it was not. All in all I would not return to the Fairmont Mayakoba due to the quality of food and service however it was not a failed vacation. We had a fine time but given the cost and annoyance the service was I just dont see it being worth the cost. I have had better service at the all inclusives and with kids an AI just makes more sense. It does have a good location if you like going into Playa Del Carmen as we do. Its just outside of town. We also went to the Rosewood for dinner and drinks. Wow, now that place is spectacular!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location! Nicest hotel i've ever been!”
Reviews.Author: mjdupuis
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel on the beach and surrounded by luxurious vegetation and lagoons. Excellent service. Good but not 5* restaurants. Had a casita on the beach and it was great to walk off the balcony straight to the white sand beach. The beach was nice, as was the ocean. The hotel grounds are extensive but you can easily ger from one place to the other by foot, by bike (free for you to take and ride) or by taking a ride with one of the carts that go by every couple of minutes. Booked a snorking tour with the travel agency - it was awesome. The pools at the hotel very nice too. In short, excellent place hotel. I Highly recommand it for a luxurious, quiet vacation!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT - I miss it sooo much!”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTraveler1979
Reviews.Content: Really the best experienced holiday I have ever had in my life!!! The resort is huge, but with the shuttle service of the golf carts you get very quickly from A to B... The best service I have ever had - friendly, attentive and always willing to make you even more comfortable than you already are! The various pool areas are fantastic and everything was just perfect! I just would love to go back there anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort with miserable 5 star fine dining!!”
Reviews.Author: SugarPooh
Reviews.Content: ...we were greeted like VIP's from the moment our cab entered the gated complex of the Mayacoba resorts (Fairmont, Banyan Tree & Mandarin Oriental Resorts) with fresh hot towels, drinks and room upgrade. Our room was huge with immaculate bathroom suited to a 5 star accomodations anywhere else in the world with excellent turn-down service. The resort was beautiful with equally gorgeous beach. The resort staff professional and beach service quick. However, dining at the 4star rated at El Puerto and Las Brisas were huge disappointments. It took 30 mins. for the sommelier to show up and recommended wines not in thier inventory. We sent back an overcooked fish and rack of lambs. The food at both restaurant were aweful not worth of any star rating except the views.... We did enjoy mexican breakfast (not buffet) at La Laguna! The breakfast buffet is another run of the mill type. The swimming pools were stunning. Go take a ride in the resort electric boat...fun and free!

Reviews.Title: “A spectacular resort but could be anywhere in the world”
Reviews.Author: theboybg
Reviews.Content: *Location* The Fairmont Mayakoba is located in the Mayakoba complex on the beautiful coast of Rivera Maya, close to the town of Playa del Carmen. The Mayakoba complex has a number of huge luxury resorts including Banyan Tree, Rosewood & Mandarin Oriental. The Fairmont Mayakoba is a 45 acre estate which has complimentary BMW pedal bikes or golf buggies to get around. Travel time from Playa del Carmen bus terminal (we arrived on the ADO bus from Merida) was about 15 minutes & cost 170 pesos ($17 USD). It’s about 45 minutes from the Cancun International Airport (CUN), which the concierge can arrange a shuttle bus to take you. *Room* We stayed in a Signature Casita Room, which was very large and private, clustered in blocks of 2-4 rooms around the beautiful gardens. We'd recommend requesting an upper level room, for privacy & views over the estate. The bathroom was huge & well appointed - bigger than our London apartment! With double sinks, full bath & walk in shower. As you'd expect all the fittings top quality but let down by the inconsistent maid service. Why do the maids replace only half of the towels & then just leave? It would be good if a supervisor could check each room daily to ensure all is in order. *Restaurants* Inevitably you end up eating within the complex every night, although expensive, the restaurants were excellent quality & service! Think international hotel chain menu not local cuisine. Las Brisas Terrace down by the waterfront is a great place for evening cocktails with friendly bar staff. Then take a buggy up to La Laguna for a great chicken fajita. *Facilities & Staff* Again staff varied in quality, buggy drivers were always friendly & never failed to impress - always smiling & being proactive if you looked lost in the 45 acre estate. Front desk, tour desk & restaurant staff were efficient but lacked the 'extra mile' service that you'd expect from Fairmont & the price you pay here. The beach was a little disappointing - not that wide & of limited appeal. *Summary* The sheer scale of The Fairmont Mayakoba & Mayakoba estates is impressive but it really could be any luxury resort in US, Mexico or the Caribbean - lacking the local ‘mexican’ feel. Do take the opportunity to go to Tulum & the local Mayan ruins – some real history to discover.

Reviews.Title: “5star grounds, 2star service”
Reviews.Author: giasep
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very spacious, infinity pool and beach area are great. But this is NOT a 5star hotel. there are 2 problems- 1)food is only average. Neighbouring Grand vellas have MUCH better restaurants. 2)Service is quite bad. We noticed mold in our bathroom and when I asked to be moved to another room I was treated rudely, took them almost 2 hours to find another room and instead of being upgraded I was sent to the similar room with the Worse view. I was told hotel` will see what we can do to compensate` but never heard from them again. There were other small things like refusing to break $20 at front desk or loooooong wait to be seated for breakfast. So overall nice hotel but does not compare to Grand Velas or Rosewwod that are right next door.

Reviews.Title: “What a rip off- NOT Fairmont quality- and a guilt trip from staff!”
Reviews.Author: midwifesara
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here last week for a conference. I have stayed at the Fairmont in Seattle many times and I have enjoyed the service and surroundings, so I was looking forward to this trip. On our first night we checked in and wanted to grab a quick bite to eat. Had to call for our luggage after about an hour of waiting. (Did not recieve the complimentary drink at check in though we saw others enjoying thiers). We just wanted to change, eat and get to bed after a day of travel. Made our way to La Laguna and waited and waited for service. Asked several times for water without getting it. Waiter brought the wrong dinner and when I asked him to make it right came back a few minutes later and complained that he would have to pay for the food that I had sent back. (ordered a sandwich and he brought a pizza). I couldn't get the manager to give me a straight answer as to if the server would actually get stuck with the charge so I ended up leaving an extra huge tip for crappy service. That started off the trip on a bad note. The room was large but the window dressing over the bathroom tub was broken-- think exposed velcro, staples and glue. I asked the manager about it and she confirmed, yes--it was broken, but never did anything about it- Not what i would expect at this level of a resort. If I wanted to look at home improvement projects I could have just stayed home, right? Bed was comfy but definately could hear the neighbors crying baby- so not well insultaed rooms. Housekeeping seemed random- requested earlier service (mainly so we could get the 2 bottles of water in the morning) but that didn't happen. They tell you NOT to drink the tap water and then charge 9 DOLLARS(!!!!!!) at the pool for WATER! GOODNESS! Do NOT use the ATM-- it is a $25 charge!!! Staff was perplexed at how to comp the 11% resort tax -- the conference had arranged to have that fee waived-- so several trips to the business center and front desk had to be made to confirm that they were not chanrging that fee. I agree with the others who say that the resort is too big- and the beach is tiny-- would not go to this resort if you like to beach. All in all, NOT worth the money. inconsistent and uninterested service given. Average surroundings and average food. Poor quality beach. You felt like you were held hostage by the prices and fees that are charged every time you turn around.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect resort”
Reviews.Author: washdc19
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful stay at the Fairmont Mayakoba. It was a lovely resort with exceptional service and fantastic amenities. I'd definitely return. Thanks to the entire staff for a wonderful vacation. It's a perfect spot for families with young children - they cater to your every need. Only suggestion would be to update the beach lounge chairs. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful large, luxury resort with some minor issues”
Reviews.Author: jgmit
Reviews.Content: Party: My wife (30), myself (30), our son(1.5) and my in-laws (mid Rooms: 2 adjoining deluxe casitas Duration: 5 days/4 nights Originally From: Northern NJ I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Fairmont Mayakoba. While the resort was very large, it was easy to get around and felt "small" at times. I found walking from our casita (sp?), which was located near the hotel, to the main pool area to be enjoyable. Walking to the beach was a bit of a trek, although it was easily accessed by way of the regularly running golf carts and also by bicycle. The grounds are nothing short of spectacular, albeit completely artificial. You almost feel like you are in a rain forest - neat, but not true. It was convenient and pleasurable for everyone in our party. My wife and I are generally people on the go and I, particularly, feel constrained (stuck in fake Mexico/name your country ) at large hotels, but I never felt that way on the Fairmont. It was also easy for my in-laws and not prohibitively difficult to bring the little guy around. Overall, this was a very family friendly hotel. Amazingly, it would also be a wonderful place for a romantic getaway. The accomodations were well-appointed and very comfortable. The bathrooms were particularly well done. There was plenty of drawer and cabinet space and the rooms were very large. I found the bed extremely comfortable. I appreciated the full-sized crib they brought for my son. It was nice to sit on the deck and with a little maneuvering of chairs it was great to be out there with my whole family, a party of five. It was really nice room. The room did smell musty. When we mentioned the smell, the hotel simply said that this was from the humidity. They offered to put a dehumidifier in the room, but we all know you cannot simply dehumidify the smell of mildew away. Also, the door to our deck was broken when we first got to the room, but the staff quickly fixed this. My only other qualm with the room was the lack of minibar. I understand the eco-friendliness of this, but I like the instant access of a minibar and wish they included one. I found the service on the resort to be a mixed bag. Turn down service was irregular. One evening we asked housekeeping to come back around 7pm and they returned at 10:30, knocking on our door while our child was asleep. The "Royal Service" was also a bit of a misnomer. I had to request a sewing kit three times before finally receiving one. Also, I had to call three times and it took 45 minutes to get help with our bags on our departure. When I requested a play pen, I was told that it was being brought to our room, only to be told the next day (after multiple calls) that it was unavailable. The service was the weak leak at this hotel and if you need something ask early and often. The front desk was incredibly helpful and quick. I chalk much of the difficulty with service to the size of the hotel, but it was still pretty poor. The staff was always very friendly and polite. I was impressed with the restaurants overall. Las Brisas was particularly delicious at both lunch and, especially, dinner. La Laguna had a pretty solid breakfast buffet. It didn't knock my socks off, but it was more than adequate. The steak and fish place in the main building was also good, but not exceptional. The dinner at La Laguna was OK. I was pleasantly surprised to find the prices very reasonable at all the restaurants. I wish we would have explored the other restaurants at Banyan Tree and Rosewood (on the Mayakoba premises), but in all honesty, we didn't have time and it's not convenient. The services at Las Brisas and the steak and fish restaurant was excellent. The service at La Laguna was good, although we stood waiting with an infant while there were plenty of tables available one night. There were three families with young children and we all should have and could have been seated, even if we had to wait a while to be waited upon. The front of the house was not well organized or considerate of the circumstances. Otherwise, the service was very good. My wife and mother-in-law raved about the spa. My wife, in particular, said that it was one of the best equipped spa that she been to.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing natural surroundings, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: MM&SB
Reviews.Content: The food and service were great as is expected for a Fairmont. The outstanding part of this resort is the beautiful and peaceful surroundings. I would recommend renting a car from the airport so you are able to go into Playa del Carmen easily (if you rent from Budget, there is no valet/parking charges since there is also a Budget at the resort). We would definitely return here!

Reviews.Title: “conference”
Reviews.Author: busybee2775
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel grounds complete with lagunas and jungle and gardens and a golf course. Beach is beautiful. Excellent for someone who would like to walk a lot or use bikes, as it is a walk from most of the rooms to the beach. Rooms are clean and large and well equipped with super nice bathrooms. Excellent in-room coffee maker (french press) and tea maker with electric kettle. Clean! Balconies with each room. Service is impeccable. Restaurants are excellent, especially Las Brisas on the beach. Pools are numerous and beautiful. Spa is expensive and gym is $10/day unless you're President Club member (but who knew to sign up before hand?). Gym is very nice. The main criticism is that everything is to be charged for, from gym to wifi to 11% tax per room per night+$15/day service and 3% tax occupancy - all each day. So, word of advise is to sign up for President Club prior to booking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Discerning_Traveler4
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Fairmont. Like all of the hotels in the Mayakoba area, most of the rooms are a little far from the beach. If you can get over that (which was easy to do with constant shuttle service and bikes) then this hotel is worth every penny. The rooms were very nice and contemporary, with spacious modern bathrooms. Opt for a room that is not attached to the lobby, and is in the lagoon area. The food was great, we never had a meal that was anything but solid and we love good food. The service was so friendly and accommodating. My only complaints are 1) very difficult/expensive to have a room with an ocean view and 2) a few of the pools had nice lounge chairs but most of the chairs were kind of cheap and not up to luxury hotel standards.

Reviews.Title: “Ahhhhhhhh, so glad to be back!”
Reviews.Author: Tripreviewergirl
Reviews.Content: They Fairmont Mayakoba is just as lovely now as it was when we visited three years ago. Like most of the resorts in the area, the service is top-shelf--staff could not be nicer. There were a lot of families with young children--the perfect spot for them! While the rooms are the standard for a four star hotel and nothing terribly special, they are immaculate as are all the common areas, pool and beach. Keep your eyes peeled for discounted deals which may include breakfast, resort credit etc. We got a 3-night package that could only be described as inexpensive, especially given that terrific location! We'll be back...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sue27Litteton
Reviews.Content: The previous review says it all. This is a wonderful resort and our stay couldn't have been better. We were treated like royalty. The best part of this resort, that many people may not realize is that most Mexican resorts' pools are not heated. (We learned the hard way five years ago at the Iberostar). In January/February, most pools in this area are ice cold and not pleasant. Not true at the Fairmont. Their pools are heated and I am so glad we stayed here because of it. We evenly divided our time between the ocean and the pool area. Both were pleasant and very comfortable. There were many shallow pool areas for my 4 year old who cannot swim yet; and while there were few lifeguards (if any), I felt that my kids were safe throughout the resort. As far as the lay out of the resort and the prior complaints about it being too big, I didn't find this to be true at all. We loved walking on the paths, riding the bicyles, or taking the golf carts. It was no problem at all. For the kids, they did have kids' bikes to check out each day. The food was outstanding. Yes, there was sticker shock and be prepared for the the high prices. For a family of 5 with glass(es) of wine, it was between $100-200 per night. It is just like eating at an expensive restaurant every night-but you got what you paid for--value and quality. (We stayed in a two room suite, and I added it up, it was no more than staying at an all inclusive with two rooms). We chose this resort because we are a family of five and the suite was perfect in having two separate rooms so the kids could sleep in, while the early risers play in the other room. The photos of the roooms and the resort do not do it justice. Everything is breathtakingly beautiful!! My only critique if any, was that while my kids, ages 4, 8, and 10 were happy and content, it would have been nice to to see more kids' activities. Perhaps there are more during the busier times and this was a quiet week there. Only on the last day did we learn that the neighboring Rosewood was doing a kayak/boat ride to the reef for snorkeling. We never knew of any such activities. I do recommend a visit to X-caret Park. We did go the the neighboring Rosewood resort one night for dinner (Punta Bonita). The food quality was incredible, but we were told that our tequilla shots were "$5" by the waiter. Come to find out we spent $70 on 3 shots of tequilla and $35 on three bottles of water. Be careful on that one. Overall, I highly recommend this resort--it was a dream. For references sake, we have previously stayed at Four Seaons (Punta Mita); Iberostar Paraisa Del Mar; Broadmoor (Colorado Springs); La Costa (Carlsbad), Ginn Resort (Orlando) and this resort was right up there at the top, if not the best.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: toppadiddypop
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Mayakoba is paradise. My wife and I stayed 7 nights in a Deluxe Casita and were honestly depressed about leaving. We've stayed in high-end properties before (including other Fairmonts), but this place is in another category altogether. It's our first morning back home and trying replicate the restful state of mind I was in only 24 hours ago is proving to be a waste of time; even their coffee is way better than mine! I'm so impressed with this property that I'm tempted to write pages -- it would be easy -- but my life must go on and so many others have written wonderful reviews that detail all the major attractions right down to the little touches. So here are a few pro tips that others might have missed.... * The property boat tour can be a private one for you and your spouse. There are a couple time slots per day that are reserved for 2 which gives you a little privacy and the full attention of the very knowledgeable boat captain. This tour is free. Keep an eye out for the crocodiles! * The resort is family friendly, but couples shouldn't find this annoying either. Casitas are semi-private (only 4 rooms per house), the pool areas are huge with many little private nooks, and the infinite pool overlooking the lagoon is adult-only. Maybe it was my blissful state of mind, but it seemed like the kids that were there were very well behaved anyhow. I wouldn't hesitate to come back with kids or for another romantic getaway for two. * The property is huge, but we loved riding our bikes around and never had a problem finding two. When we did decide to walk we couldn't go anywhere without being offered a ride by the very courteous staff. * As a courtesy, the Fairmont will shuttle you to the other hotels on the property (Banyan Tree, Rosewood) in one of the hotel Escalades. My wife and I enjoyed the Thai restaurant, Saffron, at Banyan Tree and were even able to charge it to our room at Fairmont. * I gave the hotel a 3/5 for location, but this has to do with the Riviera Maya area in general, not this hotel specifically. This stretch of coast line is non-stop hotels that are all accessed by long roads coming in from the main highway, 307. This is not like Cancun where you might walk off the hotel property to shop or eat. In and of itself I consider this a good thing (we weren't looking for a wild spring-break style nightlife), but the only viable option for getting out and eating off-property is to take a taxi into Playa del Carmen and that will cost you $30-35 USD round trip. More often than not we chose to stay on property to eat as $30 can get you a very tasty entree. If/when you do go into Playa del Carmen, get some recommendations from the concierge as there are many terrible places to eat in Playa and you will probably pick one without some guidance :P * The beach at the Mayakoba is terrific and uncrowded. Clear blue-green waters are warm and the white sand beach is kept impeccably clean. The staff will come around and offer you complimentary homemade popsicles or fresh fruit to help keep you cool. There are a dozen or more large thatched-roof permanent umbrellas and never had an issue finding two open chairs under one. There is a sizable buffer between the Mayakoba beach and the neighbors, but we went on long walks in both directions and found our beach to be the best. Oh boy... I thought this was going to be brief... I really could go on forever... Anyway, if we ever return to Mexico, we wouldn't even look at another hotel. Simply perfect.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best resorts in Mexico”
Reviews.Author: coalharbor2010
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Mayakoba is for you if you like the outdoors and staying fit. You can bicycle, jog, golf on Mexico's top course, play tennis, swim in lap pools and in the ocean, lift weights and do cardio at the gym, and top it of with a great massage at the world-class spa. Tip - sign up online for Fairmont President's Club before checking in to get free access to the gym, a discount at the spa, and free high speed Internet. The service is excellent and friendly. The resort is huge and quiet - perfect for couples and others seeking serenity. Definitely not a party resort like in Cancun. The restaurants are good, but we preferred to dine in the room, move the desk outside and turn the balcony into a personal dining terrace since in-room dining offers much of the same items from the restaurants. There were so many great included details that Fairmont included such as insect repellent, unlimited bottled water, pool-side popsicles, cucumber slices (for refreshing your eyes at the beach), water-slide, Cadillac Escalade shuttles to get around the Mayakoba resort, BMW bikes to get to the beach, electric golf shuttles everywhere, turn-down service, the list goes on and on. This resort is both over- the-top and understated and unforgettable. I will definitely be back. On the down side...all this beauty and elegance doesn't come cheap. Also, the shopping on the resort is just meh...you must go into Playa del Carmen to shop for clothes, souvenirs, wine, fresh fruit, etc.. on 5th Avenue or at the Mega.

Reviews.Title: “once again, a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: J2PTRAVELER
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to the Fairmont Mayakoba--it just gets better everytime. The staff is so courtious and helpful. We can't wait to go back next winter.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Classy Hotel, But!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Fischers72
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong, this hotel is gorgeous. The people are generally nice. The food is pretty good. Rooms are nice. But if you are anything like me & do not like hidden charges & being nickeled & dimed at every turn, this place will get sour in your mouth real quick. 1rst there is the resort fee an xtra $30 a day, $5 coke, tea, coffee, if you ask for chips and salsa make sure they do not bring guacamole, $10, they brought it when I did not ask for it. The salad was not big enough for my wife, so she asked them to make it bigger, $14 salad PRESTO, TURNS INTO A $36 SALAD. $20 dollars a day for internet, $10 a day to use gym, per person, $15 more to use the showers at the gym, per person. Bring your plastic cigar cutter because their plastic cigar cutter is $45. What pushed me to write this review, which I can't remember the last time I did write a bad review, was laundry. I wanted a load of wash done in cold & dried thereafter, I offered them $20, fair price considering there paying people $4hr, maybe. They told me it was by the piece, I said no, i do not want it pressed, I'll iron it myself, just washed & dried. They said no deal. It would cost me around $100, to do laundry. I think I'll go shopping downtown playa del carmen instead, at least I'll new clothes.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Peaceful Resort but without the flavor of Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: am1969
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 6 days at the Fairmont Mayakoba near Playa del Carment. This was our second trip to Playa. Last year we were newlyweds and stayed in town at La Tortuga (which we would really recommend). This year we came for a work conference with a 6 month old baby and two great babysitters (family). We wondered what the resort would be like after passing it last year. The setting of the hotel is beautiful. They have kept the surrounding grounds as untouched as possible. A great deal of the natural vegetation has been left alone. The hotel lobby is very open and inviting and the staff are excellent. We stayed in the hotel instead of the more private casitas. The rooms are very well apportioned and clean with very nice but simple (not ornate) furnishings and beautiful views off the balcony. I would not change the rooms or the settings. However the food is another thing. There are three restaurants. We ate at two of them. Missed the one on the first floor of the lobby. The food is very expensive and is on the very fancy side at the resaurant on the beach (las brisas). It was nice for one dinner but would not eat there more than once during the stay. The other resaurant was next to the lagoon/pools and was more simple and the food was adequate but again overpriced. And you really don't get a feel of the great food that is available less than 10 minutes away. After the second night, we rented a car and went to town in the evenings for dinner which we really enjoyed. The beach is about a 15 min walk but there are always golf carts that will take you back and forth to the hotel. This was never and issue for us even with a baby. The service at the beach was great and there are plenty of staff to help and serve. Overall: Beautiful facility, great staff, activities for children, nice beach, great pools, but you may miss that you are in Mexico if you never leave the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice place, not recommended for Pre-teens”
Reviews.Author: xolo90
Reviews.Content: We decided to venture to Mexico for the long MLK weekend. When we checked in to our surprise we were upgraded to a 2 bedroom breach front villa. Could have not been more pleased with the gift. The Villa generally priced at $1500 per night was given to us for a song of $349/per night. Spacious, clean, 2 bedrooms, three bathrooms, private heated pool and a 24 hr butler. Like other reviews of Mayakoba, the distance to the main hotel is very long, 20 walk or 7 min golf cart ride. The food was reasonably good and priced within normal resort pricing. My only complaint, not too much to do for older children. I would not recommend booking this place for a family of active pre-teens and older, you might find boredom setting in once the beach/pool activities wear off. In general the Fairmont lives up to it standards and exceeds them in many areas on the Mayakoba.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but nothing exceptional”
Reviews.Author: FunTraveler5665
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week with my family. We got a good deal on the hotel which definitely made the trip worth it. The hotel was nice, located inside the Myakoba complex which includes the Rosewood and the Banyan Tree. All three hotels can be walked through via the beach or the hotels all offer free car service betweem them. The beach was great, weather was beautiful. They offer some free ameneties such as sliced cucumbers for your eyes, popsicles, and mini fruit cups. Beach chairs and umbrellas were free and always available. The hotel had maybe 5 pool areas. The one by the beach was an infnity pool and pretty warm. The main pool was nice and included a water slide. Temperature was perfect, sometimes even a little too warm. There was also an adult pool which I dont believe was heated but was also an infinity pool looking over one of the canals. There was always ample room available at all the pools. Their "jacuzzi" was not much warmer thant the pools. Once the weather cooled down at about 4 PM, it would have been nice to relax in a warm jacuzzi for a bit. The restaurants in the hotel was ok but nothing too fancy. We ate at La Laguna a few times. For dinner, make sure you try to special fish for 2 people - it was fantastic!! Food overall was a ripoff. HIGHLY recommend eating all meals at the Rosewood. Prices werent that much more but the food was fantastic and service was impeccible. Worth going to. I was not impressed with the food at Banyan Tree. Food in town was a lot cheaper but very touristy - kind of a ripoff for what you get. Some to try include Cevvocola (italian), Sur (steakhouse), Yaxche (mexican). The boat ride the hotel offers was beautiful - higlight of the hotel!! You need to reserve it but it goes every hour and takes about 45 min. You see all kinds of birds and animals including even alligators. We LOVED it. A lot of the reviews complained about the size of the hotel complex. We didnt find it a problem at all. There are golf carts all over and we never needed to wait more than a few minutes. Its a 10, 15 min walk from the lobby to the beach. We stayed in a Signature Casita (were upgraded without even asking from a Deluxe Casita). The room had a terrible strong chemical odor which we complained abou but nothing was done. I guess we got used to it. It overlooked the canal. Beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was huge. Housekeeping service was great - very attentive. Lots and lots of free bottled water and the room included a coffee and tea maker as well. One thing to note is that if the hotel calls a taxi for you to go to Playa del Carmen town, they charge $17 for up to 4 people (price doubles if its 5 or more). However, on the way back, if you get a taxi from town yourself, you can negotiate with them all the way down to $10 dollars. Recommend getting their # and calling them yourself whenever you want to go to town. You should sign up for the Presidents Club - you get free wireless internet (only in the lobby). The room includes a wire for you. Also get free access to the health club (spa is $25 extra). Hotel is VERY quiet - theres not much, if at anything going on. No activities like water arobics or beach volleyball or anything at all. We stayed a week and were getting bored towards the end. Good if you want to get away from it all and just relax. The hotel is a good value for what you get. Its listed as a 5 star but is more like a 4-5 star - dont have too high expectations. You get what you pay for! The Rosewood and Banyan Tree are both $700+.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel- service just ok.”
Reviews.Author: alk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Fairmont Mayakoba in March 2010. We went with 2 kids age 5 and 7 and our friends who also had the same aged kids. This is a very large resort so be prepared to do a lot of walking. There is also a golf shuttle to take you around the property as well as bikes (first come, first serve). There is a large pool with a slide for the kids which they loved and also a pool by the beach. The food was good- especially the breakfast buffet. The spa is beautiful and the fitness center is small but nice. The hotel is very pretty- with a very lush feeling as it is surrounded by a lagoon. We took a complimentary tour and it was nice. The surrounding area also has a lot to do -- ziplining, snorkeling, atv, etc. We had dinner in Playa Del Carmen. Make a reservation if you are going. Had a nice dinner at Xache and saw Mario Batali there with his family. We also had dinner at Banyan Tree hotel which was good. Our only complaint here was the service. We expected better service from a Fairmont hotel at the pools and beach. You need to look for servers. Noone is asking you if you want anything. If you want a drink, be prepared to get up and get one. If you are looking for a hotel that waits on you hand and foot it- this is not it.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed - Loved it”
Reviews.Author: laurendell
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in April '10. I stay at Fairmonts pretty often so I had a suite upgrade voucher which we used to upgrade to a Signature Casita Suite. That plus a Friends&Family promotional rate made the trip a great deal. But the spa & food was very expensive, so we still managed to spend quite a bit. Room : The suite was gorgeous and right on one of the canals, with no suites on the other side. We really loved sitting on our balcony in the morning & evening and looking at all the birds and fish in the canal. Clearly it's all man-made, but it felt like we were in a rainforest jungle. Ok, maybe a rainforest jungle disney ride - but we loved it. The bathroom(s) were fabulous & huge. Fairmont beds are always outstanding and these were no exception. I will say I don't think I would have enjoyed the trip nearly as much if we had been in one of the regular Fairmont rooms or one of the Casita rooms overlooking the less lush part of the canals. Property - the resort is huge and sprawling, but we didn't mind this at all since the golf carts can take you to the beach or spa or wherever you want to go which wasn't a big deal to us. I didn't feel like cattle, as another reviewer said. Also we don't mind walking. If I hadn't been 6 months pregnant at the time, I would have ridden the free bikes everywhere. I spent most of the time at the beach, the water was beautiful. The resort would be GREAT for kids I think since they'd get a kick out of the golf carts & bikes and the pools are really nice. I do think they could improve on the beach chairs -- it would be nice to have the teak cushion ones that are at the adult pool, rather than the cheap-ish ones they have. Restaurants - We ate the Laguna restaurant for breakfast every day and a couple times for lunch. It was pretty good, nice view of the canal, good for bird/turtle/fish/kittycat watching. Las Brisas has a great view of the ocean for lunch, and we ate dinner one night there. The food was good but the service was slow. Service - Super friendly, always greeted with a smile and a hello everywhere we went. No complaints in this department whatsoever. Spa - Amazing facility. I loved and took full advantage of the private pool on the roof, and the little cakes and fruit provided. Very relaxing. My massage (neck, shoulder & foot) was fabulous (but not inexpensive). Overall -- We had a great time and would go back if we could get the same rate. Would be a great place for kids I think too. Playa del Carmen is a good change of pace for dinner, about a 15 minute drive south (we had a rental car). Next time we would probably stay closer to Tulum though, because it seems more old school authentic Mexico down there, which is more our style generally. But we loved it! Btw -- if you sign up for the Fairmont President's Club in advance, which is free, your internet is free at any Fairmont. There is no reason not to sign up.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Luxury”
Reviews.Author: HeatherSanDiego
Reviews.Content: We escaped our unusual cold this New Year & went to the Fairmont Mayacoba in the Yucatan Peninsula. The property, like many others here, is a lock down fortress - rather intimidating. However, once in, it made it easy to relax & let the children do their own thing inside the property. They enjoyed bike riding inside the property on pleasant trails & swimming in the lovely, irregularly shaped, main pool. The rooms are exceptionally well planned for comfort. Our room had two closets, a large & lovely bathroom with separate toilet & a walk in rain shower with an atrium next to the tub. We booked two rooms for our family of four & both were on a canal that was quiet & peaceful - however the morning sun did wake us up over the water - it was tropical bright! This is not a hotel geared towards either retail therapy or night life. It is a very quiet property & by 10 pm there is nothing to do. We ate leisurely dinners at one of several on site venues & watched pay per view ($16) before getting a restful & comfortable sleep. I have only a couple less than favorable things to say about this otherwise very relaxing property: firstly, a resort of this caliber should have the retail for a guest to replace lost luggage or go a little crazy. There was absolutely nothing available to read besides magazines other than a very small collection of books in English (Twighlight & New Moon anyone?) & only Foster Grant sunglasses & a few swim items for wardrobe needs. I believe a spontaneous guest should be able to find something more unique at a property of this calibre. Second & lastly, service by the front desk could be snippy at times & unhelpful often. I was sent all over the property trying to purchase a wi fi connection for my e reader - to no avail. Further, pool attendants would greet us but never voluntarily ask if we needed help locating a chair (almost impossible to find one) or getting us a menu or poolside service. Housekeeping staff was exemplary & always cordial, as was the wait staff.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this resort, excellent Christmas week service.”
Reviews.Author: ANM912
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the 8 nights at the Fairmont Mayakoba over Christmas week and it was a very easy and relaxing vacation. The rooms were spacious, clean and the bathrooms very nice for a hotel. Upon arrival our rooms were ready and there was no problem getting connecting rooms. This is a frequent problem we face but not here. Although the weather was not great in the beginning the heated pool was a life saver. The kids were in the pool non-stop. Our rooms were located near the big pool and we didn't mind having to take the tram to the beach, it was an activity for the kids. We loved the bicycles although there should be a better system for the kids bikes because people took them and they sat for most of the day. The food was good and the service very solid. Each member of the staff was friendly and helpful and even where there were problems that were very helpful and apologetic. The trip to Playa del Carmen was easy although the cab rides were a bit expensive. There was never an issue getting chairs at the pool and there was a constant supply of fresh towels. The spa was beautiful and the gym not overcrowded. While no place is perfect especially during a holiday week, the Fairmont a great job at making us happy. My one complaint is that the internet service could use an upgrading.

Reviews.Title: “what a disappointment...not for couples.”
Reviews.Author: IheartNutella
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked in on New Year's eve, excited to spend a long weekend in warm weather. We arrived from the airport at 2 pm and were told that our room wouldn't be available for another hour. Fine. We didn't have a problem having lunch and then checking into our room. 2.5 hours later, we were still waiting for our room, aching to relax and frustrated that we couldn't even change into beach clothes. And then once we arrived in our room, maintenance was there fixing a problem with the lighting for the next half hour. We didn't mind too much at the time, but we never received an apology from the front desk. Our room is a big disappointment as well. We're staying in the Beach area Casita room, which is roughly $800 a night (with taxes during peak holiday) and our view is the tropical equivalent of a brick wall. Nothing pretty to look at. We have not spent one second on the deck looking at our view. I think there are very few rooms at the hotel that actually have a view of the beach. The best part of the room is the gorgeous bathroom. As many others have mentioned, the grounds are too massive for the hotel to handle. You have to call for a golf cart to go anywhere and you feel like you're cattle being shuttled from one area to another. This hotel is not suited for couples at all. Do not come here if you're looking for a romantic holiday! The walls are very thin and we went to bed listening to screaming kids and woke up to screaming kids at 6 am. We understand that kids are kids and we can't blame them, but when we asked to be moved to another part of the hotel, the manager was extremely unhelpful. We decided to stay in and watch a movie one night and the On Demand system was down. Again, no apology from the front desk. The pros: the staff is super friendly and nice. They can't help it that management is terrible and the hotel is designed poorly. The spa is divine. We really enjoyed the facilities. And the beach is beautiful, but service on the beach is extremely slow. This is not a bad hotel for families with kids. If we are ever to come back to this area, I think we would stay at the Mandarin, Rosewood, Banyan Tree, or somewhere in Tulum.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: lemon737
Reviews.Content: Loved it all. Beautiful resort, wonderful people, fabulous food and drinks. Great zip-lining.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort but most rooms far from the beach....”
Reviews.Author: qksail
Reviews.Content: This Fairmont is part of the huge Mayakoba resort development that also includes the gorgeous (and smaller) Rosewood and Banyon Tree properties. All three are similar in that they feature rooms and suites in private villas scattered throughout an expansive property of canals and mangrove jungle. There is a lot to like about these new lovely resorts but there is one significant flaw: most rooms are far (15-20 minute walk) from the beach. All the resorts have golf cart shuttles and bicycles to help overcome this. They have some boats too but they didn't seem to be reliable except for a tour of the canals. The Fairmont also lacks enough bicycles to make that work (although we noticed that Banyon tree assigned a bike to anyone who wanted one). So you better get used to golf cart shuttling. We were there during the low season which may have exacerbated the transportation issue and also contributed to another complaint: the service wasn't great with some of the pool bars closed or pool service not being offered in some areas. The pool near the beach had the best service and gorgeous views so that is where i recommend that you go in low season. The Spa pool was also partially dysfunctional and the lack of urgency to get it fixed may have indicated that business is a bit slow. Overall, I think Mayakoba is spectacular. The best option looks like Banyon Tree or Rosewood, but Fairmont is beautiful too and we got a fantastic deal on a Fairmont suite that made it worthwhile. They didn't seem to mind if we, as a Fairmont guest, used the Rosewood or Banyon tree pools. There are some beach area rooms and suites which mostly eliminate the transportation concern, although these may be less private than the villas scattered among the canals. A couple money saving secrets: join Fairmont presidents club to get free internet and other perks. And if you rent from Hertz, valet parking is free. If you do go to Mayakoba, don't miss taking a few nights in downtown Playa del Carmen. Its a very fun, safe, and vibrant entertainment area. Also, Tulum and Cenote swimming are worth doing!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Relax”
Reviews.Author: travelbuddiee
Reviews.Content: Beautiful place with really friendly people, Service was wonderful, great place to go out and relax, Rooms are very comfortable, spacious, clean, very nice place.... Highly Recommended !!!

Reviews.Title: “Peace and serenity”
Reviews.Author: SPDRDH
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an action packed, tacky all inclusive Mexican resort...this is NOT for you! However if you are looking for a place to unwind in a beautiful environment, you will love it here. Service is gracious and top notch. Room are spacious and quiet, beds comfortable. Our casita was tucked amid a jungle-like area overlooking the golf course - El Cameleon (golfers - you will LOVE this course! reduced greens fees were available - just ask!) Spa services were some of the best I've experienced...again 'specials' are available if you inquire. Food is top notch, but we are always willing to pay more for better quality food and service.
