We had live music played during breakfast and dinner. Yes, there is an extra charge for the internet, but shouldn't you 'detach' when on vacation?? Beach is a very short distance, but very accessible by bicycle or cart. Didn't find it to be a problem at all.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the endless hidden costs”
Reviews.Author: jdktraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really nice, but paying for the room is just the beginning of the mugging this hotel imparts upon its guests. The internet and the spa are both $25 a day as well as a parking fee and daily hotel fee. The food is outrageously expensive ($18 for a mediocre burger) and I've only been here for 6 hours. Our stay has been a financial bamboozling. If you thought that you got a great deal on a nice hotel think again, these guys are like the airlines charging you left and right for luggage, carry-ons etc. Buyer beware...

Reviews.Title: “Completely Over-Rated”
Reviews.Author: Hufferca
Reviews.Content: This is my first stay at a Fairmont and it was far below my expectations. The rooms are very nice and clean with nice bathrooms and Fairmont touches. The complex is spralling and private, but too far from the beach. Everything seemed to be a haul to get to. The gym was nice, with state-of-the-art equipment and a spa facility which was awesome as well. But the resort fell short in many areas. The tennis courts are sand over carpet with broken nets, no water or towels, and no phone to call for a ride. We were forgotten and had to walk 15 minutes back. The pool main pool area was nice, but the lounge chairs were cheap and un-comfortable. Not once were we greeted to have chairs moved or towells delivered. We had to chase down the waiters on numerous occasions, so service there lacked big time. The beach itself is sparse and the hotel made little effort to keep trach off of it. The ocean water in front of the hotel was dirty and trash on the beach and not the Cancun-blue we expected. Simply put, I could have been anywhere in the world sitting by a pool without the feel of being in the Mayan area of Mexico. The food in the main restaurant La Laguna was just average as well. If you face the golf course, know that they have lawn blowers and mowers outside your room at 7am as well. The design of the resort is also funky, as the beach is a 15 minute walk from non-beachfront rooms (or you had to wait for a golf cart or ride a bike) and once you get to the other pool by the ocean, it was tight and small. This resort is one of 3 in the Mayakoba Complex (shares with Rosewood and Banyan Tree). We previewed the Rosewood, and while it looked more appealing, it too was a ways from the acutal beach. To top it off, someone in the hotel staff changed the name under our reservation, so I was being called by another guest's name each time I did anything. I had to spend 15 minutes going through my bill line by line to be certain all of the charges were mine, and all I got in return was "I am sorry". Poor service at the end for sure. All in all, I would not return. If you go here despite this review, be sure to join the Fairmont Club beforehand, as then you get free internet and $10 off the spa facility rate, which was a joke. They charge a "resort fee" of $15 per day, only then to turn around and charge you $15 to $25 per person to use the spa facility (hot tub and steam rooms), but they were free if you bought massages. We then left and went to Cancun and stayed on a white beach at The Westin Lagunamar and LOVED it! If you want a kitchen-type suite, a spralling pool and beach, or nice tennis courts, go there, or a higher end is Live Aqua, very nice and high end and also a GREAT location. Would not do The Ritz or Le Meridian, as there is little to do in that part of Cancun, their pools are small, and there is little to do there. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, stunning location”
Reviews.Author: viajeramx1
Reviews.Content: Fairmont Mayakoba has a bueautiful view, you can ride bikes to the beach ant the pools. There is a water park for kids and lots of areas for adults. Narrow, but nice beach. It is well located to explore the Riviera Maya, Playa del Carmen and its nightlife, Sian Kaan and its amazing landscape, Coba, Tulum... Do not miss the boat trip to see the birds andlandscape in the hotels property. Book as soon as you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: penichiki
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best I ever stayed in. The property is unique, amazing and most relaxing; the best food ever tasted, the best service and staff, a great beach, amazing rooms...etc. I could go on forever and never finish. I will definitely go again and if you want a great time, this hotel will definitely will guarantee this!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: JetSetterAfficion
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a dream!! The service is amazing! from the moment you walked in they know your name at all times. The rooms are clean and the architecture is great!! You are surranded by nature and it is peaceful!! Take a bike for free and ride around the property. The ocean is a clean and the sand is white. The spa was super!! The restaurants had super delicious food. You can't not go wrong with this place!!

Reviews.Title: “Mexican Gem”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelerers222
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Fairmont Mayakoba for several days and found the perfect escape. I've traveled to Mexico many times before but never have I stayed at such a private, beautiful hotel. The location can't be beat. It's located in the Mayakoba enclave so it's completely secure, but you have everything you'd ever need at your finger tips, including a white sand beach, acres and acres of greenery and gorgeous pools. That's if you decide to leave your room. I stayed in a deluxe casita which was spacious and beautifully decorated. My bathroom and soaking tub were huge. My friend and I spent time in the spa which is a must if you visit. The caliber of treatments and service was A+. I'm not a golfer but I checked out the course - and it made me want to golf! My husband, who's an avid golfer, has always wanted to visit the Jim McClean golf school there so we'll definitely be back. From breakfast to dinner, the food was fresh and delicious, and the staff couldn't have been more hospitable or friendly. Bottomline - this is a 5-star resort with an unbeatable value. I've already recommended it to several friends and I definitely plan to go back.

Reviews.Title: “even in a Hurricaine”
Reviews.Author: jani198
Reviews.Content: Even in the event of a possible hurricaine this was an awesome place to stay! Food awesome, service awesome, staff friendly, awesome, and extremely helpful! i would definately come here again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Honeymoon Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CityGirl610
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the Fairmont Mayakoba for my honeymoon. It was truly paradise! I had never been to Mexico before and I was concerned that the resort might be too hard partying for my taste. The Riviera Maya complex - which houses the Fairmont, the Rosewood and the Banyan Tree (if I have that right) - is the complete opposite of spring break. The resorts are situated on acres and acres of rivers and tropical foliage. It's stunningly beautiful, quiet and truly in tune with nature. I highly recommend taking a tour of the Fairmont by boat. The hotel was about forty minutes from the Cancun airport - farther than I would have liked, but a small price to pay for the experience we had. Check-in was seamless with a welcome drink and cold towel. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a Signature Casita (I should note it was a very quiet week at the resort). The hotel room was half bedroom, half bathroom, with a grand marble soaking tub and standing shower. It was perfect for a honeymoon. In keeping with Fairmont standards, the bed was really comfortable. The bedroom area opened up onto a patio overlooking a river. As long as you had bug spray, it was the perfect spot for an evening drink. The Fairmont is large - 46 acres, I believe - so you need to get around by golf cart, bike or boat. My husband and I frequently used the bike option and it was really fun! The resort has so many ammenities. There are three pools - the "main pool", which was huge and impressive, the "quiet pool", and a pool on the beach (my personal favorite). The beach is about a ten minute walk from where our guestrooms were located. Other reviewers complained about this, but it wasn't a problem for me. The beach was beautiful and never crowded. There are also quite a few restuarants. La Laguna had an awesome breakfast buffet each morning with fresh fruit, yogurt and traditional hot Mexican dishes. I ate there every day for almost a week and never got tired of it. Las Brisas overlooks the beach and is great for a romantic dinner. The service at both restaurants was wonderful. The Fairmont will also shuttle you between the two other resorts on the complex. I recommend Safron at the Banyon Tree for some great Thai food. The service at the Fairmont Mayakoba was amazing. My husband and I were always addressed by name and greeted by the staff whenever we encountered them. Housekeeping, which I usually don't comment on unless it is poor, was outstanding. Our room was cleaned daily with an additional turn-down service in the evening. This is great for a couple taking daily naps :) I would not hesitate to return to the Fairmont Mayakoba... we plan on coming back for our first anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience in an awe inspiring environment”
Reviews.Author: iamheatseeker
Reviews.Content: After an extremely lengthy process I chose the Fairmont for a romantic getaway. I was looking for somewhere to unplug and retreat and this was indeed the place. I will say that this hotel is not for someone who is looking to wake up and be on the ocean or fall asleep to the sound of the ocean look elsewhere. If you are looking for a rowdy time or a place to meet new people..look elsewhere. This hotel grounds were pristine and the service was the most consistent and thoughtful I have yet to receive. The beach and pool is a short golf cart ride away and the sand was perfect, the service was not too intrusive but attentive. There are 8 amazing pools and if you are looking to mix it up a bit don't overlook the other pools beside the beachside pool. The food is incredible at Mayakoba and considering this is a five star resort the prices were extremely reasonable to me for the quality of ingredients and service level. The breakfast buffet is a great deal and while overlooking the lagoons a perfect serene way to start the morning. The best part about this area is that you feel like you have been transported to a private jungle retreat and yet in less than five minutes you are escorted to this pristine beach. The balance of nature and luxury is an amazing achievement. I definitely recommend going to Banyan Tree for dinner or drinks that place is simply stunning and breathtaking. As I said the service is the best I have had...even beyond the Four Seasons Maui which was uncontested to this point. But... it is not for everyone. It is for people who want to feel unplugged and relax. The resort is spread out and quiet so I would not recommend for people who don't want to wait for the golf carts and don't enjoy taking long walks but I will be returning and for those who are ready to be pampered I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Dreamy”
Reviews.Author: itchntotravel
Reviews.Content: We found the Fairmont by chance as it came up as the deal of the day on Travelzoo. Little did we know that we found a piece of heaven. this Fiarmont treated us like princesses! From the moment that we arrived until the day we sadly left the entire staff went out of their way to serve our every need. This staff is exceptional! From the slippers laid by our bedside to the free bike usage to the golf carts to scoot you around we just can't say enough. We are very frugal traveler and wouldn't traditionally stay at a 5 star hotel but we are sold on this one and can't wait to come back! Beautiful grounds, pools, beach and great location to Playa de Carmen. food was just so-so and very expensive. After the first night decided to only eat the breakfast buffet and go into Playa for dinner. Feel freee to contact me for more details. We can't say enough! Way to go Fairmont!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic luxury resort with impeccable service - we're definitely returning.”
Reviews.Author: Avidtraveller6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with our infant daughter and found the the service to be impeccable and enjoyed our stay so much that we are considering returning later this year. The hotel facilities are top notch and the food is fantastic (albeit pricey). The surrounding lagoons were serene and we particularly enjoyed the infinity pool by the beach. The hotel provides cribs, high chairs, outdoor cots and lots of other family friendly amenities. The cleaning staff even folded our daugher's clothing every day in our hotel room and organized her toys in her crib! We have travelled the world and likely stayed at over 100 hotels/resorts. The Fairmont Mayakoba is definitely in our top ten.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: MsTexasKim
Reviews.Content: We wanted to take a vacation to somewhere in Mexico but didn't know where. Our friends decided to get married at Mayakoba and they negotiated a $129/night plus a free upgrade to the casita so we thought why not?!! Upon arriving you suddenly feel like this is an exclusive resort. It's like a compound within a jungle! We were greeted with cold towels and berry tea. The lobby is open and breezy and overlooks the property. It was beautiful!! We were taken to our room by golf cart that run every 5 minutes or you can hop on one of the bikes. The room was so private and secluded, we loved it. We thought we would like to be on the lagoon, but the jungle view and privacy was very nice! The walk down to the beach was pretty long so we either hopped on a bike or waited for the golf cart. The service was amazing and very friendly. The food was yummy but so freaking expensive. Our stay plus booze and food came to about $675. We stayed 3 nights and brought breakfast bars and ate with the wedding party Friday and Saturday, so we probably spent less than usual. The pools were awesome not overcrowded. Plenty of towels and service. Loved it and will definately return. Next time when we arrive the first day, it's worth taking a trip to walmart to stock up on food and beer and sneek it back into the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great start to a honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: dansun82
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Fairmont Mayakoba for 5 nights for the first half of our honeymoon. (We stayed at the Ritz Carlton Cancun for the other 6 nights) One of the best hotel stays ever. Upon arriving, we learned that we had been upgraded from a Deluxe Casita to a Signature Casita and were given welcome drinks. The rooms are magnificent and very private, with a very large bathroom and large balcony. Breakfast at La Laguna was very good. We tried both the buffet and a la carte. I recommend the buffet if you are very hungry, even though it cost a bit more. Dinner at La Laguna and at Las Brisas was also very good, but the best restaurant in my opinion was El Puerto. Make sure to try the short ribs. Sushi is also served in the lobby lounge every evening, and I found it quite delicious. Other highlights of this resort include the lagoon (make sure you take a boat ride in the lanchas), all of the various flora and fauna, and the spa. We had the best massage and the spa facilities are terrific. You can basically spend a whole half day hanging out in the spa. I do agree with other reviewers that the resort is a bit spread out, but I honestly liked walking around, so it wasn't a problem. There are also bikes and golf carts readily available for your transportation needs. Other than that, we relaxed a fair bit, went into Playa Del Carmen once to shop and eat dinner, and visited Chichen Itza. I would definitely recommend the Fairmont Mayakoba, and hope to return some day.

Reviews.Title: “My daughter's Destination Wedding, but we're going back!”
Reviews.Author: troggs
Reviews.Content: I don't think I've stayed anywhere where I felt that the management and staff were as genuine in their desire to make us and our guests happy. My daughter was married in a beautiful ocean front ceremony at the Fairmont Mayakoba, and we would not have changed a thing for our guests or ourselves. We had over eighty guests traveling from NYC, LA, Chicago, Memphis and more. These were discerning travelers and diners, and they were all happy that my daughter and her husband chose the Fairmont Mayakoba as their wedding location. Our guests were enchanted by the unique, eco-friendly environment and were very pleased with the resort's restaurants and their menus. Few left the resort to dine elsewhere. I would describe the rooms are "more than spacious," and we all had a wonderful time enjoying the resort's amenities and services. You may read criticism about the expanse of the Fairmont's landscape, but we did not hear one complaint about getting from one point to another. The golf carts were frequent, and our guests enjoyed the boats and BMW bicycles. Traveling through the lush, tropical grounds is part of the experience, and the buildings were designed to blend in with the landscape. There is no towering complex here, and the view from the main building is stunning, sweeping across mangrove forests and lagoons to the ocean. The Fairmont website is a fair depiction of the layout, so if it looks good to you, you'll love it. The food was fabulous, and the seafood was amazingly fresh. The chefs at El Puerto, in the main building, were not tied to their menu and were willing to create dishes at our request. I had tasted fried capers on our site visit, and these in a lemon butter sauce over Red Snapper (not fishy here!) was unbelievable. La Laguna, in the center of the resort by the main pool, offers a great family style menu that includes local traditions that are great for passing around the table or a small meal. Try the Salade Nicoise or Steak Salad ocean front at Las Brisas. I enjoyed them several times on both our site visit and the week of the wedding. The prawns in all three restaurants are huge and to die for! The rooms are wonderful: large, open and airy. The bathrooms in the Casitas are about the size of normal hotel room, and my daughter and her husband were given a two story suite with a private pool on the top. These were recommended over the ocean front suites for their privacy, and the view over the lagoon and marsh was breathtaking. Most - if not all - rooms had a balcony or deck, and the service in the rooms was impeccable. For those of you considering the Fairmont Mayakoba as a destination wedding site, do it! The management and staff were a delight to work with, and they made things so easy for us. There was no need for a separate wedding planner as the resort's services took care of most of what we wanted, including the cake. The events department connected us with florists (including their own in-house florist), photographers, ceremony officiants, and entertainiment providers. We were able to put together a wedding that suited our tastes and budget, and the plan was unique to what my daughter and her husband wanted for their wedding. With today's internet communication and Google, you can plan a destination wedding easily from home, and you will know that you are getting what you want. Anyone wanting more information, please send me a PM. My daughter's wedding was a busy time for my husband and me, so we're going back in the late winter. We think we deserve it!

Reviews.Title: “Secluded and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: 2000mrt
Reviews.Content: The room that I shared with a friend at the Fairmont was beautiful and the bathroom was large and well stocked. Those were the good things. The bad is a whole list: -It took 8 minutes by golf cart to get to the beach! By foot, it's a long trek in the blazing sun (not a shaded walkway). -once there, the beach was not that great. -it's in a gated manmade eco-resort with two other hotels, so it's very secluded. 10 minute drive to playa del carmen when traffic is good (which, due to all the construction, it never was) -those romantic looking canals? breeding grounds for tons of mosquitos. I was bitten all over by the time I stepped out of the car and into the lobby. -I noone in my group of four was able to get cellphone reception. If you want to stay at a gorgeous hotel and spend a lot of time in the room, at the hotel restaurants, or the spa, this is the hotel for you. If you actually like Mexico, would prefer non-hotel food, and access to some of the beautiful beaches all around, stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Just what the doctor ordered!”
Reviews.Author: citygirlpz
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Mayakoba is the rare resort that has it all: accommodations, service, location and amenities. We visited in January, a trip booked almost on the spur of a moment, to get away from the brutal cold on the East Coast and the winter doldrums. We did not have the all-inclusive, which worked well, since we were out on sightseeing trips almost daily. Loved the rooms, the restaurants and the cafe, the beach and being pampered in the spa. It is now on our most-go-back list.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for Conferences and Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: TickyDeepu
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for a week in April 2010 for a conference. The hotel has a beautiful property surrounded by lakes and a PGA standard Golf course. The rooms were comfortable with good views all around. The property is huge and we needed special carts to take us around to resteraunts and beach. All in all a great hotel but slightly on the pricier side.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Dazzer1969
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 days at the Fairmont Mayakoba with a 3 year old and a 12 year old, and had an absolutely fantastic stay. Our suite was amazing. The pools and grounds were incredible. And the staff, the staff was was best of any Fairmont hotel that I have stayed at. We loved it! We'll be back again next year. If you can deal with driving in Mexico, I would recommend renting a car if you plan to leave the resort frequently.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: txtraveler97
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this hotel. When we arrived on site, I immediately felt relaxed and I was amazed by this resort. The place is a paradise, with an abundance of trees, a river area that flows throughout the resort, and a number of activities to keep your family busy. I thought the rooms were some of the nicest I've stayed in and the place was enormous. It is much larger than many resorts that I have stayed in and requires a good bit of walking to get around, but they have multiple ways of getting around (bikes you can leverage or a cart). There are three or four pools on the resort that are heated (we went during an abnormally cold time) and a private beach that is amazing. Food was excellent and featured many fresh ingredients. There are several options on the resort for lunch and dinner and the breakfast buffet is huge and overlooks the river (amazing view). Food is pricey, but so is the hotel, so know what you are getting yourself into. There aren't many eating options nearby unless, unless you grab a cab and head into town, which I highly recommend doing at least once. I felt like this was the type of resort that you could spend days on, not leave, and feel relaxed and entertained. It's very kid friendly, there is a great doctor on staff and who is quick to help (we unfortunately tested this). The service and the staff is top notch. I'd definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the area!

Reviews.Title: “BEEN TWICE-NOT WORTH IT”
Reviews.Author: traveler62485
Reviews.Content: This place has amazing rooms. The regular rooms are humongous. So unless you like to spend money for fun or you have enough money to be on a villa on the beach, then you dont need to upgrade. In my opinion, if you go to the beach, you go to be on the water. You have to wait around for a golf kart to take you on a 15-20 minute ride to the beachfront...which is nice and secluded once you get there. So problem #1- but it's based on preference. That said- THE SERVICE IS HORRENDOUS. I've been here twice for two cousin's weddings. The bellboys are incompetent, the front desk are anything but helpful. For example- I asked for a toothbrush (forgot mine, its the fairmont, thought theyd give me on). They said o itll be $7. I asked if they sold toothbrushes in their stores. They said probably not but I could check the store that is halfway to the beach to find out. I didn't trust them so I went to the store down in the main building which was closer and tadaaaa toothbrushes, nice ones for $3.50. Aside from that the service at the restaurants are horrible. I am half Mexican half American- I was with my boyfriend so I was speaking in English and asked for a table. Under her breathe, the hostess muttered ok brat. Then- the waiter was so slow- but he was way better than the server the year before who ruined our entire order and then blamed me. I will NEVER go here again. If you are going to Playa del Carmen go stay at a hotel in the town. Enjoy the culture the beach and SAVE A TON OF MONEY!!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in a box”
Reviews.Author: pantheist861
Reviews.Content: This resort was so good it made it difficult to return to the real world. As part of an AmEx package deal we snagged a room at this place for a fairly low rate (compared to the average) and spent an entire week basking in luxury; we even got a casita upgrade (with the largest bathroom I've ever seen in a hotel room) for free! The staff were extremely friendly and attentive, the pools were amazing and the beach was exactly what we hoped it would be. There were also three really spectacular restaurants within the resort confines. My only complaint regards the long distances between the casitas and the beach.. they do have public-use bicycles available if you can find them, but if you can't it's a REALLY long walk from one end to the other. Honestly though, after a couple days in this little paradise you're not going to care.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Weather at a Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: CEPMonte
Reviews.Content: We arrived for our children's Spring Break on Friday, March 12. It was an easy check-in but we were not offered an upgrade probably due to the first two nights we were on a special President's club rate. We had two adjoining rooms in the cabanas with a jungle view. It was very quiet and peaceful. The weather was very pleasant but a little chilly at night. Yuki, the Concierge was very helpful with our dinner reservations. However, the only available restaurant for breakfast was La Laguna and it was often chaotic with lots of empty tables and people waiting. There was a buffet but with optional menu service. One night after an all day tour of Chichen Itza and Tulum, we had not made a reservation. We attempted to go to La Laguna and there was lots of empty tables and a one hour wait! La Puerto was our favorite on the first night. Las Brisas overlooking the beach was a beautiful setting but the menu was a little limited and different especially for the boys. We ate most of our lunches and snacks around the pools or the beach. The guacamole and chips are to die for. We ate it at least twice a day. Pool and beach food and drink service was great. Our private tour to Chichen Itza was a delight with Carlos Diaz as our tour guide. He picked us up in a nice air-conditioned van and delighted us with his stories the entire day. He had suggested an itinerary that suited us just fine as well as setting up a private tour guide at Chichen Itza. Rafael met us at the gate and he was a wealth of information for adults as well as our two boys, age 10 and 16. After the tour, Carlos took us to a nearby Maya village for an authentic Mayan lunch which was divine. The sidewalk style cafehad the grill right at the front and it produced the best grilled chicken my family has ever had. Even my picky 10 year old could not get enough of the chicken which also came with homemade corn tortillas, white rice, quesadillas, guacamole and tacos. After lunch we headed back to Tulum where we stopped and tried some Mayan corn on the cob with lime and salt. Unbelievable! Carlos is the best! He speaks perfect English. We highly recommend him but please book him in advance. His e-mail is hotcadiaz2005@hotmail.com. He is working all day so give him time to e-mail you back! We went into Playa del Carmen one night for dinner at the recommendation of a friend who said this was the best Italian food in town. It was but there are apparently two restaurants of the same name, same owner and we were taken to the more casual sidewalk cafe that faced an all glass workout facility. It was interesting watching a spinning class the entire time we were wolfing down great pasta. The name of the restaurant was Pomarola. It is a 10 minute taxi ride into town. The last night we had dinner at the Rosewood Hotel next door. We ate at the casual Mexican grill overlooking the beach. It was taco night and we tried a variety of different types of tacos, all that were excellent. It is a beautiful hotel but not as family friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room and Property but Pricey and Limited Activities and Food Choices”
Reviews.Author: TheRoadJessTraveled
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fairmont for 5 nights while attending a wedding, also at the Fairmont. The hotel and grounds are lovely, and the room was really nice, particularly because all of the rooms seem to have a nice balcony and beautiful bathroom, and great lotions and little extras. However, don't stay here if you're concerned about money! Maintly because of the food costs, and also the limited food choices which basically forces you to eat the high priced food at the hotel. I think there were only 3 restaurants on the property, and all were pretty expensive. Also, the staff, while very nice, seemed at times to be clueless about what was going on at their hotel. For example, we were told incorrect information multiple times about the hours that the restaurants were open, which restaurants were open and closed due to special events, and when hotel events took place. Instead of saying that they didn't know, they told us incorrect information, which was more problematic than helful. Another thing which increases the cost of staying there is that you basically have to take a taxi if you want to go anywhere outside of the hotel. The cost for taxi each way from the Fairmont to Playa del Carmen city was 165 pesos each way (approx $15 depending on the exchange rate). One night we needed a taxi for 6 people and the cost doubled, to 350 pesos each way. Some of my favorite things about the hotel were the infiniti pool, the beautiful beach, the bikes which the hotel lets you pick up anywhere, and the boat ride. The boat ride is very infrequently offered (maybe 2x/day) but it's free so try and do it as an alternate way to get to the beach. There are 2 beautiful pools, one infiniti pool by the beach and another closer to the rooms. While the one close to the rooms looked great, I couldn't stay there because it was too hot! The rooms and the pools away from the beach feel like they're in a sauna, while by the beach there is a lovely breeze at all hours which makes the heat tolerable. You also might be surprised at how far the beach is from your room. You could walk or bike to the beach, but most times you take the golf carts, which are pretty convenient and come pretty quickly. If anyone from the hotel reads this, I have a couple of suggestions that would go a long way.... 1st - why would they charge a per person/per day fee? I can understand if it's charged if more than 2 people stay in a room, but why charge it if 1 or 2 people stay in the room? Just add it to the hotel fee, no? It's silly to add another $30 for a couple each night they stay at the hotel. Otherwise, consider adding a couple little changes like the ones below to warrent such a fee.... 2nd - I would highly recommend putting water coolers around the pool areas (at the very least) for guests to use. While the rooms do have 2 small water bottles each day, why not allow guests to refill their bottles around the hotel when they're out? Is it just to sell water at the restaurants? It's so hot in Mexico that I was surprised that water wasn't more readily available. The practice of relying on the water bottles seemed wasteful to me, environmentally and a waste of money to continue to have to buy water bottles at $6 for a large water bottle from the restaurant! 3rd - consider putting a big communal sunscreen at the pools for guests to use. I've seen this done at other hotels, and given that the Mayakoba is upscale and in hot Mexico, I think it would go a long way. Especially because the only place to buy sunscreen is near the lobby, which is quite a ways from both of the pools, this small touch would've gone a long way! 4th - make the health club free! Again, this is an expensive hotel, and if you're charging a extra per person/night fee, I was really surprised that there is a $10/day charge for the gym. I had a nice stay, but next time would limit my stay at the Mayakoba to a couple of days for relaxation only, and then stay in Playa del Carmen city for the rest of the time to have some fun and more and less expensive choices for food, drinks, etc. Feel free to email if you have any questions!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lali2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a long weekend in February 2010. The property is gorgeous and the rooms are elegant and very comfortable. The only con is that the beach is 1 km from the main part of the resort and requires a long walk or golf cart ride (which the hotel provides). It's quite a secluded resort and the main part of Playa del Carmen with all of the shops and restaurants is about a 10 - 15 min cab/car ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Not our favorite”
Reviews.Author: mtctraveler12345
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 3pm to learn that our room was not ready & would not be ready for 2 hours. We had requested a room in the main resort area & were shown a room that smelled of mildew. We were upgraded to a beautiful room near the beach, but this was a long distance to the main pool & breakfast area. However, our primary complaint was the corporate atmosphere - this did not feel like a resort. With multiple conferences occurring, they closed the beach restaurant & pool for an all-day event. They proceeded to set up large music speakers & topped it off with a fireworks display right outside our room - all of this with no prior warning. The grounds were very well maintained & the staff was exceedingly polite & attentive. However, you are better off staying here for a business event, rather than a family vacation. We are generally fans of the Fairmont, but this was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotels we've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: J2PTRAVELER
Reviews.Content: This is truly a world class property. The staff is gracious and hard working, after a day or so they greet you by name. The pool staff is the best we've ever experienced and the restaurants are some of the finest we've ever enjoyed. Only drawback is the staff at the front desk....room upgrades are not available ..then magically become available. Pricing on upgrades can be a little deceiving. We've stayed here twice- both times we've changed rooms after we'd unpacked. Beware of front desk staff and the rest of your stay will be perfect. addl. note spa and gym are excellent --world class

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel but at a Price”
Reviews.Author: SuitNflipflops
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and well manicured grounds, large rooms and a very friendly always willing to help staff makes this hotel a winner. Free transportation to the Rosewood Hotel next door so that one may benefit from that hotel's facilities as well. Spa was gorgeous and excellent. Nice golf course with the reputation of being the best in the area (which I can't vouch for). Note that the beach is about a 15 minute walk from the front desk although this is true for the Rosewood and Mandarin Oriental hotels as well. Rooms don't really have views regardless of what they advertise. That said, the rooms themselves are big (large than Rosewood's but with a patio instead of a rooftop deck) and really, really nice. High end, Miller Harris, bathroom amenities. Only complain is the cost. This is an EXPENSIVE hotel, as is the Spa. Think $250 massages and lots of unexpected resort charges.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, interesting and fun layout”
Reviews.Author: KevinT33
Reviews.Content: We were a bit leery about the layout of the resort, but it was a lot of fun and interesting. As a family with two young children, the trails, bikes, pools, waterslide, beach, beach pool, beach restaurant, and nearby Playa Del Carmon, were all great attractions. We had a wonderful time and, if ever traveling to the Mexican Riviera again, would go to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Shear joy!”
Reviews.Author: splurgeindiana
Reviews.Content: We returned from this lovely, luxurious resort, with the fondest memories. Our group had a toddler and several pre-teens and the resort provided enough activities to satisfy everyone. The grounds are IMMACULATE and safe. In fact, we were very comfortable allowing the older children to go on their own, riding the bikes or taking the golf carts. The staff members were kind, attentive and gracious. We witnessed some rude behavior from other guests toward some staff and, STILL, they were met with a smile and attentive service. The restaurants were clean and offered a nice variety of options. We particularly enjoyed dining outdoors at Puerta. The fresh fruits in the morning buffets were wonderful. Though the food came out a little slower than what we are accustomed to, it gave us a nice chance to really pace ourselves and enjoy our family. Pool service was very nice. Eduardo was particularly attentive.

Reviews.Title: “I'd come back happily to this lovely resort”
Reviews.Author: butter
Reviews.Content: Am just back from a 10 day stay at Fairmont Mayakoba. Right away - I must say that I thought their service was amazing and am surprised by any complaints in other reviews. On the last day when I checked out, unbeknownst to me, I had left my wallet in the room. I was with a large group all leaving at the same time.... The bellman found me in the midst of that craziness an hour after I had let the room, told me he had found me wallet and that security had it. Security came to return it to me and NOTHING had been taken -- all my credit cards and cash was still there. I was so impressed by their honesty and service!!! Other points about their service, one day when we came to get something in the room before lunch, we saw the room had not been made up yet. We called housekeeping and asked that they clean the room by 2pm so we could nap our kids then and they proactively asked if we'd like our room cleaned at 12:30 (lunch time) everyday.... and proceeded to do so for the remaining 8 days. That first day they left a voicemail to make sure that the room had been done in time. Again, very impressed with the follow-up. Every staff member you pass when you walk around the hotel greets you with a smile and says good morning, good afternoon or good evening. Also, anyone driving a cart stops to let you pass by. I was with a group that had its own special food service, so I can't speak to the restaurant service, but again, everyone else was very nice. Our food was served in the conference center ballrooms for each meal and our 2 waiters were very attentive. In terms of the facilities: While the beach is a golf-cart ride away, it was never a long wait to get on a cart and ride there, and once you did you could enjoy the beautiful beach or the pool. The main pool (not near the beach) was large and never felt over crowded. Around the edge of the pools was shallow platforms in the water, perfect for my infant and toddler to splash around in. And everyone had fun with the water slide. Again, I was with a special group that had its own food set up by the pool and beach, so I can't speak to any wait time for poolside food/beverage service, but the people who helped set up the lounges and provide towels were extremely friendly and helpful. In terms of the restaurants, on our last night there, my husband and I had drinks and tapas in the lobby lounge and they were delicious. We had a ground-floor room in one of the casitas. The room was spacious and the bathroom was extremely large. On the downside, for the TV, the children's channels were all in spanish, even though many other channels were in English. Also, we had a patio but it didn't really have any view and was not that appealing -- there was just the hedge/plants that bordered it. It was kind of depressing and felt very closed in. Otherwise, the beds were comfy, there closets specious, etc. For you parents - we used the babysitting service our last 3 nights. Each night we had the same sitter, Katya, and she was lovely. She even brought crayons with her to entertain my 4 yr old and when she found out he loved the movies Cars, Wall-e and Toy Story, the next 2 nights she brought print outs of the characters for them to color together. While the view from the rooms could be better, I'd happily return to the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, but the best activities are to the south.”
Reviews.Author: MercurialAmy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful trip to the Fairmont. After reading the reviews I was well prepared. I travelled with my mom and two boys (11 and 13) We all loved the bikes, pools and beach. We rented a car from Hertz (3 days), but could not get one later in the week due to the busy Spring Break season. It's great to have a car, as there is not much to do and the tours are not my thing. We love to snorkel and travelled to Xel Ha, and Akumal. I highly recommend both. Ask the concierge about going to Akumal in a car. Best snorkelling and day trips are south of Playa and getting through Playa will take 30 minutes if you don't know the short cuts. We did the Hidden Worlds trip as well. It is very rustic, but lots of fun. My boys loved it, but the Jungle ride was rough on my mom. We ate at Fusion on the beach in Playa and the food and atmosphere were perfect. The beach is amazing, and you can walk for miles in both directions. Take your snorkel gear up to Hacienda tres rios (about 1 mile north) Grab an umbrella at the beach early in the day . It's the best place to have lunch, though you may have to flag someone down to wait on you. The bikes are really great and the best way to get around the resort. People do try to stash them at their doors. Don't be shy about taking one if you need it. It's big and it's not close to the beach, but if you like to be active and outdoors it's excellent. If you don't like to be active and outdoors, maybe you should go to Florida. The canal tour is a must! Book it when you get there. The yummy muffins in the store by the pool are the best deal in the place if you're trying to watch your money. The wine is very pricey, so buy a couple bottles in Playa and put them in the little fridge in your room. Cork screws and wine glasses are in the rooms. And cokes are $4 each so you may want to have extra in the room. Don't bother buying the water in the restaurant. We drank the tap water and no one got sick. Plus, bottled water is bad for the environment. The food was okay, but nothing to rave about. The rooms are great, very large, huge bathrooms and comfortable beds. We had a deluxe and signature casita. The only difference was the view. My room had a connecting door and we could hear the neighbors pretty clearly. But the room without the connecting door didn't seem to have that problem. The birds are pretty noisy in the morning, but I liked to get up and take early walks on the beach. If you're a light sleeper, then 6:30 will be your wake up call.

Reviews.Title: “A tranquil oasis”
Reviews.Author: Move2BC
Reviews.Content: Situated on an enourmous property sourounded by lagoons, forst and a stunning golf course, the Mayakoba is one of my favorite Fairmont properties. We found the staff extremely friendly and not as pushy as in Cancun or even in Playa. Playa is a great town to visit but the Fairmont Mayakoba was so relaxing, most days we stayed at the resort. The ocenfront pool is great but the infinity edge pool overlooking the lagoon and forest blew me away. Splurge on acasita if you can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “nice property but not a truly 5 star resort”
Reviews.Author: alexshulman
Reviews.Content: just came back from romantic trip with my wife. this is our second trip to fairmont and my opinion may be skewed because in january we stayed at banyan tree. therefore, i cant be completely objective because once you have stayed at banyan tree, no other place, no matter how perfect, can be compared to that resort. good things about fairmont: nice property. we stayed at signature casita which is very nice, comfortable and has upscale feel. - las brisas restaurant on the beach is excellent and very reasonably priced. - excellent location with a beautiful beach. you can walk safely 2/3 miles in each direction. - beachside pool is very clean and pleasant negatives: service, service, service....starting from front desk all the way down to beachside service, the service is on the level of 3 star hotel occasionally 4 but nearly close to 5 star resort. - size of the property : it is pretty big and difficult for them to manage overall, for the price range of 300$ US dollars/night it might be a good choice but if you have to pay more, i would highly consider other places on riviera maya thanks, alex

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic resort -- absolutely beautiful, very well maintained, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: davidmmc
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my wife, whose company was honorning their President's Club winners (she was a winner). From the moment we entered the resort, every staff member treated us great. Food, drinks, room -- all first class. The only thing I can complain about would be the slow service in the infinity pool by the beach. But then, you're in an infinity pool by a beautiful beach -- why complain about slow drinks. To note, my wife's co-workers, who work in a high stress field and are very well paid, are accustomed to being treated like divas. They can be very critical when things are less than first class and they all raved about the Fairmont. I don't know where the people with horrible reviews stayed -- couldn't have been here!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not "5 Star"”
Reviews.Author: Oerworked_but_rested
Reviews.Content: We selected the Fairmont Mayakoba base on the Fairmont's reputation and also both my husband and I are President Club members. We were traveling with our business partners with the intention of possibly considering this facility for a 200-person conference. Check in was seamless and you are greeted with a fruit tea drink and damp towels. Nice touch. Despite having a reservation and the resort only being roughly 60% occupied, we were told that we would have to change rooms at least once if not twice. At check in, we also were told that we could have a late check out (1:30 pm) which became an issue on our last day. Our room was an upgraded room on the lagoon. After familiarizing ourselves with the resort, we decided not to pay the astronomical upgrades for various types of rooms - especially the beach area casitas which are very isolated from the rest of the resort and not worth an extra $900 per night for a butler! The adult only pool is lovely and quiet. Despite low occupancy, poolside service was slow and the servers (other than Omar who made our stay!) did not give the impression that they wanted to be doing what they were doing. Ricardo at the Cafe is terrific and gave great types on local restaurants in Playa del Carmen which were terffific - humble but authentic food. The food was okay - nothing would qualify as really outstanding and certainly not "5-Star" quality. Our partners arrived two days after us and had several room issues. The toilet paper holder was ripped out of the wall. Their room smelled of must and was not clean. The toilet was left for several days without being cleaned. With the service issues and room issues, we decided to look onward for a better conference location and didn't tour the rest of the facility. Nice rest, great company with our partners, wonderful sun and tanning but not what qualifies as a 5-Star resort! It is a quiet stay at a place that is dependable but overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking in the details”
Reviews.Author: dctraveler067
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 5 day stay at the Fairmont. Overall, the trip was nice, but we won't be staying at this hotel again. We booked a beach area casita room which was in the group of rooms and suites that are closest to the beach (the other rooms are a good 15 minute walk or 5 minute golf cart drive away). We were put in room 831 which I recommend you request you NOT get. Upon checking into the room, I noticed a constant running water sound. At first we thought it was the toilet and even had maintenance out to look at it only to discover it was coming from the hot tub in the suite above us. Every time the hot tub heater kicked on, it would send water down the pipes that ran alongside one of our walls. Aside from the water sound, we could also hear people walking around and moving furniture upstairs. The view from our patio consisted of the golf course buffer. We noticed that all the other beach area casitas (the rooms, not the suites) had views overlooking the lagoon. I am a light sleeper so after putting up with this for a night, we asked to be moved to one of the ocean front casitas. Ocean front casita was much, much better (it is it's own self contained unit with no one upstairs or sharing a wall). We had a hammock and direct walk out to the beach, but had to sacrifice a king size bed for 2 queen sized beds and paid an extra $200 per night. We were hoping that the hotel would compensate us for having to upgrade, but they didn't offer even though they knew we were upset with our original assignment. As for the service, the front desk people were not very friendly especially given our room situation. When we would call the concierge or the "royal service" as they call it, we often got the run around or were told that someone would call us back which never happened. Their follow through was definitely lacking. Upon check-out, no one even asked how we enjoyed our stay. Not a major issue, but it does sum up the general attitude of the place. Overall, here is a summary of the good and the bad: Good: * Great for families. We saw a lot of families with young kids and the resort seems to really cater to them. * Beautiful, well--maintained grounds. *Rooms were very clean * Spa was nice and services we had were top-notch *food is okay and not too terribly overpriced Bad: *Front desk and concierge service is severely lacking and not very good at addressing complaints or issues in a timely manner. *Not very nice for a romantic getaway weekend. Felt the resort was more geared towards families (we checked out the Banyan Tree and Rosewood which both seemed much better alternatives for romantic getaways) *Rooms are hit or miss. Especially in the beach area, the regular rooms (not the suites) are dark and showing their age. *beach chairs are uncomfortable and warped. Would also be nice to have kayaks available for people to use like the other resorts offered. Recommendations if you do stay there: *The Bose radios in each room have an auxillary jack to play your ipod so bring an auxillary cord if you want to listen to your ipod in the room. We asked if they had some cords at the hotel, but they did not. *Rent a car so you can go into Playa del Carmen. Great nightlife and lots of cheap food options. We also went to Cozumel one day via the ferry. *Buy drinks and snacks at a 7-11 or an OXXO on the way to the hotel and keep them in the room's mini-fridge.

Reviews.Title: “In the Jungle!”
Reviews.Author: kpmconsulting
Reviews.Content: We arrived late in the evening and the drive in was beautiful. We brought our dog because the hotel said they were pet friendly. To the Fairmont, pet freindly means: the dog could be in the room with us- not allowed anywhere else on the property except to walk him on a leash- no beach, no pool, no where. And, we weren't to leave him in the room unattended. This meant that we were able to enjoy the room together or leave one at a time... my dog isn't a pet but a service animal- which they don't recognize at the Fairmont. When we asked about that, we were told it was the law to not allow animals (service or not) in any common areas. Totally false. But, they make the rules! They were kind enough to bring us a pet bed and dog bowls. I thought that was really nice of them! The room was nicely decorated and had a view of thick brush- nothing else. Unfortunately, we completely unpacked before pulling back the sheets. Thick black (possibly mold?) smear on the sheets and pillow. Called down to have sheets changed and they came fairly quickly. The housekeeper was pleasant and TINY! For some reason a manager came with her- he waas a really big guy. Could have been her bouncer! This tiny woman completely stripped the bed and remade it- very impressive. The manager: watched her. No help- just watched this little lady do her thing. It was very akward for us. We pretended to read and tried not to laugh! This kind of thing happens to us all the time. We are considering wearing helmut cams every where we go! The floor was really sandy but other than that, the room was clean. The next day, we broke the rules and left our dog in the room in his comfy pop-up kennel so we could check out the beach restaraunt. We had to take a golf cart to get to the beach- took about 5 minutes to get there. it was pretty far out. The food was mediocre, but the service was outstanding! the beach was really small. The pools had cheap chairs. With the dirty sheets, sandy floors and strict pet tules, we opted to check-out after lunch. The resort is beautiful and would be great for anyone that doesn't come for the beach or pool area. it would be a good getaway for nature-lovers/golfers. I think that is the attraction here. We wouldn't go back because we aren't jungle lovers and because we can't have our dog. We felt that everyone was extremly nice and accomodating. Surpirsingly, when we told the front desk person that we wanted to check-out early, he didn't ask why or how to change our minds. just, "okay." I thought that was a bit odd?? If you go, bring your bug spray and hiking shoes! You'll want to walk and explore the property.They also have bikes all over the place so you can hop on one and go!

Reviews.Title: “very nice with two exceptions”
Reviews.Author: k1052
Reviews.Content: A well cared for and well staffed property. Service was absolutely top notch for the entire stay. The beach is excellent, the food quite good (though a little pricey for the local but it is a resort), and the rooms are very nicely appointed. We were also upgraded to a casita upon check in. Two minor issues: As other reviews mention the pools are not heated and can be a little bit chilly for an extended period of time. The last night we were there a family with a number of VERY loud young children checked into the adjoining casita (separated by a very non-soundproof door).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing property”
Reviews.Author: travelwitht0ddler
Reviews.Content: This is the nicest place I've ever stayed. The grounds are naturally gorgeous and well maintained. We stayed in the main building. I liked that it had an elevator as opposed to a casita since we were travelling w/ a toddler. I loved the room w/ walk in closet and the bathroom w/ deep tub, and especially the balcony. We were on the jungle side, not the pool side of the building, so the balcony was very private. We could not see other balconies or ppl on the ground. One complaint about the room would be it was humid the first night and I didn't sleep well bc it was so sticky (in the room w/ AC on). It seems like a better AC would take the moisture out of the air. Our toilet did not flush properly and we had to call for service 3 times. Each time they sent someone to look at it, by the third time they finally got it fixed. We were somewhat hoping they would upgrade us for the inconvenience, but we didn't ask and they didn't offer. The only heated pool was the main pool, very expansive. There was a great kiddie pool area w/ separate 1' and 2' pools, heated next to the main pool. We didn't swim in the infinity pool at the ocean bc it was too cold, but it was beautiful to look at. The food at the resort was not outrageously priced at the restaurant on the beach or the restaurant at the main pool, $20-40 entrees, but they will get you on the drinks. A liter bottle of Evian water was $8 in the restaurant. We had a better experience at La Laguna, which is the one at the pool, but that was mostly due to the excellent server, Wilbert. We drove 20 minutes to Playa del Carmen for dinner one evening and lunch one afternoon. It was a tough to find parking both times we visited PDC, but it was nice to have the freedom of a rental car. We really enjoyed dinner at El Bistro on 10th Ave. We stumbled upon a Walmart, so we bought food to have for breakfast and snacks for the little one, much cheaper than resort breakfast or room service. We also drove an hour to Tulum. A must see, get there between 8-9, before it gets hot and crowded. We did lunch at Mezzanine in Tulum and highly recommend it. The boat tour at the Fairmont was nice. It goes out 8, 9, and 10am, reservation required. I had thought you could ride the boat to the beach in addition to the golf carts and bikes, but that is not the case. The only way to ride the boat is to sign up for one of these tours. The beach was beautiful with fine white sand and calm, light blue water. It was not crowded during our stay, plenty of beach chairs and umbrellas. The worst part of our trip was not at the hotel, but the airport. Our camera was stolen out of our checked luggage. So, we have no pictures from our trip. If you have to check your camera, make sure you take out the photo card.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: MrSantaBarbara_8
Reviews.Content: Fantastic property! If you are not into the Cancun scene and want to relax this is the place for you. Perfect for 3 or 4 nights. Great food and service! Would stay there again. It's about 20 minutes from Playa del Carmen if you want to get out for the nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach Vacation”
Reviews.Author: debby29b
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Mayakoba for 4 nights at the end of January. We had a great experience. We stayed in one of the beach casitas. The room was spacious and clean. There is a refrigerator in every room. You can go to the little store by the main pool and buy items to stock the refrigerator and they will deliver it to your room. Our room came with butler service. A butler is really your own personal concierge. We had no need to utilize this service. The regular concierge in the hotel is accessible by phone, and provided excellent service. Your "butler" needs to be contacted by the hotel to call you. You have to call the hotel, ask for your butler, and then they will contact your butler via their pager or two way phone. Other than showing us the property and familiarizing us with our room we never saw them. My boyfriend golfed one day and said it was a good experience. We went to Las Brisas for lunch our first day and it was excellent. We also ate lunch on the beach all the other days under a palapa. It was wonderful and the beach service was excellent. The beach attendants bring you to a palapa of your choice and lay perfectly fitted towels over chairs of your choice. They then bring by cool towels periodically. The waiters on the beach were very attentive. I highly recommend the mango margaritas, and the beer comes in little ice buckets. The beach is an excellent swimming beach with a sandy bottom. The pools are beautiful. The infinity pool by the beach is very picturesque, and looks brand new. All of the pools were so different from one another. We spent all of our time in the beach area so didn't go in the other pools. We ate at El Puerto twice for dinner. The food was incredible, and the service was perfect. Sit outside if you have the chance. I had a spa day that was very memorable, with one of the best massages I have ever had. It is a large spa with lots of amenities and a peaceful atmosphere. After receiving a spa service you are welcome in the spa all day. I got a massage, left the spa and went to the beach, and then later went back and soaked in the pools . There is a large jacuzzi on the women's side and two co-ed pools on the roof surrounded by lounge chairs. Both of these pools are heated.The spa was open until 9PM when we were there. I rode a bike from the beach area to the spa, it took about 10 minutes. The bikes are in various locations around the resort. You ride one to your destination, and leave it for someone else. If you see a bike it's yours. They were in good shape, be sure to test the brakes before you go too far. There is also golf cart service to get you where you need to go. We never waited long, and you can always call and they will pick you up at your room. The overall service at the Fairmont Mayakoba was excellent. We would go back in a heartbeat, hopefully soon! Make sure you sign up for the Fairmont President's Club. You will receive free internet, discounts at the spa and you will not have to pay the daily fee for the gym. It is free to sign up, so very worth your time to sign up.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: rhanson466
Reviews.Content: Fabulous Hotel! Impeccable service, fabulous rooms, amazing walking boardwalk throughout the property. From the Welcome Drink until the check-ou, everything was Amazing! Would love to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: kannm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night after staying at the Banyan Tree Mayakoba. I had booked an exceptional rate with their F&F promotion. We were really pleasantly surprised by how lovely the hotel was -- particularly because we were coming here on the heels of being at another, far more expensive, resort. The staff was attentive and extremely gracious. We had an amazing lunch on La Isla, the service was fantastic and the mango margaritas are both delicious and dangerous (get one!!). And ordered room service for dinner (sushi) which was fine. Our room was nice, considering the rate. However, they NEED wireless internet - their internet connection is something out of 1998. And another caveat -- like all the Mayakoba resorts it is a task to get to the beach I would have given them an "Excellent" but if we were paying their normal room rate (as others will in the future) I think "Very Good" is a more adequate representation of the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Mexico”
Reviews.Author: vwporsche1996
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the best. The rooms were great, the beach was magnificent, and the food was five star. The best part though was our butler, Willie. When we wanted something or had a question or favor, he would take care of it in a flash. The pools were great, and Willie even took care of of the check-in (Although, the check-in staff and concierge staff were very friendly). And, don't listen to the reviews about there being bugs all over the place because there is none. This is a excellent hotel and we hope to go back one day.

Reviews.Title: “Great escape”
Reviews.Author: worldtravel09
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Fairmont. Although we didn't get an upgrade (they were booked with conferences that weekend), rm 4203 in the main building was beautiful and spacious and clean. I'd definitely request a higher floor though (for more privacy and less noise). The property is huge, and golf carts are easy to hop on and off. Staff were very friendly. Definitely join the Presidents' Club for free beforehand for free internet and gym access. The gym has newer equipment and plenty of cardio machines. Restaurants- Laguna is a pretty good restaurant, but skip the boring guac/salsa. Shrimp is excellent in general, fresh and bouncy. Puerta has a great whole snapper; fresh and perfectly prepared. At Coco Maya, baked goods are delicious (especially the hazelnut cookie). Pools- there are many, the best being the infinity pool by the beach. All are in need of renovation as they're a bit tired looking. There are kids everywhere, not just at the pool with the waterslide. I would recommend the spa at the neighboring Rosewood, a much smaller and more upscale property. We were taken in the complimentary car, and spent the day there. The spa area is peaceful and beautiful, the spa has its own outdoor pool, along with indoor hot/cold plunge pools. A short walk down the beach to the Banyan Tree for lunch is also great to explore another property - their service is amazing (the Fairmont concierge said they were booked up for lunch, but when we dropped in, they were happy to accomodate). The ceviche is incredibly fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Not a hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: mchoix
Reviews.Content: I would agree that the property is beautiful. We took our kids (ages 5 and 6). It was chilly and rained 1 day. There is nothing to do at the resort if it is cold and rainy! The pool water was cold! (evidently they have since installed a heater at one of the pools). The "kids pool" is a joke - only a small slide and the pool is deep for a kids pool. I found the conceirge was not useful at all - even rude. The rooms are nice - but they echo... and with 2 bored kids- that was a problem. And we could hear the tv of the room beside us - so I am sure they heard our loud kids. The kids liked the golf carts and the boat tour of the property (we did it twice). The guys who drive the golf carts were great. They always remembered my kids. If you want a quiet resort - read, sleep, and lay around - it's for you! We've stayed at other Fairmont properties (Maui) and there were many more activites/amenaties... and more things for familes/kids. Maybe with this one being so new (3 yrs) they still are ramping up.

Reviews.Title: “Eye Candy”
Reviews.Author: balance415_123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are in our early sixty's wanted a 4 night vacation and being the king and queen of the Caribbean and inclusive resorts we decide to go back to Mexico (not inclusive) after a 10 year hiatus. We needed golf on premises and had our travel agent book our stay. As soon as I saw this resort I said WOW eye candy. Ther service was the best we had in a long time and the food at breakfast (which was included in our price) and El Puerto for dinner was wonderful. We also ate at the Rosewood and Banyan Tree one night each and the Fairmont made our arrangements. The food was great at both restaurants. I loved every part of this resort and in the morning I went to the beach and enjoyed the beautiful white sand and blue water and the infinity pool overlooking the beach was incredible. In the afternoon I went to the quiet pool overlooking the canal and mangrove. The had bar poos,baby pools, kids pool and my favorite pool the quiet pool. The only thing that may be a problem for some is that the resort is spread over a very large area. Peole are taken from one place to another by golf cart like trolleys. The resort was half full and we waited only a few minutes. Even thought there were alot of Europeans there with their children I'm not sure I would take my grandchildren ages 2 and 4 until they were a little older. But I would highly recommend it to couples,adults and honeymooners.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect moment of perfect everything!”
Reviews.Author: DanouZ
Reviews.Content: the resort itself, the service, the friendly service, the food... the Fairmont Mayakoba allowed me to spend 4 perfect days of relaxation, on a beautiful sandy beach. Everything is done to ensure that all guests spend a perfect moment.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Beautiful, 5 star service, a little boring for kids after a few days”
Reviews.Author: 4familycanada
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mayakoba with my 3 kids aged 4,8, and 13, from Feb 6-13th. I echo all of the reviews about the fantastic setting, wonderful and friendly service. We were upgraded to a signature casita with a balcony on the canal. With kids, try to have a room close to the main pool area and La Laguna restaurant to save walking. The place is spotless, and the rooms almost hidden in the jungle setting. Very quiet the week we were there, but next week is very busy hosting the PGA tournament. The golf course looks beautiful . Be sure to join the Presidents Club (free) for free internet and daily paper. If your laptop does not have ethernet, then wifi is only available in the lobby and restaurant areas and not in the rooms. There is an ethernet cable in the rooms however. All of the staff learned my kids names and were able to accommodate any request. Be aware for younger kids, the children's menu is the same at all the restaurants. The pool became heated midway through our stay which made things better. The kids pool has a waterslide. The beachfront pool with the "disappearing edge" was my favourite. The beach area is FANTASTIC, with clear and shallow area for swimming and wide powder sand. Lots of beach recliners and umbrellas and staff to bring towels and drinks and snacks. The kids club is a little shaky, although it does have an organized schedule and your kids can come and go over the day and 3 hours per day per child is included with the room rate. The teenage "camp" is a room with a Wii and 2 pingpong tables and no real activities. There were few if any teens while we were there, so we opted out of that. We had a rental car, and valet parking was efficient but $14/day. Easy to drive to Playa del Carmen, so we had a lot of meals away from the hotel for variety (and to save a few $). Definitely recommend a day trip to Xcaret and also to Xel-Ha; the kids LOVED it. At the hotel, the golf cart transportation and the bicycles added to the charm. Definitely take the little boat tour around the canals to see the fascinating layout. If you have kids and are planning to stay at your resort the whole visit, you might be scratching your head to keep the kids entertained after they've been to the beach and pool a few times. As a home base for travellers with a car, it could not have been better and I would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, relaxing, great value, fun.”
Reviews.Author: jetsetting13
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to the Fairmont Mayakoba for a Saturday to Thursday stay on the great rate promotion of $139. I echo all the positive reviews that you will read on tripadvisor. A couple of points: 1. The spa facilities are terrific. From the massages, to the gym, to the sauna/steamroom/heated whirlpool they are all top notch. Enjoy the roof top pool after a spa treatment. 2. The main pool is now heated! They installed the heating equipment during our stay and as of Feb 10 it was heated. 3. Take Salsa lessons with Julia at the spa. Practice at Laguna restaurant when the Cuban style ban plays. 4. Have drinks in the lobby one night. Sit inside and enjoy the music. 5. Don’t go to Ula Gula for martini’s in Playa del Carmen. They are practically all water. 6. The bikes and golf carts are very convenient. 7. Join the presidents club before you book your stay, it’s free.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Facilities-Food so so”
Reviews.Author: belmontchildcare
Reviews.Content: Our room, 212, was excellent, the staff acomodating and attentive, the grounds beautiful, the food, well, less said the better. However, we didn't go there to eat, but to relax. Playa del Carmen is only a 20 minute (and 170 peso ride away) and worth it. Good restaurants and "tourista" shopping. We had a "private" cab driver, Arturo Sosa [--] Call him (with an hour's notice) and he'll pick you up.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic, one of the best places we have ever been”
Reviews.Author: ML_NY_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Casita, and we took two adjoining rooms. The rooms were beautiful, great bathrooms too, and everything was excellent from the service to the facility to the food. All around, completely outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: Eli7isme
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fairmont Mayakoba for a week in January. It was an incredible stay. When we arrived we were greeted by our name and there were cool towels and a refreshing drink served. Check-in went flawlessly (took about a total of 2 minutes!) We were complimentary upgraded- even though we had never asked and assigned to a Lagoon view Castia. Service throughout the stay remained at this high level, with everyone greeting us with an "Hola" and a smile. The rooms were beautiful- spacious, with plenty of natural light and air. My husband and I particularly enjoyed the bathroom- as it was huge, updated and spotless. The Lagoon view was also really nice and we were able to see many different birds and fish from our balcony. I know some people have complained about the layout of the resort but we actually really liked this aspect of the hotel- it made the resort seem spacious and not overcrowded or over-run. My husband and I enjoyed biking around the property, taking longs walks and when we were tired or not in the mood of physical activity- we never had a problem getting a ride on the shuttle that runs quite literally every 4-5 minutes. The beach at this hotel is really nice with soft sand and blue green water. My husband and I walked up and down the beach in both directions and the Mayakoba beach is really the nicest in the area. We didnt hang out by the pools much but they seemed to be similar to the overall feel of the resort- well laid out and spacious. The spa on site was also top notch with really nice pools and great services to be had. Sign up for the Fairmont Presidents club before arrival and you get a 10% discount and access to the gym (also free internet in the room) We took a cab into Playa del Carmen 2 nights during our stay (about a $15 dollar cab ride each way) for some change of scenery and a little more "action". Overall, this was really everything we could ask for from a vacation- relaxing, luxourious, great service- we truly enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, private place to relax in luxury”
Reviews.Author: Thalina
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned a last minute trip to the Fairmont Mayakoba, and I'm so glad we settled upon this location for our vacation. We were seeking a quiet, private hotel with plenty of opportunities to relax. We got it. Our deluxe casita room was upgraded (without our asking) to a signature casita room free of charge. The room had a huge balcony overlooking a canal. The pillows were soft and comfy. Double closets. Double sinks. A big, wall-length window in the bathroom (covered by a wall outside to ensure privacy) gave lots of light. I never heard any neighbors through the wall/floors. Daily newspaper was USA Today. We didn't use the internet service. Maid service did a great job. During turndown service at night, they'll swap any used towels and provide fresh bottled water for the evening. We loved the french-press coffee and tea service that was refilled every day. The room also had a wine bucket/glasses/corkscrews. They have a Bose radio player that is compatible with iPhones, but NOTE: there is not a "dock" for iPhones on the Bose player. You need to bring an aux adapter cable (not USB) to connect your iPhone. I called the front desk for one, and while the hotel is supposed to have some available, there was never one free when I called for it. The spa was great. You've got access all day if you have a treatment, and after a couples massage my husband and I spent the whole day at the spa pool (we were the only ones up there, so it was like having a pool to ourselves for the day). The spa has complimentary water, fruit, muffins, and juice. You can use the spa, leave, and come back the same day without having to pay again. It was no problem to book an appointment for the time we wanted within 24 hours notice. The gym is in the spa building; my husband bought a 5 day pass for $40. The resort seemed almost empty at the end of January. A trickle of guests; most of the beach/pool chairs were empty and it was never a problem to get a table at the restaurants. There were many families on the property, and the kids seemed to enjoy their pool with the water slide. I saw the babysitting group doing a nature program by the turtle pond, and they looked to be having fun. The beach was nice, but we stuck to the pools most of the time. The hotel is on a long stretch of resorts, so you can walk either direction on the beach for a long time without leaving populated areas. Become members of the Fairmont hotel chain rewards program before arriving. This gives you perks like 10 percent off at the spa (if you sign up for the program on site the perks are available for your next visit, but not the current stay). I'm a picky eater, and I liked almost everything I ate. Quesadillas were great, tuna tartare with avocado was wonderful. Las Brisas has a great tasting menu with superb wine pairings. Watch the wine selections at the Mexican restaurant by the main pool: one glass of simple pinot grigio cost $18, and it was warm and sour -- I sent it back without trouble. Yes, the food is on the expensive side, but at least you're getting good quality for the money. I've been to too many resort hotels where the food is expensive yet lackluster. Pool service is pretty consistent -- they make great mojitos at $10 a drink. We went over to the Banyan Tree resort next door for dinner one night, and that property is stunning. The hotel provided a free shuttle both ways (they're both in the "Mayakoba" development). We enjoyed good Thai food at Saffron. Amazing service, beautiful views, excellent food. If you want some variety, check out Banyan Tree. The service is even better than the high level provided by the Fairmont. We didn't mind walking/taking the shuttle around the vast resort. The spread out nature of the resort gives it a quieter and less crowded feel, and that's what we wanted. We thought about renting a car for a day, but decided against it. Cost would have been $60 for 24 hour. We took a cab into Playa del Carmen one night ($20 one way with tip) and walked the main shopping street. Food was a lot less expensive at the local restaurants in town, but we quickly missed the serenity of the resort. I recommend going to the Cancun airport website and booking a shuttle in advance. For two people roundtrip in a private shuttle, it cost us a total of $105. This was much lower than the price quoted by the hotel for transfers. The service was friendly, and after giving your room number at a restaurant, you were always addressed by Mr. and Mrs. Last Name.
