No competition for chairs, etc. The food was good overall (not outstanding), but we are so spoiled in this regard by NYC restaurants. The breakfasts were excellent. Dinners at El Puerto were the best. The dinner buffets at La Laguna were just good/ok. The food was not hot enough for me (temperature-wise). Beach/pool food was very good. The only negative thing is that the resort is dead at night. They should do a cocktail party or entertainment once a week or something. We ate at Playa del Carmen one night at Negrosol, which was upscale in a Euro sort of way. Otherwise, Playa was colorful and fun but had a very young, crowded, spring-break vibe. Two highlights of our trip were the excursions. We went to Chichen Itza by private tour with a certified guide who also took us to a cenote called Ik-Ikel (I think?). It was an amazing day and really worth the trip. We left at 6:30 am and returned at 8:00 pm. We also really enjoyed a full day at Excaret eco-park: the underground river was an experience and the Mayan/Mexican night show was spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: VeronicaJirina
Reviews.Content: Fabulous resort. It is very large and rooms are a distance from the water but bikes or carts are available for transport. We loved taking the bikes all over. Service was superb, rooms very nice, our balcony looked out onto lush landscape with birds singing constantly- very serene. Good swimming beach, fantastic pool/restaurant besides beach. Food/margaritas were very tasty & not too overpriced. The Spa was one of the nicest I have ever seen. All around, I rate the experience as excellent.

Reviews.Title: “stay away from the fairmont,and go to the four seasons”
Reviews.Author: amdrerd
Reviews.Content: no water sports as stated, rooms are nice, resort too large who wants to wait for a golf cart ride? overpriced and lacks activities food was ok at best, below ritz or four seasons management .charged excessive fees and took 2 days to settle ,including having to change atm card as fraud charges came from hotel staff. pass this place and go for better resorts for better value.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: NYNJTraveler
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay through Fairmont direct and got a wonderful rate (149 USD) thanks to the President's Club email updates. The hotel is beautiful. Our room was spacious, clean and comfortable. The property is huge, and there is a lot of walking. This didn't bother us, but I can see how it would bother others. The beach is a fair distance from the hotel, but there are golf carts running regularly to shuttle guests around the property. We went to the spa and played golf - both were gorgeous. We ate at Las Brisas for dinner one night. It was pricey, but the food and service was wonderful. Easy access to Playa del Carmen and night for dinners. All in all, a great long weekend getaway at the Fairmont!

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Mayakoba”
Reviews.Author: travlingirls
Reviews.Content: My husband and I s.ayed at the Maykoba in Feb. of 2008. He won a trip for work, so we expected a really lavish hotel. The hotel is set in a jungle which they did well in preserving. That aspect I can truely appreciate. However, in order to preserve the jungle, the rooms are far away from just about everything. We stayed in room 556 which was about a mile from the beach and about 1/2 mile from the hotel lounge. They offer bikes and golf carts for convienience (which was kind of fun). The restraunts (4) had traditional local fare which was good, but $$$$$$. We ordered a hamberger and a fish sandwich with 1 margarita and coke. Our bill came to $89.. The pools are are very nice and well kept. They do offer a adult pool and a kids pool. I would NEVER bring my younger kids to this hotel. It is just not the atmosphere and I think they would starve without any real kid friendly foods. I cannot imagine trying to get my kids to the beach on the carts we would literally need to take 2 trips on the golf carts. The rooms of the hotel were average. Each building has 4 rooms with a large window wall in the bathroom. Very relaxing for taking a tub. Overall, it is a beautiful hotel. Very vast and secluded. I would consider this hotel again for a short get away with my hubby, but never a family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, But Big!!!”
Reviews.Author: mladamik
Reviews.Content: My chief complaint would be the distance from our room to the beach. There are the golf carts that will take you, but it seems like you are always waiting on one to come your way. The place is so big that it is really easy to get turned around on the many winding paths. The service was really great! If we stopped and asked "anyone" where something was, they didn't just tell us, they took us where we were trying to go each time. That really means alot! We didn't encounter all the bugs I read about in previous reviews. I think I had one mosquito bother me while we were eating outdoors under the stars, (I have more attack me here at home)! If you are looking for a relaxing quiet hotel, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: randyair
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in a Private Suite located in the beach area of the resort. We did not have an ocean view but a view of the lagoon. As previosly mentioned, this is a huge property. If you are an active person, the are plenty of bikes to ride to get around the property. It is a long distance from the lobby or middle section of the resort to get to the beach and bikes are only available during daylight. The room was beautiful, and the level of service from all employees that we encountered were pleasant and cheerful who went out of their way to make sure your needs were met. The pools were a little on the chilly side. The main pool in the middle of the resort had a swim up bar. The beach was a little dissapointing as there was an abundance of rocks and the clarity and blueness of the water was not like I previously encoutered in Cancun. The food was decent, nothing great and priced at what you would expect to pay in Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Trip”
Reviews.Author: amtraveling
Reviews.Content: Family of five, including three children ages 13, 11, and 9, just returned from a wonderful stay at the Fairmont Mayakoba. The hotel is breathtaking, clean, architecturally dramatic, but naturally nestled in the thick of a natural mangrove loaded with bright flowers, iguanas, tropical birds, butterflies. Winding private paths and bridges invite you to explore your way through the property and down to the magnificent beach. Don't feel like walking? Take a slow boat along the river, or wait no more than a couple of minutes for one of the quiet carts that are constantly running along the paths. Or grab one of the many bikes that are about the property free for your use. Transportation around the resort was easily the least stressful part of our entire stay and made the enormous property feel like it was at our fingertips. There were unexpected and wonderful surprises at every turn: Greeted by cool towels and fresh juice or wine upon arrival. The lobby is gorgeous, cozy chairs, beautiful art and flowers. We never, ever saw our maid service, but every single time we came into our room (3-4 times a day) we could see that she had been there, fresh sheets, bed turned down, fresh coffee, a postcard. On the beach, or at the pool, a staff member brought you towels, offered drinks, or delivered an umbrella before you could even think to ask. They were literally at your service without being obtrusive, or subservient. My children commented at every encounter how the people of Mexico seemed to be so happy all the time. One thing we really enjoyed at the hotel was the constant attention to music. During breakfast at La Laguna restaurant, we were treated to a small mariachi band with a truly wonderful singer. At night, over a beer at La Laguna, another duet with guitars treated us to music under the stars. Breakfast one morning at El Puerto, a harpist; Upon our return from Playa del Carmen one night, a terrific singer was performing in the lobby, so we spontaneously stopped and enjoyed a drink on the veranda. And lunch at Las Brisas, yet another duet set up playing the mexican zylophone while we dined and enjoyed the view of the Carribbean. Such a treat. The food was excellent at every one of the four eateries. We had at least one meal at each spot. Lunch at Las Brisas on the beach was amazing. French fries, chips and Guacamole, ice cold beer and soda, delivered to our beach chairs, even better! Breakfast at El Puerto was my favorite meal with a huge variety of fresh fruits, breads and Mexican inspired dishes. Also fresh salmon, cheeses, deli meats, and omelettes made-to -order. La Laguna at night offered a wonderful buffet for the children with quesadillas, hot dogs, macaroni, fresh fruit and salad, while the adults indulged in amazing seafood dishes (try the gruper!) and tenderloin prepared in authentic Mexican style. Cafe Maya was a treat for the kids: On occasion there would be be REAL Mayan tribal painted men and women outside the Cafe, great for picture ops! Inside: Ice cream, fresh fruit, a huge variety of drinks, hot and cold, chips, sweets and conveniences like sunscreen, and magazines. Poolside, order a drink or a burger at the bar, or have it delivered to your chair. Delicious. The travel office arranged for two excursions off site. Every detail was taken care of. All fees, admissions and transportations were handled by the office. The were extremely helpful with every detail including what would be age appropriate, what to wear, the weather, etc. Our tour guides were very informative and pleasant. We particularly enjoyed the trip to Tulum (about an hour). We went into town (Playa del Carmen) on two nights. Never any problem having a taxi called--Ask and in less than a minute --voila! $17 each way for approx 10 minute trip. Cab drivers were pleasant and helpful, and happy to chat about their favorite eateries, stores. Town was incredible array of shops, restaurants, craftsmen. Our first night were were even treated to a full blown parade which we had a great view of because we landed a balcony level table at La Parrillia Restaurant. Lucky us! I would highly recommend this location and this hotel to anyone who is interested in visiting the Mayan Riviera. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort”
Reviews.Author: joko5176
Reviews.Content: We were invited to stay at the Fairmont Mayakoba through my husband's company for a sales incentive trip from February 14 - 17. This resort is simply AMAZING. From the moment we walked in the door to check in from the time we sadly had to check out, we were treated with nothing but the best service. Our room was one of the casita rooms and it was incredible. Spacious, clean.. the bathroom is truly a sight to be seen. Our room was made up every day while we were out enjoying the beautiful Playa del Carmen weather and they came by every night to offer turn down service. Air conditioning & fan worked perfectly (and quietly for that matter). The resort itself, despite being huge, was spectacular. The grounds were meticulously maintained and the pools were clean and pristine. There were TONS of kids/families and they all seemed to be having a great time on the waterslide and swimming in the pool. Usually, large resorts are a big turn off for me, but there was never a lack of transportation- if you wanted to go down the the beach there was always a golf cart available or one that would be stopping by soon. They also had bikes that you could take at your leisure. We spent the most time at the Infinity Pool by the beach- it was a little more quiet than the main pool. The food at the Mayakoba was just okay. We had two business dinners (buffet) and weren't overly impressed. The events were really spectacular though and very well organized. We did order room service and they were on time and the food was quite good. We've stayed at all-inclusives (which this resort is not) that had just as good, if not better food. The staff was so wonderful throughout our stay. Everywhere we went, we were greeted with a "Buenos Dias" and "Hola". I HIGHLY recommend a stay at the Fairmont Mayakoba!

Reviews.Title: “Sterile”
Reviews.Author: fairfax80220
Reviews.Content: Don't bring your kids. We traveled in Mexico before, and there seems to be a love of children wherever we go, not here. The restaurants didn't seem to be that happy that we had two little ones, no special little treatment, not too many holas from the staff within the eating areas. The ability to walk is pretty much taken away by the golf carts, even though they give the right of way to the person on foot, its not much fun to have a full golf cart stop so we could cross over a bridge. The beach is a long ride from the hotel, and the pool was freaking' freezing. There seemed to be a sterile quality to the whole place, with a staff that was both helpful and polite, that would at times completely disappear, never quite giving you what you wanted. Not what I expected, but, my opinion is blurred by a 2 and 4 year old. If you do not bring the kids, who knows, could be a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Greatly enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Margouille
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 4 nights at the Mayakoba. My husband and I were after a place where we could just relax and enjoy a bit of quality time together. Mayakoba offered us just that! We were in a king size room in the low rise building to the left of the lobby. The room was large, the bathroom impressive! We also had a nice terrace at the front of our room with a lot of privacy. We were on the ground floor and protected behind vegetation. The resort has 5 pools including one for adults only (we didn't actually try it but we saw it). The pools were never busy and the kids seemed to stay in a smaller pool that had a slide. Most of the time we had the main pool for ourselves! The resort is massive and it takes about 10-15min. to walk to the beach, 5mins if you take one of the hotel buggies or a bike. The service was outstanding. We ate in 2 of the restaurants and enjoyed both. I recommend the fine dining restaurant by the beach... We celebrated Valentine's day there, very romantic. The beach front part of the resort has a nice infinity pool and the beach is nice. The beach is a bit dirty to the right of the resort, much better going for a walk the other way. The resort is very pleasant as there are no high rises and lots of gardens. As far as going into town is concerned you need a taxi. It cost us 15-17USD per trip as the resort is about 8kms out of town. We paid rack rate which made it fairly expensive but still worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Mayakoba is luxury!”
Reviews.Author: KateChicago_Illinois
Reviews.Content: I just got back from the Mayakoba and it was incredible. I read the other reviews before I went, and now that I am back, I don't know how anyone could complain about this hotel. First of all, the service was amazing. Everywhere we went there were employees asking us if we needed anything. When we got towels for the pool, the staff would follow us, carrying the towels to put them on our chairs for us. There are so many pools that none of them were ever crowded. We stayed in one of the casitas, and it was lovely and spacious. The bathroom had a nice, big bathtub and a rain shower. And the beds were so comfortable, I didn't want to get up. But when I did get up, I could look forward to a great run through the jungle path to the beach. There were several restaurants to choose from, some very expensive, and some quite reasonable. They all offered excellent food. I just can't imagine anyone complaining about this hotel. If you can't be happy here, I really don't know what it would take.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: daggar
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for the all-inclusive resort setting, this is the place. The room was stunning, so much marble, and the pressed coffee was great. We ate several times at the resort, in several of the restaurants, and even had some convention food served during a meeting I attended. Every morsel was great. The staff was incredibly helpful, and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: honest0112
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel by Fairmont standards, not Mexico standards. We generally prefer Fairmonts, RC's and Four Seasons and we were very impressed from top to bottom with our experience. Stayed in a "Deluxe Signature Casita Suite" and the room was great. Huge, probably close to 1400 SF, with 2 large bathrooms, very comfortable yet elegant living area and a fantastic bed. Maid service was exceptional and prompt for us. The grounds are beautiful, the staff exceptional, the spa world class, the gym more than adequate and we found the transportation, when we used it, to be no problem at all. (we did hear a few people complaining about their few minute wait for their long 100 yard transport to their casita...are you kidding?) Restaurants: The premier restaurant on the beach was actually the disappointment...not bad, just not as good as we expected given it's billing, dress code, pricing, etc. The seafood restaurant in the main building was fantastic by any culinary measure...service, cuisine, presentation, etc. And we had several great meals in the main dining restaurant, breakfast, lunch and dinner. (The Jicama fish tacos are about the best thing I had our entire trip!) If I had one complaint it is that the property store is a total clip joint...it just bugs me paying $6 for a bottle of water, but such is the reality of a resort property...just a pet peeve of mine!) Loved the location, isolated but near so much...it very much has the Fairmont feel. Having read some of the negative reviews I can tell you that if you are an experienced luxury traveler, they are simply silly. This hotel is a very strong 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Great 5+ Star resort”
Reviews.Author: jefk56
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing. It will take you 2 days just to get acclimated - it's over 550 beautifully maintained and appointed acres. Golf carts, bikes and boats are the way to get to the beach and the beachside gourmet restaurant Las Brisas(very good, not great, slightly overpriced for the quality - but very nice room with live Jazz, service impeccable). All rooms are top notch, would definitely go with asking for a lagoon view or, if you can afford, upgrade to a beach casita. Depending on when you go in Feb.(the 19th start I think), the mayakoba golf classic will be at the resort and the golfers will all have the beach and ocean side casitas and villas. Golf course is pristine although fairly easy, resort style golf. Some beautiful views of nature. When you are out and about, the place has a virtual army of staff and they are more than willing to offer help at every turn. However, calling in to request anything from the room turned out to be very sloooowww , but I think that goes with the territory. Rooms had some small ant problems but nothing to worry about. Meticulously maintained(leave a note for the roomstaff to leave extra bottled water). Willow Stream Spa will always be a wonderful memory as the services here were unsurpassed in my life of resort vacationing. From the state of art fitness room, throughout the facility(locker rooms, whirlpool hot tubs, sauna, steam rooms, swedish showers, rooftop deck and pools, hot tubs, lounges)- all was way above excellent - staff and professionally administered services are second to none.(Sampled were pedicure, relaxation massages, facials). La Laguna restaurant was adequate for Breakfast(you could have buffet 24.00pp or a la carte). Nice fruit, omellettes, waffles, quesadillas and all the regular breakfast items in quantity. Las Brisas was excellent for Oceanfront lunch(or served on the beach if you want to mix it up). El Puerto in the main hotel was also excellent for any meal and actually my fave for dinner. The beach was well maintained, long, fairly wide for this area and very swimmable. Service here, as throughout the property, was first class.Lounges, umbrellas, towels, food and drink were all served to your request. Pool areas are amazing also, with a beautiful infinity pool overlooking the beach and a vast pool area nestled between the casitas and another infinity adult pool overlooking a lagoon. Playa del Carmen is just a 10-15 minute 16.00 cab ride away. Numerous shops, restaurants and bars with or without entertainment on the main drag(pedestrian) Fifth Avenue or along the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise at a Price”
Reviews.Author: rockslinger
Reviews.Content: This awe inspiring establishment is as close to paradise as one can get. The pictures do not and cannot do it justice. To say this place is amazing is an understatement. The staff was as equally wonderful and spoke English well. I loved waking up to the sounds of monkeys. We stayed in one of the bungalow type rooms, the bathroom was definitely a highlight (all glass and marble-- gorgeous!). Everything was very clean. It was not really near the beach, but they have golf carts that pick you up almost immediately when step out of your room. The pools were also amazing, infinity with private gazebos, a slide and perfect temp. I cannot rave about or describe Mayakoba as it deserves--a true phenomenon!!! However, a can of Diet Coke-- $4.00 US!!! A large bottle of water $20.00!! Call home less than 5min $80.00!! A lot of people we spoke with went into Playa del Carmen and brought back snacks and drinks--the hotel charged them $50.00!! Nothing was a bargain-- the food at the restaurants was very good, but at those prices, it should have been superb. If money is not an object, stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: dave4761
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed here for a week for a medical conference and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Keep in mind we are an adult couple travelling without kids. This was the first vacation we have taken without our kids in 20 years and while I would not rank the facility kid unfriendly, it is neither exceptionally kid friendly, and I would rank it kid neutral. This is clearly an upper end resort, for people with expendable cash. We stayed with conference rates in the cheap rooms attached to the main bulding of the resort, around $330/night including taxes. We were told for these rooms through the Christmas holiday, they charged and receive high 700's for these same rooms/night. We have stayed in many types of properties over the years with our kids and while I can think of one place that might have had similarly exceptional grounds, perhaps even a little nicer, the service at this facility far exceeded the other places. Even though we were in the cheaper rooms, the room and bathrooms were exceptional. Large and luxurious, clean . Keep in mind the grounds are large and if you are staying in the main resort building, it is 1 1/4 miles to the beach. They provide bicycles around the resort for you to travel with, or you can travel in boats or the ubiquitous golf carts, which are driven by resort personnel. We had no problems getting where we needed to go. If you are going with kids you will probably want to stay around the pool or at the beach. The prices for these rooms climb significantly, and I think for the beach front casitas, they were in the vicinity of $1700-1800/night. They are, however, exceptional accomodations with butlers. Personally, I would not stay here with small children. The food is good, particularly at the higher end restaurant on site, Las Brisas,. We only ate dinner at the resort two out of seven nights, and otherwise cabbed into and ate in Playa del Carmen, the other 5 evenings. Round trip cabfare with tip, about 400 pesos. I would definitely stay at this facility again and strongly recommend it to the higher end traveller, particularly adult only couples or families with older children, particularly older teens, but get prepared to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing spectacular...”
Reviews.Author: kishmish
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mayakoba in January 2008. The property is huge, with the lobby located about a mile and a half from the main gate (don't even think of walking, it's a jungle with a paved road), and the beach is another mile and a half from the lobby. Only a small number of ($$$) rooms are located on the beach, with some located on the lagoon (a natural underwater river that has been tapped to flow through the resort), and some just off the garden paths. The room itself was a good size, with a big bathroom, and a flat screen TV. Beds are absolutely heavenly and the pillows were nice and soft as well. Double sinks and a soaking tub in the bathroom, along with a little garden outside of the tub are a real treat. Room service was a little sketchy, as I had to call twice in the four days for my room to be made up (it was past 1:30pm). Complimentary newspaper appeared the first day, and didn't show up again until the last day when we requested it. Food at the resort is pricey, and service does not come with a smile. The employees walking the pathways of the hotel are very friendly, always offering an "ola", but the hostesses and servers in the some of the restaurants were borderline rude. I would walk into a restaurant and have to work to get the attention of the hostess who was usually standing there gabbing with a co-worker. Laguna's breakfast buffet runs about $24 per person and isn't worth it. Las Brisas (restaurant on the beach) has slightly more flavorful food, and the service was better. El Puerto was open for dinner only, and never had the chance to try it. The pools are great, especially for kids (wouldn't recommend the water slide for adults as pool is only 4.5ft deep), with an adult only swimming pool located outside of Laguna restaurant that is quite peaceful, but the infinity edge overlooks the river and trees, and you start to miss the ocean. The pool near Las Brisas has the desirable infinity edge overlooking the ocean. The beach is rather small, and not always the cleanest. The water was murky up until our last day there. It is a public beach, and the Fairmont needs to do a better job in cleaning it up each morning. Keep in mind that unless you are staying ocean-front, getting to the beach is a bike ride (mountain bikes located all over the resort for your use) or a 4-5 min golf cart ride away. There is also a boat that runs on the lagoon that takes about 20 minutes to get you from the beach to near the main lobby. Overall, the Fairmont is a scenic property, but definitely not ocean front. You will feel isolated as it is a 20 minute ride from Playa del Carmen, leaving you very dependent on the over-priced, below-average restaurants. Once in the resort, you can't really tell you are in Mexico, so unless that is the feel you are looking for, I wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Their Casita is Your Casita !”
Reviews.Author: jwsmd3
Reviews.Content: A near perfect week. I liked the resort and the Mexican people so much that the following is not only for fellow travelers but for Fairmont so they can further refine their excellent service and facility. Spent two nights in one casita (in the 7 block) and because of air conditioning problem, upgraded to following 5 nights in another, lagoon view, casita ( in block 1...facing a canal and across from the Event Lawn where a full out reception could be heard thru the closed glass doors but quieted down by 9 or 10 PM.. A few pluses/ a few minuses. -Outstanding, super friendly and helpful staff. Superbly professionally trained to be courteous and keep their cool no matter what the issue or how upset a guest may be, Derailed balcony shutter, light bulbs that blew out, a minor mistake on my account and a recurrent air conditioning shut off problem were responded to within minutes with follow up phone calls inquiring as to satisfaction. -With five pools (counting the two side by side toddler pools as one) there is always a lounger available. I did see a kid transiently at the "Adults Only" pool,,,,,I guess it's tough to enforce a rule when everyone is paying so much. The beach loungers were more comfortable than the double ones at the Adults pool and more so than the strangely uncomfortable pool side loungers. Cucumber slices for your eyes on a hot day were kinda silly but got some use ! The design of the main pool is fantastic....filled with smaller nooks and crannies so you never feel like your surrounded by a crowd of people. -The provided map and ground markings are inadequate. Night time lighting is limited. It's easy to get lost, especially after a margarita, but maybe that's part of the fun! -Excellent housekeeping twice a day with mild inconsistencies. Even when I hid the soap remnants they didn't replace them?!?!. The last night we got two sink front rugs. One room had a scale the other didn't (who cares). They never circled the weather forecast or filled in tomorrows max temperature on the nice bird watching/ identification cards they put on the beds each night. No chocolates! Maybe attracts wildlife ! -First room had 3 different lamps and the second only two...with the bedside lamp a single instead of the nice double as seen in some of these pixs! -The next to last night I learned that they do 7, 8 and 9 AM 45 minute round trip nature tours on the boat that you have to sign up for. This was NEVER advertised...anywhere. The boat to/ from the beach take different routes, the journey about 25 minutes each way and the drivers were very informative about the nature around/ ecosystem. -The bikes were fun. Think twice if you haven't been on one in years or you've had a few drinks...for your own and everyone else's safety. Maybe they should hand you a list of rules on check in since the ones fixed to the bottom of the basket (on some, not all) of the bikes is too fine print to read. Yes occasionally there are none to be found and while there's a full time mechanic about 9 - 12 bikes were out of commission each day. Always check the brakes. Rely on the rear one more as I know someone went head first coming down from a bridge for applying only the front ones ! -Mosquitos were at a minimum in Jan, perhaps more in the rainy months..come prepared and spray regularly. I did see a small dark spider in one room but, heck, I live in an old house with plenty of them. Perhaps someone else's horror story lead to regular extermination. Yes there are scorpions and monkeys and snakes and little alligators...it's the jungle and the same at all the Mayan Riviera resorts. -Restaurant prices were high end, especially for Mexico, especially with our devalued US dollar....but on a par with other high end resorts and Manhattan. Quality was very, very high as was service. Portion size at Las Brisas was on the small side and at 8 PM with a 6 year old running around snapping digital pix's and tow 5 year olds at the next table, the romantic potential and appreciation for haute cuisine were deflated despite the terrific musical trio (there was live music in almost every restaurant and lobby every night and in the lobby and beach side restaurant daytime too).......so I canned my reservation to return and indulge in the tasting menu with accompanying wines. PS the markup on bottles were 400 to 500 %. It is $16 US each way by cab to Playa del Carmen and while good, even the upscale places there were not as good as at the Resort....even the creative Mexican stuff at the Laguna rest. which was superb. Playa is just a bit honky tonk. -The prices for souvenirs at the airport were much higher than the resort and while selection was less, quality was better at the resort than at Playa. -The gym was great but $49 to use the spa facilities if you aren't having a treatment seemed really steep. While everyone raves about the spa, prices seem quite steep with 10% tax and 15% service charge to be applied. Overall I can't remember returning from a resort so relaxed and pleased. I'd go back tomorrow! However, if your watching your wallet, forget it otherwise have a margarita and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Hawaiiherewecome
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Fairmont. We are a family with a toddler, preteen and a teen and first time Mexico tourists. The property is gorgeous, service wonderful, food very good. We loved the beach, and although staying at the main building we were about 10 minutes away (which does take away a certain magic of staying "right on the beach"), the kids loved taking the golf carts (there were always plenty around). The pools are great as well. We chatted with quite a few other families staying there, as well as some people we happen to know who stayed there a few months before, and everyone was unanimous in their raves. This is a great hotel. Do note that it is somewhat isolated, so if you don't rent a car you need to arrange all excursions or take cabs, literally nothing is within walking distance. We had a few day trips. We did an Edventure tour of Tulum, cenotes and snorkeling with the turtles, which was a wonderful day. We also used Brant at Entertainment Plus to arrange for a car and driver to take us to Chichen Itza, Ik Kil and Ek Balam (the latter) was the kids' favorite ruin. The driver was prompt and pleasant but NOT English speaking as advertised and promised. But it was a wonderful (and educational) trip. This was a wonderful family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely out of this world!”
Reviews.Author: utleyuu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Mayakoba Resort with our 18 and 21 year old kids for 15 nights during the Christmas and New Year holidays. It was absolutely amazing. At first I was a bit worried due to some of the previous reviews on this site, but it was nothing like they had experienced. We had a fantastic time. The staff was top notch! Especially Laita, in the lobby bar, and Omar down at the adult pool. The concierge staff was also very helpful with reservation requests to restaurants in Playa. We had a casita one-bedroom suite with a separate living area where both the kids stayed (one on a pull out and one on a cot. This also provided us with two bathrooms which was perfect. The bathrooms are HUGE and must been seen to be believed. After our son left we downsized to a one room deluxe casita with two queen beds and one washroom. This room was also amazing, although much smaller than our suite. The housekeeping staff is great and they kept the rooms perfectly clean with nightly turn down service and clean linens as needed. The resort area is very, very large and the bikes and golf carts are always readily available. We spent most of the first week camped out on lounges by the pool near the beach but then moved to the adult only infinity pool in the middle of the resort as more and more family showed up with small children. The adult only pool was a quiet paridise away from the noise of the children. When we arrived on Dec 18th, the resort was very quiet, but as Christmas came the small children also arrived. The nice thing is that there is always a place to go to find quiet as the resort is so enormous. We rented a car for the entire time from National, which gave us freedom to come and go as we pleased. The restaurants at the resort are great and the food suberb, although eating at 3 places for 15 days gets a bit boring so we ventured into Playa at least every second night. Our favourite restaurants in Playa are Da Vino and the Glass Bar. Located directly across from one another and both owned by the same person. Both are Italian gourmet. We also enjoyed our days at Xcaret and Xel-Ha. My suggestion would be to do Xcaret if you only have time for one as it is more culturally specific and the nightly two hour show is spectacular. Xel-Ha is only for snorkelling and would be great for smaller children. It was an amzing resort with amazing staff!!

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED the Fairmont Mayakoba!”
Reviews.Author: designguru
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Mayakoba was a magical, wonderful, elegant discovery! From the moment you pull up to the beautiful entrance, every detail of this hotel has been thought through - its just breathtaking. The fact that it was 'carved' out of the existing mangrove habitat to create these serene lagoons is sublime, and has the added benefit of having become an incredible bird sanctuary - we saw many species of water birds happily sunning themselves everywhere we looked! The staff were the most friendly, open, accomodating people we encountered anywhere. It was just a very calm and relaxing place. We had a great time riding bikes around the grounds (a few minute ride down to the beach), then taking an electric boat back up to our room through the mangrove lagoons. dg

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: sjmacdee
Reviews.Content: As with all Fairmonts, the staff was superb. The training for everyone from gardeners to waiters is amazing. The hotel is carved out of the jungle, with most of the jungle intact. The bird watching is the best I have ever seen. It is truly a beautiful place. The restaurants may be the best I have found in any hotel. The food was great. The layout is a little challenging. Most of the rooms are convenient to one of the many pools, which are great, but everything is quite a distance from the beach. There are golf carts that will take you anywhere, but they can be hard to find during the busy times. The rooms are huge, the baths have to be seen. Huge terrariums that allow natural light into them. I have two issues with this resort. The front desk has a few communication problems. I left four messages for members of our party to inform them where to meet the first night for dinner, none were delivered. Also, our luggage took two and a half hours to make it to our room. The front desk insisted it was in our closet. It was not. Otherwise, this is a great resort with an amazing staff.

Reviews.Title: “Mayakoba Golf rip-off”
Reviews.Author: flyerfan1
Reviews.Content: I played at Mayakoba one day last week. Great course, but expensive - $250. However, the staff leaves much to be desired, and I will never return due to the following incident: I called on Monday to make a tee time for Monday afternoon. I found out later in the week that they charged me for an additional round claiming that I made a reservation that I did not keep. When I called to dispute the charge, the clerk (Ivete) told me that she had "proof" that I made the reservation because it was "in the system". How did it get in the system? She put it there! (I only spoke to the shop on the phone, and had no way to enter it myself) Ivete lied to my face and told me that she remembered me asking for both tee times. When I asked to speak to the manager, I was told that he was "in a meeting". I have contacted Visa to dispute this, but I am not going to hold my breath, as I was told that foreign charges are harder to dispute. I was told by someone else that in Mexico, staff is held responsible for reversed charges, so I am sure that they will do everything they can to keep from paying out of pocket. They hold the reservations using a credit card, so beware that even if you play, they may charge you for as much as they want! Stay away! It's a shame, too, because the course was challenging and scenic. But I can barely justify $250 for a round, let alone double that!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort...stay away from Europcar (rental car)”
Reviews.Author: GHCoppell
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort. One of the nicest resorts we have ever been to. The only issue there were very few things for our children to do. We didn't have the best weather which didn't help. Mostly adualts at the resort. Some families with little children. Staff was terrific. Beach was very nice. I would not advise renting a car from Europcar. We did and it was a mistake. I received a very hard sale from a Europcar representative for a condo visit. I finally said we might do it just so we could get out of there. As we are driving down the highway I noticed as my wife the Jeep is in poor condition. Bottom line we did not feel safe in this Jeep. It was several years old and more fit for traveling through a jungle than for tourist. I drove back into Cancun the next moring and replaced the Jeep with a car. The whole experience with Europcar was very bad. We did have a good family vaction though.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff & Facilities”
Reviews.Author: mhellman
Reviews.Content: My family & I were a little aprehensive after reading several poor reviews. These people must have stayed somewhere else. We thoroughly enjoyed our 4 night stay. The resort was immaculate. This resort is perfect if you like an intimate setting with all of the amenities of a full scale facility. Most of the rooms are in "casita's" scattered throughout the immense property. Most of these have very private balconies. You can ask at check in for a private view. The main pool meanders and is segmented. Although quite large, almost all of the lounge chairs are directly poolside and are sectioned off from other pool area's. The beach area has a seperate infinity pool and a good bar/restaurant. The food and service in all of the restaurants was excellent. I had a good quality massage at the Willow Stream spa. The spa was certainly above average, but a shade under what I would consider "top notch". I'm not saying that there was anything wrong with it. Just not a destination spa. The golf course is world class and compares with any that I have played. It's a challenging, yet fair, test of golf. All in all, I would highly reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very special place”
Reviews.Author: sweet6383
Reviews.Content: we just spend one week at the fairmount and i must say that this was the best resort i have ever stayed in. the service was fantastic without being pushy, food great, ground emaculate. the pool area was fantastic as well as the ocean grounds chairs, everything was a ten. i am trying to find anything wrong, and the only thing i could possibly come up with is one ply toilet paper instead of two-ply, and by the way the bathroom were spectacular as well as the room. the staff has to be complemented for their freindliness and they never had their hands out like out resort employees... great job

Reviews.Title: “Beauty and the Beast”
Reviews.Author: njr423
Reviews.Content: Just returned from extended weekend at business conference at Mayakoba and writing review to express my disappointment. Definitiely did not meet expectations. There are some positives - Beautiful grounds, Friendly staff who try to provide good service. well furnished and large rooms and very clean all around - Great spa treatment. However, some major negatives - Rooms in garden villas are poorly designed. The walls are paper thin and you can hear the adjacent rooms every move , their tv, showers, toilet etc. The entrance way to my suite flooded when it rained ( and in the tropics it always rains) - At night the paths are not marked, lighting is very poor making it very diifficult to find your room, - upwards of half the staff didn't speak english so couldnt help with the simple requests. Playa del Carmen and Rivera Maya are beautiful locations. NExt time i'm staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: jramon
Reviews.Content: The property is great, nice pools, beach and rooms. But if you are looking for a romantic getaway this hotel is not the place to go. During our stay they had two convention groups so the ambiance of the hotel was definitely not in line from what you would expect at a luxury resort. The concierge had no clue on recommending a good restaurant in Playa del Carmen nor had suggestions for activities on a rainy day, would you call that person a Concierge? at a Fairmont?

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: trekkingaround
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews I did not know what to expect, some loved it some hated it. I LOVED IT. The service was exceptional; from the minute we pulled up and were greeted by name, and offered cool towels and beverages. Everyone seemed to go out of their way to assist us in any way they could. The food was great, transportation around the resort was prompt and everyone was friendly and nice. We upgraded when we got there for a third of what the price would be on line, to a suite with a private pool on the roof, beautiful at sunset. I’ve stayed at some of the best hotels of the world, Four Seasons, Ritz Carlton, etc and this was one of the best, I would highly recommend the Fairmont Mayakoba!

Reviews.Title: “Over priced Nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: donnyagreen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for romantic vavation. VERY nice resort, great food, clean rooms beautiful beach. secure location with a good staff. Major problem is transportation. We waited over 30 min for trasportation to the beach on property. all the cars were full, same as gondola ride always full. We walked 30 min to the beach 1 day staff had filled all the cars. This was a Major problem every time we tried to go somewhere. I would call the front desk & they would claim someone was coming. Awful.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Playa”
Reviews.Author: MikiJuli
Reviews.Content: We are amazed that this hotel is not ranked higher. if you ask locals in Playa- they will tell you that the "Mayakoba" is the best hotel in Playa- and our stay would seem to suport that! The hotel is very new and is beautifully designed with a great personality that makes it very distinctive vs. the average hotel. The service was great and the food/beachside restaurant was particularly nice up at the beach. The swimming pools are also distinctively designed and well positioned to enjoy both the beach and the "rivers/manglares". We enjoyed our room with the river view- and while most rooms are a bit distant from the ocean (by design) the golf carts that shuttle you back and forth are plentiful - or it's even more fun to get there or back by boat or bicycle (about 15-20 bikes available for use around the hotel). The rooms were also very spacious - with great bathrooms. We also played on the PGA golf course- which was breathtaking and had great views of the ocean, the "manglares" and the rivers. Once caveat for those unfamiliar with Playa- the hotel is not near the center of town and is a $16 /15 minute cab ride away (at the time of this review). We would definitely recommend this hotel for people who are looking for a place with lots of personality, a modern, sophisticated feel, yet not over-pompous or old fashioned

Reviews.Title: “We just loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kleine-genieter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont last June for a long weekend. It was part of a corporate event and the family was invited to join. The hotel is just wonderfull, the pools are great, the food is fantastic and the staff are really friendly. It's just amazing that all the staff members speak such a good English, after all it is still Mexico! The rooms were spacious and clean and the golf carts came regularely. My kids loved the kids club and the babysitters are very skilled and very friendly, they also speak English. In sum, we will go back there soon, but I would stay much longer than just a long weekend!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in Playa”
Reviews.Author: HobokenGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind being about 10-15 minutes from downtown Playa del Carmen, the Fairmont Mayakoba is a lovely resort with plenty of ammenities. We had a spacious room that was not super luxurious but new, very comfortable and nicely put together with a pretty patio- it was strange that there was no full length mirror. The bathroom was modern and more luxurious than the bedroom. The resort itself is beautiful- there are a number of pools and the beach is wonderful. The pool area at the beach is particularly nice. The resort is very large and getting around is fun - they have golf carts and boats that make the rounds around the property or you can borrow a bike, ride around and leave it where you land. The staff is extremely friendly and the service efficient. The ceviche at any of the restaurants is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Views, Service not up to par with the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: BlueDevilTraveler
Reviews.Content: I was here for a business meeting and was lucky enough to stay in one of the bungalows at the beach. We had our own private plunge pool looking out over the beach/ocean. The golf cart transportation was quite prompt and easy to use. My only complaint was the food was very mediocre both at Las Brisas as well as served at the meeting. Since the minibars were empty it would have helped to have a few more choices of food/drink to purchase at the ministore. Next time would stop at the grocery store before arriving at the resort. Bottled water was free and the room was tip-top- modern with a glass "garden" shower. The room was spotless and had good internet connection but not wireless. Wireless in the conference rooms was spotty The staff was helpful but lacked the polish seen by the staff at the Ritz in Cancun. Weather was gorgeous and I'd definitely go back

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time or money -- this "resort" is horrible!”
Reviews.Author: m_gedi
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Mayakoba after staying 6 nights, and could not wait to leave. We would have left to go to the Ritz Carlton in Cancun had we been able to without forfeiting about $450 in tours we had already scheduled. If you are looking for a place to sit at the pool or beach and do only that -- sit (and drink or read), you could probably do much better elsewhere. There is a beautiful golf course if you want to play in 90 degree heat and 90% humidity with the bugs and mosquitoes, or utilize the spa. However, my girlfriend ruled out the spa after the repeatedly poor service we experienced. We had issues from the moment we arrived. The service was so bad in every department, that at times we wondered if we were on a hidden camera show. When we asked for things, we either got something different than we asked for, or nothing at all. For example, I ordered four beers (for the reasonable sum of $30) from room service that I chilled over ice and stored in our room's refrigerator. I went to enjoy one later the next day, and they were warm. I called the front desk to see if they could send a maintanence attendant to check the machine and was told that it was a "beverage center" and not designed to keep drinks cold. What, then, was it designed to do? It certainly looked like a refrigerator. After reading about the "standard refrigerator" in each room in the in-room resort guide, I asked a room service waiter the next night if the machine in the room was indeed a refrigerator. My question was met with a quizzical look, as though I asked him if the canvass and rubber things on his feet were shoes. I said that it wasn't keeping my drinks cold -- he, of course, responded by saying, "uh, maybe it's broken." Duh! However, after asking him to send a maintanence person to the room, my refrigerator / beverage center remained, uh, broken. This may seem nit picky (not to me), but imagine every time you ask for something, from requesting one foam pillow one night and having all of your feather pillows replaced with foam pillows for the rest of your stay, or asking to be picked up from your room and having no one show up, or being completely ignored as you sit at the bar as the bartender breaks down the liquor bottles with five tables seated 40 minutes before the bar is actually supposed to close, it gets really old after a while. This is not what you expect from a five star resort, and we were fed up after a few days. Frankly, if we were staying at Fast Eddie's Roadside Motel, I would have overlooked the dead dried bugs on the white bedspread, the bathroom thermostat that didn't work, or the broken sliding doors that I almost cut my foot on trying to get them to close properly. But this is supposed to be a five star resort -- so I did notice these things, and when they are not isolated to one or two things, it becomes quite irritating. The food and menus at El Puerto and Las Brisas (the property's signature restaurant) are totally substandard if you enjoy eating (great) food. I was amazed at the complete lack of local ingredients and the limited local fish available on the menus. Who wants to eat duck, rack of lamb, Cornish hen or risotto in 90 degree heat? Further, the food quality was so bad that we actually cancelled our main courses at Las Brisas and went back to the room to order room service. This was after sending back three drinks in a row: a signature martini that was served room temperature and smelled truly like vomit, a special margarita that was made with brown sugar, lime juice and tequila (imagine honey and tequila, not a tasty combination) and a dirty Grey Goose martini that was green and murky because it was all olive juice with a splash of vodka. At least they didn't screw up the beer -- although it took three times of me asking to actually get limes for my Pacifico. I actually got a call from the resort's executive chef the next morning who asked me to detail the problems at the restaurants we experienced, and he assured me that this was in the process of being fixed. (Apparently, the chef at Las Brisas left two weeks prior, presumably because the menu and fare is so poorly designed, unappealing and does not compliment or match the surroundings). To my surprise, he agreed that the menus were not up to the standard that their "main competitor, the Ritz Carlton up the road" are. Guess that was my problem? Overall, we had a very expensive vacation, and feel like we paid handsomely for a miserable and frustrating experience. We have stayed at the Kea Lani and had a totally different experience with Fairmont resorts. However, this resort does not measure up. In fact, I'll close with a comment the general manager made on our last night after I was so completely fed up that the front desk patched me through to his cell phone. After I recounted a few experiences with the hotel when I felt the service level was below expectations (we had a list of over 30 problems over 6 days), he responded by saying, "Sir, you made the choice to come to Mexico. What did you expect?". That pretty much sums up our experience. Apparently, one should not expect much. In fact, if you expect nothing, there's even a chance this resort may exceed you expectations! Don't go, unless you don't mind bad food, atrocious service, and a swamp marketed as a fabulous Mayan jungle. Trust me, it's only fabulous for the many, many bugs that live there...

Reviews.Title: “One of the finest vacations ever!”
Reviews.Author: lucyolivia
Reviews.Content: We just retuned from a week at The Fairmont Mayakoba. Upon arrival we were greeted in the lobby with a ice cold washcloth and an ice cold drink of guava juice. That was just the beginning. The casita that we stayed in was wonderful, the staff friendly , never forgetting to greet us. We found no problem with getting around the resort, allways a golf cart to pick us up or a boat to take us to the beach, or a bike. We traveled with our 5 year old and found the resort to be very child-friendly. Downtown Playa is also not to be missed. I will return again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay last fall”
Reviews.Author: msruckus
Reviews.Content: This review is very late, so I cannot remember all of the details of my stay. Overall, though, we were extremely pleased and would go back in a heartbeat. The property is gorgeous and so different from Cancun. It seems much more upscale than anything around it. The design of public spaces was modern but relaxed. The room was really beautiful. Simple, elegant, clean. The bathroom was my favorite part. I am actually planning to redo my bathroom at home to look just like this one. We had no problem walking around the large properties or taking the golf carts or boat shuttles around. However, there were not enough working bikes if that was what we wanted to use to get around. The spa was magnificent! Truly the best hot stone massage I have ever had. We were underwhelmed by the food at the hotel which is why I only gave it a 4 instead of 5. La Laguna was fine for breakfast and for light meals. El Puerto (I think it is called, the seafood restaurant near the lobby) was not very good at all. The restaurant by the beach was okay as well, but nothing special. We ate in Playa del Carmen a number of nights and had some great meals there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort & Easy to Relax”
Reviews.Author: rileyscountry
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fairmont Mayakoba for a company trip. I had read many of the reviews and was a little weary. We did have a issue upon checking in- the room was already occupied. However, they quickly corrected their error and paid for our entire dinner at La Laguna. That was the ONLY issue we had at this resort. The pool staff was wonderful, as Luis, the bartendar, remembered our room number and drinks by the second day. The food at La Laguna was very good. We ate at Las Britsas for lunch, and you couldn't ask for a better view if you eat outside (yes a little spendy but wonderful). The resort is large. However, we never waited for the golf carts if we needed them. With the space comes the privacy... there was NO ONE at the pools... we felt like we had the resort to ourselves for most of the week. I think if people measured the actual steps they took from the 20 story mega-resorts (don't forget the wait for the elevators) they have stayed at in the past versus the Fairmont's one flight of steps down the casita to the path and the three mintue walk to a wonderful, very private variety of pools, they would be surprised!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Darn Great”
Reviews.Author: ritterbride
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on a variety of sites, I was expecting an underwhelming, overpriced experience- but I was wrong. As we drove up to the gate, we could tell that this property was going to be fabulous. The resort is amazing. There was a tremendous amount of labor that went in to the development of the flat, hot jungle terrain that this is built into. I think everything was fantastic. I can't believe anyone really complained as much as they did. The staff, the design, the amenities and overall ambiance was great. We only had breakfast and lunch on-site, but both were fabulous (breakfast buffet especially). I cannot speak for the dinners, but on the last day I regretted not having had dinner at the property- probably at the restaurant overlooking the beach. We only stayed for 3 nights and couldn't fit in a spa visit, but after using the gym I regret not making time for a treatment. The only area that was a small annoyance was the distance from our room to the beach. We were situated in the middle of the property and since it was so hot we blew off the beach after the first day. Huge mistake. It just got a little old traveling by golf cart everywhere, but please don't let this get in your way like we did. The pools were very nice, however. The staff was warm, and extremely attentive. It was my impression that the economy is doing well in this area and locals really recognize and appreciate the impact tourism has had on the area. Overall, great experience. Let me know if you have questions. One note- if you are thinking of Xel-ha, don't go if you are only able to book a full-day tour. Way too hot, too little to do, too many people for 8 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: keirao
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fairmont for 6 nights in June. This hotel is about 35-40 minutes from the airport in Cancun, which is a little annoying, but when you get there you will feel instantly relaxed. We were greeted with a welcome drink and a cool scented cloth. Our check-in was very quick and we were escorted to our room by the bellman. The property: The property itself is quite large and you have several options for getting around. The first is walking, which we did most of the time. We were about a 5 minute walk from the lobby and breakfast place (La Laguna). The walk to the beach was a little longer, so most times we grabbed bikes or took a ride on the golf carts. There was never an occasion where we were unable to get from one place to the next. Golf carts were everywhere and there were always bikes at the beach. There were water taxis as well, but they ran every half an hour and we never wanted to wait, but they seemed nice. The Rooms: We had one of the Casita rooms overlooking the jungle and it was beautiful. It had a huge bathroom, two sinks, huge tub and separate shower. There was a huge terrace which had seating and was pretty secluded. The only thing I disliked was the fact that there was no screen to go out to the terrace, so we were unable to leave the doors open to the room and get fresh air. Restaurants: We tried all three places. LaLaguna was more of a breakfast place, although they had some nice lunches. I wouldn't go there for dinner. They offered a buffet, but we always ordered a la cart. Try the banana smoothie...it's awesome. The other restaurant (I can't remember the name) overlooked the beach and was the BEST one. They had a great live jazz band and the setting was completely romantic. Although they had no chicken on this menu, the steak was fabulous. The third restaurant was El Puerto which was in the main building. This restaurant was mostly seafood, and was very nice except that my husband and I both got sick from the food. He had the surf and turf and I had the chicken. At the pools they also have food which they will bring to you, which is more like quesadillas, nachos, etc. The Pools: There are three pool areas. The main one is right next to LaLaguna and is beautiful. There are plenty of umbrellas or shady areas. The other one (which we did not go to) was toward the lobby and was rather small. The bellman told us that since they do not serve drinks there, it is almost always empty. The last pool area is right by the beach with an inifinity pool. This I had heard was an adults only pool, but I am not sure. Beach: Beach was very nice. Tons of umbrellas and people to set up towels and chairs for you. Having been to Cancun, this beach is slightly more cloudy and has a few rocks and vegetation as you walk in. It is not as pristine and clear as the beach in Cancun. It was slightly more wavy as well. There were no water sports except for a guy walking around asking about jetskiing. However, it didn't seem like you could really go anywhere with the jetski, so we didn't bother. Service: EVERYONE at this hotel is friendly, kind, and helpful. We even had a guy who was on his way to stock a vending machine offer to take our bags to the lobby. CLEARLY this was not his job, but did so with a smile. The staff was happy to smile at my spanglish and help me to practice. The Spa: One word-OUSTANDING. Immaculate, relaxing, and one of the best spas I have ever been to. My husband and I go to spas wherever we go, and we both agreed that this was the best. I had the scrub with ylang ylang and massage and my husband had the hot stone massage. Playa Del Carmen: TWO WORDS-BE CAREFUL...my husband was robbed at knifepoint after getting money from an ATM in the shopping area. We are both native New Yorkers and typically consider ourselves street smart. I suggest you carry a small amount of cash when going to that area and no important documents. Overall: One small thing that bothered me throughout the trip was the presence of tiny ants everywhere. At the pool, in the room, and it was generally annoying. I would like to see more Mexican cuisine at the restaurants as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Don_Covay
Reviews.Content: We set up a quick getaway through JetBlue approximately three weeks in advance. The entire process was seamless and the hotel was an excellent place to stay. We spent three nights and four days. Probably just about the maximum amount of time, unless you were leaving the grounds. The resort is 30 minutes from the Cancun airport. It's very well maintained and quite beautiful. We were upgraded from a main hotel room to a casita, which had a beautiful bathroom, two queen beds, flatscreen television and excellent air conditioning. There was always bottled water in the room and the maid service was quick, thorough and timely (2x a day). There are several pools on the grounds. The main pool is broken into several different pools, including an "adults only" infiniti pool over-looking part of the lagoon. The main pool is walking distance from the main lodge and the various casitas. The beach is approximately a mile from the main lodge. There are regular golf cart rides and boats through the canals. The easiest and quickest are the bikes, which are stationed all over the resort and, honestly, the best way to get out there. We really liked that. The beach is beautiful, has a great pool overlooking the ocean and plenty of covered chairs looking out towards the gulf. The water is warm and the bottom sandy and smooth. We had an excellent experience here and would definitely return. The negative comments about the distance among the various places on the grounds seem exaggerated to me. The negative comments about the service are also exaggerated. The service was not without flaws, but it was hardly problematic. There was ample opportunity for drinks and food throughout the resort and at virtually any time you wished for it. With the exception of El Puerto (the restaurant in the main part of the hotel), the restaurants were only ok. We ate two dinners at El Puerto, having grilled fish each time. Both meals were outstanding. Bottomline is that the Fairmont Mayakoba is a great, quick getaway. It seemed to be an excellent place to bring children and I'd certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Go for the spa and breakfast- have the rest of your meals elsewhere...”
Reviews.Author: dirigible
Reviews.Content: Huge resort . The trek to the beach was long but the different ways of getting around were fun and novel (although it might get tiresome after a longer stay) . My husband and I were taking bets as to when the first drunk tourist will walk off of one of the many "bridges" and fall into the lagoon at night. Beach service and pool service good. The small waterslide was fun! Spa was divine! My husband and I had the couples massage and both therapists were really good and responsive- (even asking about the room temp and music). Relaxation area and sauna/jacuzzi area lovely. Spa staff wonderfull. Gym was great and well staffed. We had a basic room which was large with a great bathroom and nice balcony. We loved the buffet breakfast (there was a convention crowd when we were there and so maybe that's why the breakfast buffet was spot-on). The rest of the resort food was higher than your usual resort food prices and a very poor value. I don't mind paying a resort prices for food if it was worth it. The staff kept trying to steer me away from Mexican/Mayan food towards American fare. Our dinner at the restaraunt (the one near the resort's entrance) was a fiasco. Could it be they were busy with the convention dinner event on the lawn? Multiple missteps and nothing went right- servers MIA and when we finally did get our entrees my husband's fish was cold (icey cold) in the center. The management dealt with the situation eventually but our last night in Mexico ended up being rather frustrating. We hope that the restraunts have gotten their act together because the resort is nice and the spa is wonderfull.

Reviews.Title: “ok, but you need to know a few things”
Reviews.Author: DallasPhotoguy
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for a week, working on a corporate trip. I read most of the reviews before I went and overall, they are fairly accurate. I am sure this resort made total sense when the plans were presented and it photographs very well, but in execution, there are some issues. First the good stuff: Golf course is great. Unlimited fresh water combined with the weather gives you great conditions. Early morning tee time a must. Pools - There are at least five pools and they are all great. Except for one, they are all a long ways from the beach and breeze. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Large rooms that were well serviced. Spa got high marks from our guests, particularly the massages. Now the bad stuff. If you see all the canals in the photos, don't be fooled. The hotel is in the middle of a mangrove swamp and with that you get a lot of bugs. Be prepared. It is very spread out. To get to the beach, you need to take a golf cart or ride a bike. Fun to do in the morning, not so much in the afternoon. Check your bike before you take off. We had a guest that had no brakes and crashed on his first day there. The beach is great, but there is nothing to do. No jet skis, no boats, no floats, no parasail..........nada. If you want to go to a beach and do nothing, this is the place for you. Worst lobby bar in the world. It looks like a lobby but it's also the bar. However, it has no bar and everyone is scattered all over the room. Every night there is live music with a guy playing to an empty room. I've stayed in a hundred hotels and this is the worst bar ever. Rooms have motion detector thermostats. When you go to sleep and stop moving, the AC cuts out. You wake up sweating and when you move, it starts cooling. We couldn't find an override. Last negative.........the refrigerators in the rooms take 8-12 hours to cool a beverage to drinking temperature. When you go to the store on the grounds, all the beverages they sell are hot, even though they are presented in a refrigerated case. So if you want a cold beverage, you have to go to the bar and pay double. Overall, if you want to sit by a pool or on the beach to read a book, nap, and you don't really care what it costs, this is the place for you. More than a couple of days and you will go nuts because, unless there is a large corporate group there, it is virtually deserted.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: freqtrav88
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for three nights during mid-May. This was the largest of three properties we stayed at during our vacation. Yes, I agree that this is a very large property but I tended to see the good in the size. You are easily able to hop on a bike, cart, or even a small boat to get around. We never had a problem accessing transportation. Let's face it, walking is not such a bad thing either. Our room (in one of the casitas) was very pretty, clean, minimal, with the highlight being the bathroom (gorgeous shower and large bathtub). The various pools were immaculate (another reason the large property is a bonus - many pools to select from). Yes, the restuarants were a bit overpriced, but what hotel restuarants are not? I loved the spa and my husband enjoyed the golf course. The spa ammenities are terrific - know that there is a separate pool on the roof. I took a toning class in the gym and the trainer was very helpful. Unfortunately, I do agree on the service - it was certainly lacking to say the least. Not once did anyone offer to help us with towels at the pools and nor walk around and ask if you might be interested in lunch or a drink. It is pretty much a DIY hotel on that end. Also, the service in the restuarants (we went to all except the lobby restaurant) was the same - very slow and inattentive. We expected a better quality of service from a Fairmont property. I do think that once the surrounding resorts open (Mandarin Oriental, Viceroy, Rosewood), they will be forced to step up the service or they will lose clientele. We didn't experience any of the security issues but because we read tripadvsor reviews prior to our trip, we were extremely careful. We also did not see a tarantula - thank goodness! I was very scared by that previous review but think those guests had a fluke experience. I do believe the rates are fair as we did visit during the low season. For the quality of the room and beauty of the property (minus the lousy service), the rates are quite reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Fabuloso!”
Reviews.Author: scesare
Reviews.Content: The hotel and service were incredible. The hotel was amazing and only 10-15 minutes to downtown Play del Carmen. Perfect for my husband and I who dont like to be trapped at an all inclusive hotel and never leave the grounds. We left the hotel almost every night to experience some local culture- although the hotel was so beautiful you dont have to ever leave if you dont want. We had a signature Casita suite and the rooms were beautiful. This hotel is up on the level with other Four Seasons and other 5 star resorts. Planning on returning!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful setting and reasonable value for location”
Reviews.Author: 2boysmomTX
Reviews.Content: We booked a 3 night trip to the Mayakoba to celebrate our wedding anniversary. The hotel is large and spread out. But as most of the rooms are divided into units of 4 "casitas", the resort feels intimate. Pool and beach areas were never crowded even though the hotel was almost at full occupancy during our stay. Bikes and golf carts make getting around the property a breeze. Staff was helpful and courteous. Given the location and accomodation, it was a good value for such a high end resort. The resort golf course and spa were also first rate

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: DLH1959
Reviews.Content: Our family (2 adults, 1 teenager, 1 child) stayed here during a company-sponsored trip. After reading several negative reviews, we were concerned about having an enjoyable stay. Service ... It was warm when we arrived and we were greeted with cold towels and drinks. During an outdoor company event on the lawn, bug spray was offered by the staff. The employees were friendly, especially the gentlemen who operated the golf cart and boat transportation. The employees who ran the kids-club/baby sitting service were very good. Room ... very spacious, even with 2 queen beds and a rollaway bed. We were in the 500 section which is half way between the lobby and beach and near the main pool/La Laguna Grill/Cafe Maya. We used the golf cart transportation to both the lobby and beach each day and rarely waited more than 5 minutes for a ride. We didn't experience any thefts. Whenever we left the room we placed our valuables in the safe, even when we placed the "privacy please" sign on the door. We always double-checked the sliding glass doors to make sure they were locked. Restaurants ... we ate dinner at El Puerto and received very good service. We ate breakfast at La Laguna Grill several mornings. They serve both al a carte and buffet breakfasts. Some days the service was quicker than others. We ate the buffet breakfast at Las Brisas and weren't impressed with the offerings or price. Food and drink service at the main pool were good, but slower on the beach. Cafe Maya offered light breakfast/lunch and drinks/snacks. Pools/Beach ... there are 3 pool areas -- an adult-only pool, the main pool which is broken into several smaller pools (baby area, slide area, jacuzzi area, and infinity pool), and the infinity pool at the beach. Each offers umbrellas, cabanas, and/or palapas. The beach was a decent size and the sand was white. The water was warm and turquoise, but had a lot of seaweed. Final opinion ... the Fairmont Mayakoba is BIG and we believe it is better suited for those looking to relax at the spa/pool/beach or play golf. Since no day or night-time activities are offered, our teenager became bored. We had several cloudy/tropical shower days and there wasn't much to do indoors. We enjoyed our stay, but will not return at our own expense.

Reviews.Title: “Ola!”
Reviews.Author: CompressedChi
Reviews.Content: A lovely property about a half an hour drive south of the Cancun airport and about 10 minutes north of Playa del Carmen. The sprawling property is situated adjacent to a golf club and along the ocean, though the bulk of the property is set back from the water. Check in was efficient, and as Fairmont President's Club members we were upgraded to a suite as well as offered complementary entrance to the spa and 2 for 1 rounds of golf. Walking around the property takes a while since it is so spread out. They do offer trolley service around the property as well as water shuttles to select places and one can use the hotel's bikes to get around, although the walkways are not super wide and can to treacherous to negotiate. The rooms are very new, modern, and clean. Our suite had a living room with patio overlooking the waterway and a distant ocean view, the bedroom had a king bed with additional seating, and there were two full bathrooms in our room. The spa is really spectacular with separate men's and women's sauna, outdoor whirlpool, and steam rooms. The lobby restaurant was pricey and good, but since the food in Playa is so good in general, we felt it was much better to eat in town. The beach is very large, though there were lots of rocks in the ocean so remember to bring your aquasocks. There are several pools--one at the beach and the main one in the middle of the property, which is really a series of smaller pools linked together. Plenty of chairs and towels at both locations. The restaurant at the ocean was perfect for a tasty lunch. Overall we had a very enjoyable stay--pricey but luxe!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation”
Reviews.Author: LBR9
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week's stay at the Fairmont Mayakoba and had a wonderful experience. I should preface my review by stating that we got a very good deal through Expedia for the rooms so I didn't feel we were paying through the nose for a five star hotel. I may have judged it differently had we paid full price. To begin with, transportation from Cancun airport went very smoothly. We arrived at the hotel and checked in without any problems. We were assigned a staff member to assist us to our room and orient us around the hotel. Our room was in the main block nearest the lobby area (cheapest room rate). It was beautiful. As you enter the room there is a small foyer area, a full walk-in closest with a safe, king size bed, nice size balcony with a bench, two chairs and a table - - we had a beautiful view of the swimming pool, gardens, and lagoons. The bathroom is phenomenal - - double sinks, soaking tub, frameless glass shower and a seperate toilet area. The air conditioning and fan were in perfect working order. There is a fridge for use in the credenza. We ate at every restaurant in the hotel. We had dinner the first night at El Puerto which is located in the main lobby. The service was wonderful and the food was good - - however, I didn't feel like there was a very diverse selection. Dinner ran us about $160 USD (no drinks). La Laguna grill, which is located in the middle of the resort, walking distance from our building, was where we had breakfast most mornings. Buffet is about $25 USD per person. If you order ala carte it is still around $15-20. Dinner was very good, had a little more flair in terms of choice compared to El Puerto. Las Brisas is located down at the beach and serves lunch and drinks all day outside and dinner in the evenings. The restaurant at night is beautiful, very elegant, the live music they had was first rate. However, I think the menu was restricted and the dish I ordered was just "ok". Again, Los Angeles prices.
