The following day, we decided to go to the beach, and to our dismay, was told that there were no more beach chairs. After sitting on the sand on a towel,at this "exclusive" resort, we decided to go to the pool, only to find out that they were completely out of towels! The grounds were beautiful, and the staff were all friendly, but clearly they were not well trained or managed. We returned one night after the turn down service, to find that all the dirty towels were still on the bathroom floor. We came back another night, and noted that they left only one bath towel. The room was clean and roomy, but there were many little things that needed fixing, such as the air conditioning, the balcony doors, the safe. The food was decent, but never great, and clearly overpriced. Luckily, we had a rental car, that allowed us to go to far better restaurants at nearby Playa Del Carmen. We enjoyed the stay for the beautiful weather, the great pools, that our children loved, and the beautiful beach, but the hotel really needs better service and management.

Reviews.Title: “More of the same”
Reviews.Author: Radman2
Reviews.Content: I agree with much of the criticism I have read. Just got back yesterday. Spectacular spot, beautiful...bring your fieldglasses if your are a naturalist or birder. The staff are wonderful, intelligent caring and happy people....BUT there are not enough of them!! Room service, for all intents and purposes, is nonexistent. No problem...we went to the Walmart in Playa and bought everything we needed for the week, booze included for a little over 100 USD. The restaurants vary...some fabulous dishes, some not so hot. Any glitches in service have to do with not enough waiters working full houses. Never anyone at the concierge desk. Golf cart transportation throughout the resort excellent and fast. Summary...an amazing spot,,,not up to Fairmont standards for service and dining. Quite expensive. Remember 10 % surcharge for IVF (?) plus 2% accomodation charge PLUS a service charge added on top of the top dollar room rates. If you've got a pile of money and a lot of patience the place is amazing. If not, go to town to eat Recommend Casa D'Agua and Yaxche...both terrific. Stock your fridge with groceries..forget about room service and don't bring a big family. We really had a wonderful time but I can imagine people with higher standards than mine being very upset at the service given the cost of living at the Mayakoba...they have some work to do.

Reviews.Title: “Some people compared it to Four Seasons?”
Reviews.Author: ignor
Reviews.Content: The name Fairmont meant a classy place before I visit this resort. I briefly read reviews and didn't pay too much attention and I never contributed one before, but I am compelled to write one after spending a week there. The ocean is 5 minutes golf cart ride from hotel's main complex , it could have been built just off the beautiful ocean. The path is too long for a casual walk to the beach and often it maybe too hot to walk in the sunny daytime and the walkway is not particulary scenic. There are three restaurants in the hotel and a small one in nearby golf course, to which you have to ride a cart also. None was impressive as 4 or 5 star hotel restaurants, food was mediocre quality at best compared to the price. There are plenty of empty seats always but quite often you have to wait for something instead of seated right away. Beach side restaurant was using the same tablecloth for the next customers. I wanted good Mexican food experience but it was mostly below average American food. I once asked the waiter to order the same dish as the person next table was having while I pointed with the finger, I was served totally different food. (Too bad, but it is hard to blame them because it would be impossible to learn without good traing and experience.) The staffs tried to be friendly, but they are under trained. After I checked in, one staff member accompanied me all the way (I am not sure why she did) to my Deluxe Casita room with Jungle view(actually the view was limited to the path only) but she had to ask other staff members three times on the way to find my room. Only at the end, she told me it was her first day at the job. She showed me that the room has a full bath, a glass shower door and two robes and so on as if guests have to be told. The refrigerator was not working and it took a day to get working one. I didn't report that the scale was not working and it was never repaired until we left, but the housekeeping staffs were doing their best. I want to hear PGA tour players' response. The food, the location and the course. I don't know how they will serve food as I believe they are incapable to handle the volume. The golf course had only one hole with true oceanview. The course, in my opinion, was too plain boringly flat with almost negligible hazards even for a worse- than-bogey player. Yes, the place is isolated from the crowd and quiet but maybe too much so. And at night, you may have nothing to do unless you go out to nearby town. If you are planning a visit, read the reviews. I found the complaints expressed in them are almost all not exaggerated.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous resort, staff overwhelmed-be prepared to wait and plan accordingly.”
Reviews.Author: kljones1
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Dec 26th and left on January 1, 2001 and were greeted with two cranberry cocktails and a wet towel for our face. The resort is breathtaking, and very big and it takes some time to get from one place to another. Our room overlooked the lagoon and was very nice. *Allow some time to get from one place to the other esp. if you have a spa appt or dinner reservation. They have golf carts that will pick you up outside of your room or if you just stand on the path. To get to the beach, we had to wait a while for a cart that wasn't already full. When we got to the beach, there wasn't a chair to be had (at 9:30am). BUT, the beach staff carried chairs down to the beach to accomodate us. The resort was clearly overwhelmed this holiday week and the staff was doing the absolute best they could. *Get to the beach early to get a chair, towels, and cushions or befriend a beach staffer and give him a tip to set you up early in the am. Room service took a very long time two days in a row, so plan accordingly. *The Deli on the property (where everyone tells you to go for everything) is good for gourmet coffee drinks and suntan lotion and that's about it. We went out in Playa del Carmen most nights for dinner and took a cab. *I would recommend John Gray's Place, La Casa De Aqua, and The Glass Bar as they all had outstanding food and service. *If you go to Tulum to see the ruins and don't want to take a bus tour, rent a car and get there by 8:30am and you won't have to stand in line and wait. One day we got there at 11am and the line was over 2 hours long and you cannot pre-order tix unless you're with a bus tour. *If you rent a car from the company that's at the resort, the guy usually doesn't show up (if he does show up) until 9-10am so plan accordingly. We were there over New Year's Eve and the show was amazing and very memorable. They had 4+ Mexican/Cuban bands that were out of this world. *We paid a preminum and were told that no children would be at this event. We also had to buy our own bottle of premium liquor (Grey Goose and Captain Morgan) if we wanted to drink it at the evening event. There were children at the event, even though there was a seperate children's event. All in all, we had a nice, relaxing vacation. Our experience was much better than some other guests that we talked to, so we felt fortunate. We adjusted to their speed and were fine with it. I think next time when we go back, it won't be during a peak time and we'll give them a little while to get settled and trained and wait until the other resorts at Mayakoba are open so you can take the boats over to each one and have more dining options on the property. *Our car to the airport was 50 minutes late (b/c noone showed up for work after New Year's Eve), luckily we planned appropriately and made it to the airport in plenty of time. *We left 2 hours before our flight and were just fine.
